Con los financiamientos que ha logrado en la instituciÃ³n ha aumentado la venta de productos Avon a si como hacer ropa nueva. El cual estÃ¡ contenta porque ha sido de mucho beneficios. Hoy con este prÃ©stamo comprara telas variadas de colores, productos Avon y asÃ­ seguir ofreciendo sus productos y lograr mejores venta. Ya que ha sido de mucho beneficio el trabajar en casa y cuidar mÃ¡s de su esposo, ya que no tiene hijo , y que espera a futuro ser madre.
texts.en:
Basilia is a lady dedicated to her works as a seamstress and saleswoman of cosmetics, business she manages from her home,she is married and her husband is an audio technician.

Previously she worked in the working zone, but she quit in order to set up her own workshop and increase profits as in the working zone work is much and salary is low.

With the loans from the institution she has increased her sales of Avon products as well as the business of new clothes. She is very happy with the many benefits.

With this loan she will buy material in a variety of colors and Avon products to continue offering her products and improve sales. It has been very beneficial working at home and taking care of her husband as she has no children but expects to be a mother in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase material in a variety of colors and Avon products to increase sales and improve profits.

loan.name: Sadith Nicayla

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œVirgen del Rosario del Cuscoâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Sadith Nicayla; ella tiene 29 aÃ±os de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos en un paradero final de carros que hacen servicio pÃºblico y en algunas oportunidades vende comida en las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar productos para preparar los desayunos.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueÃ±o mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Sadith Nicayla, she is 29 years old and a single mother of 1 son. Daily the partner sells breakfasts at a public bus station and eventually she sells food at the fairs in the town of Cusco as well. The partner would like to improve her business. She requests the loan to purchase products for the preparation of breakfasts.

The partner is grateful to the people being part of her dream through this means and she is committed to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The partner requests the loan to purchase products for preparing breakfasts.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 38 aÃ±os de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, especÃ­ficamente en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propio techo a base de adobe. Cuando ella visualizÃ³ las tiendas de abarrotes que tenÃ­an sus vecinas, anhela con tener uno igual, con el paso del tiempo lo logrÃ³, puesto que sus estudios se trucaron debido a la falta econÃ³mica, por lo que solo se dedicaba en ayudar a sus padres en la chacra, a cambio le daba una propina para sus gastos personales. Hoy, con una contenta, siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, incluso cuenta con clientes que van a su establecimiento. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su pareja, su punto de venta lo realiza en su hermoso barrio de su propia localidad. Ella anhela en el futuro mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que le dÃ© un formato distinto a la competencia, de esa manera cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crÃ©dito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, ademÃ¡s estÃ¡ conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderÃ­as de primera necesidad, con el propÃ³sito de que estÃ© surtido su tienda de abarrotes y asÃ­ cumplir con las exigencias de sus clientes mas asiduos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old, she lives with her significant other and has five school-going children. Together they live in the locality of Santa Rosa, specifically on the edge of the Peruvian forest where they have their own adobe made house. When she visualized the general store of her neighbors, she wishes to own one herself and eventually she managed as she did not finish her studies due to economic problems and therefore she only helped her parents with the farm and in exchange they gave her a tip for her personal expenses. Today she is happy as she feels she has succeeded in the first objectives, she even has customers that go to her establishment. Normally she works on her own but ocasionally her children and partner help her. She sells from her beautiful neighborhood. It is her dream for the future to improve her grocery store so it gets a different presentation as the ones of the competition and that way meets the demands of her customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she promises to continue to repay punctullay, she is also happy with her community bank as everybody repays accordingly. With the loan requested she will invest in buying essential merchandise to supply her general store and thus meet the needs of her most regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase supplies for her store.

loan.name: Dativa De La Concepcion

texts.es: Dativa tiene la edad de 56 aÃ±os, mujer trabadora, casada, con dos hijos, hoy en dÃ­a trabaja como tÃ©cnico quirÃºrgico, desde hace treinta y cuatro aÃ±os. Su esposo trabaja en construcciÃ³n y ambos han logrado hacer la casa, mitad de concreto y mitad de madera. Sus entradas econÃ³micas han sido su fuente de entrada, pues inicio estudiando un tÃ©cnico, el cual aplico y hasta hoy ha dado sus servicios al pueblo. Como planes es poder poner una pulperÃ­a ya que entre poco llegara la jubilizacion y desea poder vender en su casa y asÃ­ seguir apoyando a sus hijos. Es su primer ciclo en Afodenic, en donde va invertir en mejoras de vivienda haciendo un cuarto el cual comprara materiales de construcciÃ³n como: piedra, arena, cemento, perlines, zinc, soldadura, clavos, pintura entre otros para construir. Y hace lograr mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dativs is 56 years old, a working lady, married with two children. Presently she has been working as a surgical technician for thirty-four years. Her husband works in construction and both have succeeded in building the house, half concrete and half wood.

Their salary has been their source of income as she started to study for becoming a technician and now she offers her services in the village. Her plans are to set up a grocery store as she will retire shortly and wishes to be able to sell from her house and thus continue supporting her children.

It is her first loan with Afodenic, and she will invest in improving her dwelling, building a room and therefore she needs to buy building matieral such as rock, sand, cement, purlins, zinc, welding, nails, paint etc. for the construction, and thus improve the living conditions.,

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rock, sand, cement, purlins, zinc,welding, nails, paint, etc.to improve her house.

loan.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio pertenece al Banco Comunal Pureza hace 8 meses. Rocio es soltera, tiene 26 aÃ±os y 1 hijo, vive en casa alquilada, Rocio tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, tiene 3 personas que le ayudan en la preparaciÃ³n y atenciÃ³n, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as, negocio que inicio hace 2 aÃ±os, ademÃ¡s Rocio vende salchipapas en la noches. Rocio necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1500 soles para la compra de ollas y platos. Los sueÃ±os de Rocio son implementar una polleria y abrir una sucursal en la provincia de Huanta.
texts.en:
RociÃ³, 26, has been a member of the Pureza (Purity) communal bank for 8 months. She is single and has a son. She lives in a rented house. RociÃ³ has a restaurant in a rented locale. She has three employees that help prepare the food and provide customer service. She is open for business every day. She started the business 2 years ago. In addition, she sells Salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages) at night. RociÃ³ needs a 1500 sol loan to buy pots and dishes. Her dream is to open up a poultry shop and a branch in Huanta province.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy pots and dishes.

loan.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Rosa viaja los dÃ­as sÃ¡bados y domingos a la feria del Distrito de Tambo en donde vende frutas, canchas y de allÃ¡ compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Rosa tenia una tienda de lubricantes en local alquilado, negocio que dejo de realizar porque termino el contrato de local, pero aun sigue vendiendo sus productos a pedido, Rosa tiene proyectado construir un local propio para vender sus productos. Rosa solicita un prÃ©stamo de 900 soles para la compra de maÃ­z y frutas.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has 4 children. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes to the Tambo District market to sell fruit and corn nuts (roasted corn kernels). From there she brings back cereals to sell in Ayacuchoâ€™s wholesale foodstuffs market. Rosa used to have a vehicle lubricants store in a rented space but she left it when her rental contract for the location expired. However, she continues to sell these products by special order. Rosa plans to build her own structure to sell her products. She needs a 900 sol loan to buy corn and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy corn and fruit.

loan.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 27 aÃ±os de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene una hija; Heyde de 7 aÃ±os. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propio techo a base de adobe. El negocio al que se dedica Sonia, es la venta de ladrillos, por el cual ella misma lo elabora, es un trabajo al que tuvo que esforzarse mucho para sacarlo adelante. Se siente contenta y satisfecha por el proyecto del cual iniciÃ³, pues tiene mucha presencia en su localidad, debido a la calidad y durabilidad de sus ladrillos, incluso sus clientes mas recurrentes estÃ¡n conformes por el buen servicio y entrega eficiente que les brinda, ademÃ¡s sus ventas aumentaron considerablemente con respecto a otros meses. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, en ocasiones cuando tiene que aumentar su producciÃ³n, es ese momento que contrata peones para que le pueda facilitar la elaboraciÃ³n de sus ladrillos. Su plan futuro es levantar su casa a base de material noble, con el propÃ³sito de que les brinde la seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su quinto crÃ©dito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, ademÃ¡s estÃ¡ contenta con su banco comunal, ya que todos estÃ¡n comprometidos con sus obligaciones de pago. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima e insumos, de esa manera lo facilite en la elaboraciÃ³n de sus ladrillos de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Sonia, 27, lives with her life partner and their 7-year-old daughter, Hayde. They live in Santa Rosa where they have their own adobe house. Soniaâ€™s business is selling bricks that she herself makes. This is a business that she had to work very hard to get ahead. She is happy and satisfied with the project she started because now she has quite a bit of presence in her area thanks to the quality and durability of her bricks. In fact, her most recurring customers are satisfied with the good service and efficient delivery she provides. Her sales increased significantly compared to other months. Usually she works with her partner and together they make a good working team. Sometimes, when she needs to increase production, she will hire laborers to facilitate brick making. Her future plan is to build her house out of more substantial materials in order to provide her family with more comfort and security. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. She is happy with her communal bank because all the members are committed to pay on time. The requested funds will be used to buy raw materials and supplies that will make artisanal brick making easier.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy raw brick making raw materials.

loan.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines es socia del Banco Comunal Pureza. Ines es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Ines tiene un lavadero de carros en su casa, actividad que inicio hace 2 aÃ±os, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as. Ines sueÃ±a con tener una tienda de lubricantes, lo cual complementaria al negocio que ya tiene. Ines necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1000 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de champÃº y escoba. Ines sueÃ±a que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
InÃ©s is a member of the Pureza (Purity) communal bank. Sheâ€™s married and has 6 children 5 of whom are in school. InÃ©s has a carwash at home, a business she started two years ago. She is open for business every day. She dreams with owning a vehicle lubricant store which would complement her current business. InÃ©s needs a 1000 sol loan to buy shampoo and a broom She dreams with her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy shampoo and a broom.

loan.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 40 aÃ±os de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. El vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Teofilo asegura que el producto de cacao se ha convertido en los Ãºltimos aÃ±os en un gran negocio, desde luego que estÃ¡ sacando el mÃ¡ximo provecho a sus plantaciones hasta llegÃ³ al punto de comprar productos de cacao de otros productores, con la finalidad de que pueda cumplir con sus compromisos de entrega para sus clientes. Por tal motivo, sus clientes se sienten en confianza, por el buen servicio que les otorga, ademÃ¡s percibe buenas ganancias econÃ³micas, por lo que siente gran satisfacciÃ³n por el negocio que realiza. Cada aÃ±o va tomando presencia en su localidad, de esta manera trata de mejorar en cuanto a la cantidad y calidad de su producto. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de sembrÃ­o y cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones, con la finalidad de que recolecten el producto final. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Mas adelante piensa mejorar su casa a base de material noble, con el propÃ³sito de brindarle estabilidad a su familia. Este es su quinto crÃ©dito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, ademÃ¡s siente que llegarÃ¡ lo mas lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos estÃ¡n conformen por el buen manejo de su grupo. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con la necesidad de prevenir futuras enfermedades a sus plantaciones de cacao, de esa manera no perjudique su productividad.
texts.en:
TeÃ³filo, 40, lives with his life partner; they have three school age children. They live in Santa Rosa in their own adobe house. TeÃ³filo assures us that cacao production has become a very profitable enterprise in the last few years. He is getting the most profit out of his crops and even had to buy from other producers in order to fill all his orders. His customers trust him thanks to the good service he provides and he makes good profits so he is very satisfied with his work. Every year he becomes better positioned in his community and he constantly strives to improve both the quality and quantity of his product. He usually works alongside his partner but during planting and harvesting he needs help from laborers in order to bring in the final harvest. His sales point is the local gathering centers. He works daily from 7am until 6pm. Later on he plans to rebuild his house using substantial materials to provide more stability for his family. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. He feels that he will get as far as possible with his communal bank because everyone is very satisfied with the groupâ€™s performance. The requested funds will be used to buy manure and supplies to prevent future plant illnesses in his crops so that productivity wonâ€™t be adversely affected.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy manure for his cacao crops.

loan.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella y lo que mas le agrada son las charlas de cÃ³mo invertir su dinero. Yanet es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 7 aÃ±os que estudia y vive en casa alquilada, Yanet tiene un restaurante en una avenida transitada, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as con la ayuda de 1 personal, ademÃ¡s Yanet vende bebidas. Yanet solicita un crÃ©dito de 1000 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido para la decoraciÃ³n del local y la compra de gaseosa. Yanet sueÃ±a con tener una casa y otro restaurante.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Anabella communal bank. What she likes most about it are the talks on how to invest your money. She has a live-in partner and a seven-year-old son who goes to school. She lives in a rented house. Yanet has a restaurant on a busy avenue. She is open for business every day and has one staff person. She also sells beverages. Yanet is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy soft drinks and to decorate the restaurant. She dreams with owning a house and having another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To decorate the space and buy soft drinks.

loan.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Rosa Amelia L. es socia del banco comunal La Inmaculada, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, es de clima friÃ³ tÃ­pico de la regiÃ³n sierra, su poblaciÃ³n se dedican en su mayor parte a la crÃ­a de animales y a la agricultura y mucha de su gente tambiÃ©n trabaja realizando varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.
DoÃ±a Rosa trabaja realizando los quehaceres domÃ©sticos, su horario es de ocho y media de la maÃ±ana hasta las cuatro y media de la tarde, de lunes a viernes laborando desde que tenÃ­a una muy corta edad ya que solo llego a cursar la escuela. TambiÃ©n en su casa se dedica a la crÃ­a de animales pequeÃ±os como: cuyes, gallinas y chanchos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.
La SeÃ±ora. Rosa tiene 33 aÃ±os, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 aÃ±os de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamÃ¡.
Nuestra socia estÃ¡ en su tercer crÃ©dito, el dinero de su crÃ©dito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
Su meta es ofrecerles a sus hijos la mejor educaciÃ³n para que puedan llegar lejos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Amelia L. is a member of the La Inmaculada (Immaculate Conception) communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca which is part of Santa Ana parish. Its climate is cold, typical of the mountains. Most of its population raises animals and are farmers. Many of its residents work at various jobs in the city of Cuenca. Rosa works as a domestic employee from 8:30am until 4:30pm, Monday through Friday. She has worked since a very young age because she only went to primary school. She also raises small farm animals, like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs at home that she sells when needs arise. Rosa is 33 years old and a single mother of four children who are 12, 10, 8 and 6 years of age; all are in school. She does not own her own house; she lives in her motherâ€™s house. This is her 3rd loan. She will use it to buy chickens and feed for them. Her goal is to provide her children with an education so they can go far in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys junto a su esposo se dedican a L. venta D. bebidas al por mayor y menor, su negocio esta ubicado en local alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en L. tienda y tambiÃ©n reparte a negocios con un carro que adquiriÃ³ hace 3 meses, antes repartÃ­a con carros alquilados. Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza hace 1 aÃ±o y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones y L. confianza entre las socias. Gladys es conviviente tiene 3 hijos D. 10, 7, 3 aÃ±os. Su sueÃ±o es tener una distribuidora granD. y tener un local propio. Gladys solicita un crÃ©dito D. 2500 soles para L. compra D. gaseosas y cerveza.
texts.en:
Gladys and her husband are beverage wholesalers and retailers. Their business is located in a rented space. They sell from the store and also deliver to other stores using a car she bought three months ago; she used to make her deliveries using leased cars. Gladys has been a member of the Confianza (Trust) communal bank for a year. What she likes best about it are the meetings and the trust that exists among the members. Gladys is partnered and they have three children who are 10, 7 and 3 years of age. Her dream is to have a large distributorship and to own her own locale. She is asking for a 2500 sol loan to buy soft drinks and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy soft drinks and beer.

loan.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella hace 4 aÃ±os y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones y los prestamos fÃ¡ciles. Maria es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, ademÃ¡s Maria tiene cabinas de Internet en el mismo lugar, la administraciÃ³n de estos negocios los realiza sola. AdemÃ¡s Maria prepara chocotejas que vende a pedido. Maria necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1750 soles para la compra de arroz, azÃºcar. Maria sueÃ±a con tener una bodega grande, ser mayorista y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a has been a member of the Anabella communal bank for 4 years. What she likes best about it are the meetings and the fuss-free loans. She is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom are students. MarÃ­a has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries, vegetables and meats. In addition, she also has Internet access booths there. She runs both businesses by herself. She also makes "chocotejas" on order [A teja is a candy filled with "manjarblanco" (a sweet, white spread or pastry filling made with milk) and coated with a fondant-like shell. When this shell is made with chocolate, the candy is called chocoteja] MarÃ­a needs a 1750 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. She dreams with having a large store, with being a wholesaler, and with having her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 38 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo JosÃ© de 65 aÃ±os, y de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son mayores e independientes. La vida para esta emprendedora mujer no ha sido fÃ¡cil, pues desde que se casÃ³ muy joven debiÃ³ cuidar de sus hijos, ahora que estÃ¡n grandes y ya no tiene mucha responsabilidad quiere instalar un negocio para salir adelante. Siempre le ha ayudado a trabajar a su conyugue, y por eso ahora quiere mandar a restaurar su casa y acondicionar una librerÃ­a, pues por la zona donde vive no hay un negocio de ese rubro. Dice que el trabajo de su esposo, que tiene su taller de renovaciÃ³n de calzados, siempre les ha permitido tener una vida cÃ³moda y brindarles una buena educaciÃ³n a sus hijos, por ello cree que con este nuevo negocio podrÃ¡ darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es el segundo crÃ©dito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ empezar a concretar sus sueÃ±os. Juana tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la instalaciÃ³n de agua y desagÃ¼e en su casa, ya que no cuenta con este servicio; ademÃ¡s tambiÃ©n quiere acondicionar un ambiente para empezar con el negocio de librerÃ­a, por lo que espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, lives in her own house with her husband, JosÃ©, 65, and their five children, three of whom are independent adults. Life for this enterprising woman has not been easy because since marrying very young she has had to care for her children. Now that they are grown and she doesnâ€™t have a lot of responsibilities she wants to open a business to get ahead. She has always helped her spouse work but now she wants to refurbish her house and set up a bookstore because in the area where she lives there are no similar businesses. She says that her husbandâ€™s work (he has a shoe repair shop) has always provided a comfortable life and a good education for their children so she feels that this new business will provide the family with a better quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will make it possible to have her dream come true. Juana plans to use the requested funds to install running water and drainage in her house because it currently lacks then both. She also wants to equip a space in it to set up her bookstore with which she hopes to continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy supplies to install running water and drainage in her house as well as to equip a space to install her book store.

loan.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery pertenece al Banco Comunal Anabella hace 10 aÃ±os y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones. Mery es soltera, tiene 1 hija de 3 aÃ±os que esta en el nido, Mery viaja a las ferias en donde vende abarrotes en general, ademÃ¡s Mery vende ropa usada en la feria de San Juan los dÃ­as domingos, la ropa lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Mery solicita un crÃ©dito de 1250 soles para la compra de ropa, arroz y azÃºcar. Los sueÃ±os de Mery son comprar una casa porque actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Mery has been a member of the Anabella communal bank for 10 years. What she enjoys most are the training workshops. Mery is single and has a 3 year old daughter who is in child care. Mery travels to the various markets to sell groceries. She also sells used clothes in the San Juan Market on Sundays. She brings the clothes from Lima. Mery is asking for a 1250 sol loan to buy clothes, rice and sugar. Meryâ€™s dream is to buy a house because she currently lives in her parentsâ€™ house and that her daughter becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy clothes, rice and sugar.

loan.name: Donatilda

texts.es: Donatilda es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia, Donatilda tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del cementerio, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as desde la maÃ±ana hasta la noche, ademÃ¡s en el mismo local tiene su polleria, cuenta con el apoyo de 3 personas, tambiÃ©n tiene otro pequeÃ±o restaurante en otro lugar que es administrado por su hija. Dontilda es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella y solicita un crÃ©dito de 2000 soles para la compra de cerveza y gaseosa. Donatilda vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueÃ±o es comprar su casa y que el ultimo de sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Donatilda is married and has four children only one of whom is still in school. She has a restaurant in a rented locale near the cemetery. She is open daily from morning till night. She also has a poultry shop in the same locale. She has three staff persons that help her. She also has another small restaurant that her daughter runs. Donatilda is member of the Anabella communal bank and is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy beer and soft drinks. Donatilda lives in a rented house and her greatest wish is to buy a house and that the youngest of her children becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loan.name: Ker

texts.es: Ker, de 66 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de su hijo mayor de edad y juntos habitan una amplia morada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Este simpÃ¡tico caballero se dedica a la preparaciÃ³n de comida tÃ­pica de la selva peruana en su restaurante, ubicado en el interior de su vivienda. Dice que aprendiÃ³ desde muy joven a preparar estos deliciosos potajes de la selva del PerÃº, ya que ahÃ­ fue donde naciÃ³, y luego le ha transmitido sus conocimientos culinarios a su hijo, quien le ayuda en la atenciÃ³n del negocio. Recuerda como debiÃ³ migrar a la ciudad, pues allÃ¡ en su tierra no le iba muy bien, entonces decidiÃ³ venir y ahora no se arrepiente, pues aunque extraÃ±a su tierra, en el negocio le va muy bien, pues las ganancias son regulares y junto con su hijo esta saliendo adelante. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar mÃ¡s su negocio, para ofrecer mayor cantidad de platillos a sus comensales. Es el cuarto crÃ©dito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando. Ker tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando sus platillos de la selva.
texts.en:
Ker, 66, lives in his own house with his oldest son. They have an ample abode in a crowded neighborhood in the north of the city. This likable gentleman prepares typical dishes from the Peruvian jungle in his restaurant located inside his home. He says he learned how to prepare these delicious dishes from the Peruvian jungle, which is where he was born, while still very young. He has since transmitted his culinary knowledge to his son who helps him tend the business. He recalls how he had to migrate to the city because in his place of origin he wasnâ€™t doing too well. He decided to come to the city and he does not regret it because, although he misses his homeland, he does well with his business because profits are steady and he and his son are getting ahead. Because heâ€™s quite an enterprising man he plans to expand his business later on in order to offer a wider variety of dishes to his diners. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because heâ€™s very grateful to all those how funded the loan that will allow him to continue in business. Ker plans to use the requested funds to buy quantities of the ingredients he needs to continue to prepare his dishes from the jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ingredients to prepare his typical stews.

loan.name: Musuq Rumi Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva piedra en quechua inicia el ciclo 20 con 19 socias. Como es el caso D. L. seÃ±ora Esperanza que es socia hace algunos aÃ±os y actualmente es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal, Esperanza fue presidenta en 3 oportunidades, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian. Esperanza venD. leÃ±a en su casa, negocio que realiza todos los dÃ­as, L. leÃ±a lo compra D. los productores.. Esperanza solicita un prÃ©stamo D. 400 soles para L. compra D. leÃ±a. Esperanza sueÃ±a con que sus hijos salgan adelante estudiando una profesiÃ³n.
texts.en:
The Musuq Rumi, which means New Stone in Quechua, communal bank is starting its 20th cycle with 19 members. Esperanza has been a member for several years and now is the group President. She has been President on three occasions. Sheâ€™s married and has three children who are in school. Esperanza sells firewood at home every day; she buys the firewood from producers. She is asking for a 400 sol loan to buy firewood. Esperanza dreams that her children get ahead studying a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy firewood.

loan.name: Martha Adriana

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora. Martha Adriana L. es socia del banco comunal La Inmaculada, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia Santa Ana, es de clima friÃ³ tÃ­pico de la regiÃ³n sierra, su poblaciÃ³n se dedican en su mayor parte a la crÃ­a de animales y a la agricultura y mucha de su gente tambiÃ©n trabaja realizando varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.
La SeÃ±ora Martha es muy joven tiene 21 aÃ±os, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 aÃ±os de edad, su esposo labora como chofer de un camiÃ³n, los dos realizan su mayor esfuerzo ya que se encuentran construyendo su casa.
DoÃ±a Martha se dedica a la limpieza de hogares, trabaja de lunes a viernes, no tiene un horario fijo y lleva realizando esta actividad hace 2 aÃ±os, en su casa se dedica a la crÃ­a de pollos, chanchos y cuyes.
Es socia de la banca comunal, los crÃ©ditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crÃ©dito lo va a utilizar en la compra de materiales para la construcciÃ³n de su casa como: cemento, arena, etc.
Su meta es terminar su casa y ponerse una tienda en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Adriana L. is a member of the La Inmaculada (Immaculate Conception) communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca which is part of Santa Ana parish. Its climate is cold, typical of the mountains. Most of the population is into farming and animal raising. Many of its residents work a variety of jobs in the city of Cuenca. Martha, 21, is very young. Sheâ€™s married and has 2 children who are 4 and 3 years of age. Her husband is a truck driver. Both work hard because they are building their house. Martha works cleaning houses. She works Monday to Friday. She doesnâ€™t have a fixed work schedule and has been in this line of work for 2 years. At home she raises chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She is a member of the communal bank. The loans have benefited her business. The new loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies for her house construction like: cement, sand, etc. Her goal is to finish building her house and installing a store in it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sand, iron rods, cement, etc.

loan.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 49 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su esposa Cerila de 44 aÃ±os, y de sus 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores. Desde hace 4 aÃ±os se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en una combi, negocio en el cual labora a lado de su hijo mayor. Es asÃ­ que ambos, realizan un mejor servicio de transporte, en donde a veces se turnan, Ã©l maneja y su hijo cobra, o al revÃ©s. Manifiesta que le va muy bien pues las ganancias les permiten tener una vida cÃ³moda, aunque es un poco tedioso manejar durante casi todo los dÃ­as, y eso es estresante, pero sabe que solo con el trabajo constante saldrÃ¡ adelante, ademÃ¡s se entretiene. La combi, que es su herramienta de trabajo aÃºn no es de su propiedad, pues un familiar que viajÃ³ al extranjero se la vendiÃ³, y desde entonces la paga por partes. Como es un hombre muy trabajador para mÃ¡s adelante tiene planeado instalar un negocio que le permita descansar un poco y pasar mÃ¡s tiempo en su hogar. Es el quinto crÃ©dito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando. Santos tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de 4 llantas para cambiar las que tiene su combi pues estÃ¡n algo deterioradas, de esta manera espera brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Cerila, age 44, and their three children, two of whom are adults. For the past four years he has been providing transportation services using a minibus. He manages this business with his oldest son. Both of them work together to provide better service. They take turns driving and collecting bus fare. Santos says his business is doing well and the earnings have allowed him to have a comfortable life. However, it is a little bit tedious to be driving almost every day. Even though the work can be stressful, he knows that this is the only way for him to get ahead so he keeps himself entertained. Santos did not originally own the minibus he uses for work. It belonged to a relative who traveled abroad, but was later sold to Santos. Since then, he pays to have the parts replaced. Being a hardworking gentleman who wants to get ahead even further, Santos plans to open a business that will allow him to relax and spend more time at home.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Santos promises to complete his payments on time because he does not want to disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that he could continue working. He plans to invest this loan in the purchase of four tires to replace the ones on his minibus that are already worn. This will enable him to provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase four tires

loan.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 32 aÃ±os, vive en la casa de sus padres en compaÃ±Ã­a de ellos y de su esposo JosÃ© de 28 aÃ±os y de su pequeÃ±a hija Abril de 3 aÃ±os. Esta emprendedora mujer trabaja desde muy joven, cada dÃ­a se despierta con muchos Ã¡nimos de salir adelante. Es asÃ­ que desde hace 5 aÃ±os se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de diversos productos para el hogar, como cubrecamas, platos, utensilios de cocina, jarrones, entre otros. Realiza su labor sola, dejando un dÃ­a, durante las maÃ±anas y tardes, pues no descuida la crianza de su hijo, pero lo que no le gusta es caminar, durante varias horas en busca de clientes, por el centro de la ciudad, que es el lugar por donde trabaja. Pero esta muy satisfecha porque obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los diversos gastos del hogar. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Es el segundo crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere atrasarse y decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Betty tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercaderÃ­a para ofrecer variedad a su clientela a precios cÃ³modos, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and lives at her parentsâ€™ house with her husband JosÃ©, age 28, and their three year old daughter Abril. She has been a hard worker ever since she was a young woman. Each day she wakes up with great optimism to get ahead. For the past five years she has been selling different household products as a street vendor. Betty offers bedspreads, dishes, cookware, vases, and other items. She works by herself in the mornings and evenings so that she does not neglect the care of her daughter. However, she does not like walking around for several hours looking for customers within the central part of the city where she works. Betty is very pleased because she generates a steady income that allows her to help her husband with the various household expenses. Since she is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead even further, Betty plans to open a bazaar where she can offer her merchandise in a more peaceful environment.

This is her second loan with MFP. Betty promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to fall behind and disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest this loan in a larger quantity of merchandise so that she can offer variety to her customers at affordable prices. In this manner, she hopes to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a variety of household products

loan.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a D. su madre, D. su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieta, todos muy unidos habitan en un populoso barrio al norte D. la ciudad. DesD. hace 1 aÃ±o esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta D. mueble D. madera como estantes, vitrinas, camas, y esta ubicado en la parte D. afuera D. su casa. Dice que se le ocurriÃ³ instalar este negocio, pues la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido captar buenos clientes en poco tiempo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo considera tranquilo y rentable, porque aunque atienD. sola cuenta con la ayuda D. su hijo o nuera. Cada vez tiene mayor variedad D. muebles que ofrecer a su clientela que la visita con frecuencia, por el buen acabado y calidad D. su mercaderÃ­a. AdemÃ¡s como es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchos planes en mente, para mÃ¡s adelante quiere ampliar y acondicionar un ambiente D. su casa para tener mayor espacio, D. esta manera espera ofrecer mÃ¡s cantidad D. muebles. Es el noveno crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando. Dolores tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. juegos D. mesas y sillas, ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, y asÃ­ calcula que obtendrÃ¡ mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolores lives in her own home with her mother, her oldest son, her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter. They resiD. together in a very crowded neighborhood located north of the city. For the past year this enterprising woman has been selling wooden furniture such as shelving, cabinets, and beds. Her business is located just outsiD. of her house. Dolores says that since starting her business, the area where she lives has experienced more commercial activity, which has allowed her to attract good customers over time. She greatly enjoys her work because it is peaceful and profitable. Dolores manages the business by herself, but she also has the help of her son and daughter-in-law. She always has a wiD. variety of furniture to offer to her customers who visit her frequently. The merchandise she sells is of good workmanship and high quality. Being an enterprising woman, Dolores has many plans in mind. Later on she wants to expand and equip her house so that she can have more space in hopes of offering more furniture.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Dolores promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to lose the trust of everyone who maD. this loan possible so that she can continue working. She has plans to invest the funds in the purchase of a large quantity of dining sets (tables and chairs) since she has several orders to fulfill. This will allow her to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase dining sets (tables & chairs) to complete her customers' orders

loan.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula tiene 49 aÃ±os D. edad, es separada desD. hace 10 aÃ±os y vive junto a sus hijos en el sector Guaraguaos, una zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrÃ­cola caracterizado por dedicarse principalmente al cultivo D. frutas, las cuales son procesadas para exportarlas. El distrito pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la regiÃ³n del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la regiÃ³n Lambayeque.
La necesidad D. sacar adelante a su familia hizo que empezara un negocio D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes que se encuentra instalado en su propio domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo D. productos D. uso diario por los cuales tendrÃ­an que dirigirse hacia el pueblo D. TambogranD. para adquirirlos. Adicionalmente crÃ­a y venD. ganado ovino y aves D. corral para venderlas a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donD. vive.
Ursula se esfuerza diariamente para sacar adelante a su familia, por ello siempre se esfuerza en brindarles a sus clientes productos D. calidad y un buen trato. Sus esfuerzos estÃ¡n dando resultados y su clientela aumenta cada vez mas. Para satisfacer la creciente demanda por su negocio ha creÃ­do conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. productos para ampliar su negocio.
Ursula es una mujer trabajadora, diariamente se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Ursula is 49 years old, has been separated for 10 years and lives with her children in Guaraguaos, a rural zone in the district of TambogranD., an agricultural area known for growing fruits for exportation. The district belongs to the province of Piura and is located in the region of Piura, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Ursula began her business selling basic goods and groceries in order to help her family get ahead. The business is located in her home. Ursula offers her neighbors all types of daily use products which they would ordinarily have to travel to the town of TambogranD. to get. She also raises and sells sheep and poultry to sell to businessmen that are present in the area where she lives. Ursula makes an effort each day to help her family get ahead. For this reason, she also makes an effort to offer her clients high quality products and good service. Her efforts are bringing results and her clientele is increasing more and more. To satisfy the growing demand, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying products to expand her business. Ursula is a hardworking woman. Each day she makes an effort to help her children get ahead and to offer them a better quality of life. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy basic goods to expand her business

loan.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 2 aÃ±os y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fÃ¡ciles y el incentivo al ahorro. Felicitas es casada tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Felicitas se dedica a la crianza de animales en su casa como gallina, cuy y lo vende en su misma casa porque ya tiene clientes. AdemÃ¡s viaja a las ferias los dÃ­as sÃ¡bados en donde compra quesos y cereales. Felicitas tambiÃ©n trabaja por las maÃ±anas cuidando una huerta de flores. Felicitas necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1500 soles para la compra de cerdo y gallinas. Felicitas sueÃ±a con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, communal bank for two years. What she enjoys most about it are the fuss-free loans and the savings incentives. Felicitas is married and has five children who are in school. She raises small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at home. She sells them directly from home because she already has customers. She also travels to markets on Saturdays where she buys cheeses and cereals. During the mornings, Felicitas works caring for a flower orchard. She needs a 1500 sol loan to buy a pig and chickens. She dreams with her children becoming professionals and with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a pig and chickens.

loan.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria luz es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Maria luz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, negocio que inicio hace 3 aÃ±os y realiza con la ayuda de su hija. AdemÃ¡s Maria luz trabaja en un hotel haciendo limpieza por las maÃ±anas. Maria luz es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua y lo que mas le agrada son las charlas sobre familia. Maria luz solicita un prÃ©stamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz y azÃºcar. Maria luz sueÃ±a con tener una tienda grande en el centro de la ciudad y construir su casa de material noble porque actualmente su casa es de material rustico.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Luz is married and has two children who are university students. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries and vegetables. She started the business three years ago and her daughter helps her tend to it. In addition, she is employed at a hotel as a cleaning lady during the mornings. MarÃ­a Luz is a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua. What she enjoys most are the chats on the family. MarÃ­a Luz is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. She dreams with having a large store downtown and with building her house out of substantial materials because itâ€™s currently made of flimsy materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loan.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es: Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 10 aÃ±os y lo que mas le agrada son la facilidad de prestamos y el incentivo del ahorro, Silvia con sus ahorros techo su casa y ahora sigue construyendo su casa. Silvia es separada y tiene 1 hijo que estudia, Silvia compra cereales en el mercado que luego los procesa en su casa y luego lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad. AdemÃ¡s los dÃ­as domingos compra animales que luego comercializa. Silvia necesita un prÃ©stamo de 1200 soles dinero que serÃ¡ invertido en la compra de cerdos y cereales. Los sueÃ±os de Silvia son terminar de construir su casa porque ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Silvia has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, communal bank for 10 years. What she enjoys most are the loans and savings incentives. Silvia was able to roof her house with her savings and she is continuing to build her house. Silvia is separated and has a son in school. She buys cereals in the market that she processes at home for later resale in the cityâ€™s markets. On Sundays she buys animals that she later resells. Silvia needs a 1200 sol loan to buy pigs and cereals. Her dream is to finish building her house because she currently lives with her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy pigs and cereals.

loan.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 14 aÃ±os y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro. Catalina es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos que estudia, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los dÃ­as con la ayuda eventual de su hija. Catalina solicita un prÃ©stamo de 1000 soles para la compra de azÃºcar, arroz, fideo y leche. Los sueÃ±os de Catalina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Catalina has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, for 14 years. What she enjoys most are the training workshops and the savings incentives. Catalina lives with her life partner and she has three children in school. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells vegetables, fruits and assorted groceries every day with occasional help from her daughter. Catalina is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy sugar, rice, pasta and milk. Her dreams are that her children become professional and to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta and milk.

loan.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un padre de familia de 35 aÃ±os de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Los Higos, una zona rural ubicada en la carretera en San JosÃ©, un distrito pesquero que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica desde hace diez aÃ±os a brindar transporte de carga en un camiÃ³n. El ofrece sus servicios a sus vecinos agricultores los cuales acuden a el cada vez que necesitan llevar los productos que cosechan a venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y aves de corral. Con estas dos actividades se encarga de solventar los gastos de su familia y sacarlos adelante.
Guillermo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crÃ©dito de 1700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparaciÃ³n de su vehÃ­culo asimismo en la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversion el piensa ampliar sus negocios para percibir mas ingresos y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Guillermo es bastante conocido y estimado en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos le consideran alguien responsable y tranquilo. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior que les garantice un futuro estable.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 35, is a father living with his wife and two children in Los Higos, a rural area along the San JosÃ© highway. This is a fishing area that is part of Lambayeque province located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 10 years he has provided cargo transportation services in a truck. He offers his services to area farmers who call on him every time they need to move their harvests to market. In addition, he also raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl for sale. These two activities make it possible for him to support his family and get them ahead. Guillermo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1700 new sol, loan to invest in vehicle repair and maintenance as well as in the purchase of more animals and feed for them. This investment will expand his business so that he can earn more and provide his family with improved quality of life. Guillermo is quite well known and esteemed in his area. His neighbors consider him to be responsible and level headed. His greatest wish is to offer his children the opportunity to study a career that will guarantee a stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For truck repair and maintenance.

loan.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Bayarjargal G., a 41-year-old divorced woman, lives with her three children in their own ger (a traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongoliaâ€™s capital city. Her middle daughter, Azzaya, attends a university and her youngest daughter studies at a secondary school. Her oldest, a son, works as a dancer for a government organization. Bayarjargal operates a retail clothing business. She began her business in 2003 and operates it out of a stall in Narantuul, Ulaanbaatarâ€™s largest outdoor market. She imports new clothes from Erlian, a border city of China, and from Beejin, China's capital city, once a month. Her business is a popular spot in the market. Bayarjargal plans to expand her business by increasing her working capital for the peak season for sales. She hopes to renovate her house using her business earnings. Bayarjargal is requesting a 2,135,000 tugrik loan to buy more clothes and grow her working capital.

loan.use: To buy more clothes

loan.name: Mela

texts.en: Mela P. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Kalawaig, Banisilan, Cotabato. Mela has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Mela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Mela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loan.name: Merlyn

To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.
In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Merlynâ€™s 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.
About HSPFI:

He is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Henryâ€™s 5th loan from HSPFI. loan.name: Julie Jane

loan.name: Rose Ann

Rose Ann A. is from the village of Kinura, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old, married, and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rose Ann owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorsikad (a motorcycle with a sidecar) services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years, and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.
In 2010, Rose Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase materials needed to provide her service. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. This will be Rose Annâ€™s 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

Darlyn P. is from the village of Kinura, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old, married, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Darlyn owns & operates a service-based business. loan.name: Gracelda

texts.en:
Gracelda M. is from the village of West Poblacion, in Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gracelda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products, such as lotions and shampoos from different suppliers, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

loan.name: Emerita's Group

texts.en:
Emerita E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 57 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Emerita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store selling household items (such as canned goods) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $68 a month for these activities.
In 2009, Emerita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional stock needed. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

To make a living, she makes and sells snacks such as juice, pancit (noodles), banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with carmelized brown sugar) and others to the local members of the community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loan.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma belongs to a small city called Raiwind which is famous for its dairy and agriculture industries. She is 29 years old and married. She has given birth to four-year-old Adiba and one-year-old Mariam, both of whom are very young and have not started to attend school yet.
Najma is a very hardworking and caring lady. She takes care of her family and manages the household chores. She also handles her clothes sewing business after doing the household chores. She sews clothes for her neighbors. She is good at her work and gets regular orders. She does this work to financially support her family.
She is married to A. R., who is 34 years old and operates a laundry business in the market. He is renting a shop for that purpose. He has been operating this business for the last ten years. He also sells washing items such as bleach powder, Surf detergents and washing soaps in his shop and also uses them to wash the clothes in his laundry.
Naima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husbandâ€™s business. With the loan money her husband will buy the above mentioned laundry items for his laundry shop. Najma has confidence in her husband that he will be able to successfully upgrade his business by making positive use of the loan money. She is a regular Asasah loan user and has maintained a good credit record. This is her 4th loan application.

loan.use: Purchase washing items for laundry shop

loan.name: Le

texts.en:
Le L., 54 years old, owns a small shop next to her house along a big road where she sells porridge to people who eat it for breakfast. She typically makes around $2 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She was married but her husband died of senility. She has four children, all of whom are married and help carry the responsibility for family by working at different occupations.
Le L. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has reached a low point due to insufficient financial capital. Le L. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loan.use: To increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: expand his business

loan.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin C. is an old woman whose husband appears on the photograph above. Sewing clothes is the main part of 45-year-old Mrs. Chin C.â€™s daily duty at the garment industry. She has been engaged in her job since 2000 and has a steady salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a construction foreman. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their three kids. All three of the kids are attending school.
Chin C. also buys clothes that are not export quality from her garment factory to resell in her community. In order to generate additional income for the family, Chin C. is taking out her loan as capital to buy a larger quantity of clothes from the garment industry to resell, which will allow her to improve her profit.

loan.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothing from the garment industry to resell

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To purchase cosmetics

loan.name: Kuljamal

texts.en:
Kuljamal Z. lives in Kok-Tokoy village in the northern region of Kyrgyzstan. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. After graduating from medical college in the capital city, she worked in the local hospital. Her open-hearted personality and attentive attitude to patients helped her to acquire an excellent reputation as a medic. As salaries in rural areas are low, people need to find an additional means to lift themselves from the poverty level. For this reason, Kuljamal and her family started their own business in cattle breeding. At present, the farm has 13 sheep and one milch cow. Kuljamal is also engaged in cultivating apples, pears, raspberries, and currants, all of which were planted 15 years ago. Today her family works hard to get a good harvest. These activities allowed Kuljamal to improve her household, but she still needs a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep and one colt. Revenues from this loan will allow Kuljamal to send her children to the capital city of Bishkek in order to get a good education.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas leading to increased employment and meeting the needs of its clients and investors.

loan.use: To purchase cattle

loan.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is from the village of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is 43 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. To earn a living, Merlina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. More specifically, she sells bananas. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlina joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she will be able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Merlina is requesting her first loan from PMPC in the amount of 3,000 PHP ($75), which will be used as additional capital for her existing business.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loan.use: Additional capital for banana vending

loan.name: Linda

texts.en:

More specifically, she plants and harvests assorted crops to sell for a profit. Notably, Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This prior loan was used as additional capital for her business. Linda is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 25,000 PHP ($575), which will be used to rent a parcel of land. This loan would be the eighth loan taken out by Linda from PMPC.

loan.name: Purisimo

texts.en:
Purisimo Z. is from the village of Kimaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 50 years old, married, and has 6 adult-age children. To earn a living, Purisimo owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, he runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where his primary source of income is derived from selling both food and everyday products in his local community. Purisimo has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of this loan to improve and expand his business.

Her potential customers are the neighboring community. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Siti's major goal is to open another retail shop in the future.
She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services. She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

loan.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is married to a policeman and has one child who is an adult. She has been operating her water selling business from her home for the past three years. She sells to her neighbors and to passers-by. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a water tank.
Sophie faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business, especially during dry seasons. Her major goal is to purchase a large water tank to store more water.
She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

loan.use: To purchase a water tank.

loan.name: Mildred

texts.en:

She owns & operates a business selling seafood like fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.
In 2010, Mildred joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. loan.use: to invest in expanding her business

loan.name: Komiljon

texts.en: H. Komiljon is 35 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market of Penjikent town. Komiljon sells an assortment of good quality and different sorts. Because he buys his goods at wholesale, the price of them is cheaper than the price of his competitors. Thus he has many customers who even make a purchase of his products straight from his house. Today he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take an individual loan. Komiljon has requested a loan of 7,000 Somoni to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key factors in the success of his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loan.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He has been operating a public motor vehicle business for over a year. His customers are the entire public who uses public transport means. Moses faces major challenges during police crackdown. He hopes to own another motor vehicle in the future.
With the 20,000 KES he wants to open a shop for his wife, purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.
His major aim of working with Yehu is because it provides sustainable financial services. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loan.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loan.name: Tohirboy

texts.en:
K. Tohirboy has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and two children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Iskandar provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they donâ€™t get lost. Once theyâ€™re fully mature, Iskandar sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale.
Currently he needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of $1,000. Iskandar thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.

She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $700 a month for these activities.

loan.name: Kisakye Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
N. Robinah belongs to the Kisakye Womenâ€™s Group-Mukono. She is 42 years old, hard working, happily married and blessed with five buoyant children. Taking her family responsibilities in stride, Robinah has for the last 18 years been under the financial auspices of her boutique business in Mpunge-Mukono. This above mentioned coupled with her diary farming enterprise has been her familyâ€™s dependable means of livelihood.
She set forth on this business with pep talk ideas from a close friend. Robinah was, prior to this, involved in a fishing business that in retrospect she says gave her some of the financial backup to start up this business. In a week, Robinah says she can make up to $31.
The experienced stock in trade, she says she has banked on to achieve longevity in this business, has been her exceptional customer care skills and her high spirited entrepreneurial efficacy. Robinah says her major challenge in the course of doing her business has been the lack of sufficient capital to buy more new clothes to resell in her boutique. This, she says, has in many respects affected the growth of her business. She reckons with this loan she will be able to buy more new clothes to resell and as a result make more profit.

loan.use: The purchase of more new clothes to resell at her bontique

loan.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
F. Umedjon is 33 years old, married, and has three children. All of his life he has devoted to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Umedjon the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting wheat, onions, watermelon and rice.
Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market. That is the motivation to continue planting. At the same time Umedjon raises cattle.
This is the 9th loan that Umedjon has with IMON International, making his payments on time. He is very grateful to those who support him, because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, Umedjon will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, and also cattle.

loan.name: Kamol

texts.en:
Since he was a young man, Kamol has known hard work. His parents taught him how to get by as an farmer and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of a family he still works as an farmer. Thanks to his parents Kamol now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer and hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can provide his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive. Without them his production will not improve. You can help Kamol keep moving forward with his development plans.

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loan.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loan.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna P. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Verna is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Verna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Verna has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Verna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Verna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Verna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the family.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
