Elle sâ€™approvisionne sur place Ã SÃ©gou auprÃ¨s des coopÃ©ratives de pÃªcheurs. Madame Batoma SingarÃ© vend au comptant et Ã crÃ©dit Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e de femmes et dâ€™hommes. Elle envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, qui servira Ã prendre en charge certaines dÃ©penses familiales. Son ambition est dâ€™avoir une maison Ã usage dâ€™habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Batoma SingarÃ© is 29 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in her husbandâ€™s paternal family with several other households in the Darsalam neighborhood near the Famory Doumbia hospital in SÃ©gou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having left school during the 5th year of elementary school (Mali educational system), she went into a revenue-generating business very early with her mother, who sold smoked and dried fish. Provided with 5 years of experience, she decided to take off on her own, running the same business as her mother. Batoma sells dried and smoked fish and often some food condiments such as onions at the ChÃ¢teau market in SÃ©gou. She enjoys a great reputation in her sales area and even in her district. She frequently gets orders from Bamako and Kayes where she has clients. Her fish are carefully protected from flies and mosquitos. In the hope of increasing her working capital and satisfy her ever more demanding clientele, she turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is her first loan, which she plans to use to buy 200 kilos of dried fish and 150 kilos of smoked fish. She gets her stock on site in SÃ©gou from fishermen's cooperatives. Mrs. SingarÃ© accepts cash and credit and sells to a clientele composed of women and men. She anticipates making a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA, which will be used to provide for certain family expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Too buy fish

loan.name: Haoua

texts.fr: Madame Haoua TraorÃ© est Ã¢gÃ©e de 51 ans, mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Darsalam de SÃ©gou (4Ã¨me rÃ©gion du Mali). Nâ€™ayant pas Ã©tÃ© Ã lâ€™Ã©cole pour des raisons sociales, elle commenÃ§a trÃ¨s tÃ´t les activitÃ©s gÃ©nÃ©ratrices de revenus auprÃ¨s de sa mÃ¨re qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. AprÃ¨s plusieurs annÃ©es dâ€™apprentissage Ã ses cÃ´tÃ©s, elle bÃ©nÃ©ficia dâ€™une solide expÃ©rience dans le petit commerce. Câ€™est ainsi quâ€™elle dÃ©cida dâ€™Ã©voluer de ses propres ailes dans le crÃ©neau du commerce du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Elle mÃ¨ne cette activitÃ© depuis 13 ans chez elle-mÃªme Ã domicile. Ses ventes sont nombreuses du fait quâ€™elle est la seule vendeuse de bois de chauffe dans le quartier. Elle est sollicitÃ©e lors de tous les grands Ã©vÃ©nements sociaux (mariages, baptÃªmes et funÃ©railles). Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientÃ¨le de plus en plus nombreuse, elle fait recours Ã Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 30 mois. Tous les prÃªts obtenus : 3 solidaires et 1 individuel ont tous Ã©tÃ© bien remboursÃ©s. Elle est Ã son 2Ã¨me prÃªt individuel qui sera utilisÃ© pour acheter, 2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe. Elle sâ€™approvisionne Ã Sanando sur la route de Bamako. Madame Haoua TraorÃ© vend au comptant et Ã crÃ©dit Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prÃªt elle envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 100000FCFA qui lui permettra de finir sa maison et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillements et nourritures).
texts.en:
Haoua Traore is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and their children as a monogamous family in the Darsalam neighborhood in Segou (4th region in Mali). Not having been to school due to social regions, from an early age she started working in income generating activities alongside her mother, who used to sell cooking condiments. After several years of learning at her side she acquired a lot of experience in small business management, so she decided to start her own business in the trade of firewood and charcoal. This is what she has been doing from her own home for the last 13 years. Her sales are good because she is the only firewood seller in the neighborhood. She is especially sought after when there are major social events (weddings, christenings and funerals). In order to keep her increasingly numerous customer base happy, she is seeking the help of Soro Yiriwaso, which which she has been working for 30 months. She has paid back all loans obtained (3 group loans and 1 individual one). This is her second individual loan, which she will use to buy two truckloads of firewood. She stocks up in Sanando, on the Bamako road. Haoua Traore sells for cash or credit to a mostly female customer base. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 100000FCFA, which will allow her to finish her house and meet the needs of her family (clothing and food).

Translated from French by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy firewood

loan.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
These are members of the â€œGod Is Greatâ€ Group. They are microentrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of 1,400,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit.
Mariama Siray M. is the leader of this group. Mariama was born in Makeni. She is 38, married to a businessman and they have four children: one in primary school and three in secondary school. Mariama has been a businesswoman for quite a long time now. She sells baby clothes. She wants this loan in order to buy more baby clothes to add to her business.
Also included in the photo is the loan officer in charge, handing over the loan.

loan.use: To buy more baby clothes

loan.name: Amidatou

texts.fr: Madame Amidatou T. est une divorcÃ©e de 24 ans et mÃ¨re de 2 enfants qui vit chez son pÃ¨re dans une grande famille traditionnelle au quartier Darsalam de SÃ©gou (quatriÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Amidatou a abandonnÃ© lâ€™Ã©cole en classe de 9 Ã¨me annÃ©e fondamentale (systÃ¨me Ã©ducatif Malien) pour se marier. Elle a appris la couture auprÃ¨s de sa mÃ¨re, aprÃ¨s avoir passÃ© plusieurs annÃ©es dâ€™apprentissage. Depuis maintenant 16 ans elle exerce pour elle mÃªme. Son atelier, situÃ© au marchÃ© de MÃ©dine, est facile dâ€™accÃ¨s ce qui constitue une des raisons de lâ€™affluence de sa clientÃ¨le. Elle jouit dâ€™une grande rÃ©putation et notoriÃ©tÃ© car ses Å“uvres : oreillers et habits confectionnÃ©s sont trÃ¨s apprÃ©ciÃ©s et prisÃ©s Ã SÃ©gou. Dans le dessein de faire face Ã la demande clientÃ¨le de plus en plus grande, elle fait recours Ã Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est Ã son 1er prÃªt individuel quâ€™elle compte utiliser pour acheter une nouvelle machine CORNA sur place Ã SÃ©gou. Madame Amidatou T. vend ses articles confectionnÃ©s (souvent sur commande) au comptant Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e de femmes et dâ€™hommes. Avec ce prÃªt, elle envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bÃ©nÃ©fice lui permet de gÃ©rer son quotidien. Son ambition est dâ€™agrandir son atelier, de former beaucoup de personnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amidatou T., a 24-year-old divorcee and mother of two children, lives with her father in a large traditional family in the neighborhood of Darsalam, in SÃ©gou (fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali). Amidatou quit school in 9th grade elementary (under Maliâ€™s education system) to get married. She learned sewing from her mother and spent several years in apprenticeship. She has been working on her own for 16 years. Her workshop at the MÃ©dine market is easily accessible, which is one of the reasons for the high customer traffic. She enjoys great reputation and notoriety as her pillows and clothes are in high demand in SÃ©gou. In order to better serve her increasing client base, she turned to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is her first individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a new CORNA sewing machine in SÃ©gou. Amidatou sells the clothes that she makes (often on order) for cash to a clientele consisting of both men and women. With this loan, she hopes to earn a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA. This will enable her to manage her daily life. Her goal is to expand her workshop and train numerous employees.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a Corna sewing machine

loan.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 32 years old and married with two children, ages 1 year and 6 months. He runs a retail shop in the Mukuru Kwa Njenga slums selling items including soda, sugar, and maize flour. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Omori Group in Faulu, Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a weighing machine and a refrigerator. He hopes to start a transport business in the future.

loan.use: To buy a weighing machine and a refrigerator.

loan.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Madame Fatoumata C. est Ã¢gÃ©e de 44 ans, mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de 3 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari dans une grande famille traditionnelle au quartier Darsalam de SÃ©gou (quatriÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Fatoumata a abandonnÃ© lâ€™Ã©cole en classe de 8Ã¨me annÃ©e fondamentale (systÃ¨me Ã©ducatif Malien) pour faire le commerce auprÃ¨s de sa mÃ¨re qui vendait des habits et ustensiles de cuisine. AprÃ¨s plusieurs annÃ©es dâ€™apprentissage, Ã son mariage, elle commence Ã Ã©voluer seule pour mener le mÃªme commerce que sa mÃ¨re. Elle mÃ¨ne son activitÃ© depuis 26 ans et jouit dâ€™une grande rÃ©putation et notoriÃ©tÃ©. Sa force de vente est due Ã la qualitÃ© de ses articles. Dans le dessein dâ€™augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de rÃ©aliser plus de bÃ©nÃ©fice, elle a fait recours Ã Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette derniÃ¨re depuis 5 ans, aprÃ¨s 8 prÃªts solidaires et 2 prÃªts individuels, tous correctement remboursÃ©s. Elle est Ã son 3Ã¨me prÃªt individuel quâ€™elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 balle de pagnes wax et 50 baignoires en plastiques et aluminium . Elle sâ€™approvisionne au Burkina Faso. Madame Fatoumata C. vend au comptant et Ã crÃ©dit Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e de femmes et dâ€™hommes. Avec ce prÃªt, elle envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 30.000FCFA. Ce bÃ©nÃ©fice lui permet de participer aux Ã©vÃ©nements sociaux. Son ambition est de construire une maison Ã usage dâ€™habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata C. is 44 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in a traditional extended family in the Darsalam district in Segou (the 4th administrative district of Mali). Fatoumata has left school after the 8th grade (Maliâ€™s educational system) in order to join her mother in the business of selling clothing and kitchen utensils. After several years of apprenticeship, once she got married, she launched her own business in the same line as her mother. She has been in business for 26 years and is well-known and respected. Her strength is in high quality of her products. In order to bolster her business capital and increase her income, she has turned to Soroo Yiriwaso. She has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for five years and had 8 solidarity loans and two individual loans, all properly repaid. She is now on her 3rd individual loan which she plans to sue to purchase 1 bale of wax â€œpagnesâ€ [traditional colorful fabric] and 50 plastic and aluminum bathtubs. She stocks up in Burkina Faso. Mrs. Fatoumata C. sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed of both women and men. With this loan, she anticipates achieving a monthly benefit of 30,000 West African francs. This income will allow her to take part in community events. Her goal is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing clothing and kitchen utensils

loan.name: Tabaksneh Group

texts.en:
These are microentrepreneurs from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 1,500,000 leones each to enable them to expand their businesses. With their loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses and make more sales and profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living, send their children to school and feed and clothe them.
Mohamed D. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda, near Makeni. This 41-year-old is married and has three children: two in secondary school and one in primary school. Mohamed sells slippers and has been managing this business for countless years. With his share of the loan, he will buy dozens of slippers to add to his current stock.
Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loan.use: To buy dozens of slippers

loan.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 40 years old and married with two children who attend school. For two years, he has been operating a boda-boda (motorbike) transport business where he has employed one person. He also grows vegetables to earn more income. He was previously selling building materials for a living. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for previously supporting him with capital for his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy another motorbike. He hopes to own a fleet of motorbikes in the future.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loan.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 36-year-old member of Future Target Group in Faulu Kenya. He is married and blessed with two children ages 7 and 11. He has been selling secondhand shoes to earn his daily bread. He was previously running a retail shop. He has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. His business is located in the Gikomba open air market. The fact that he is a member of Faulu Kenya and has previously received two loans has improved his financial status. He has now requested a loan of 45,000 KES to buy more shoes for selling. In five years, he hopes to be selling shoes wholesale.

loan.use: To stock more shoes for his shop.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old husband and father of a seven-year-old child. For twelve years, he has been selling sugarcane. He also runs a boda-boda (motorbike) transport business. He employs three people and hopes to hire two more in the future. He has learned good customer service skills from Faulu Kenya, where he has previously taken out a loan. He is requesting another loan for 40,000 KES to buy more sugarcane for selling. In five years, he hopes to have two other locations for his business.

loan.use: To buy sugarcane for selling.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 27 years old and a member of the Favour self-help group in Faulu Kenya. She does embroidery and sells clothes to earn a living. She also gets financial support from her husband. Nancy has been in business for two years thanks to Faulu Kenya for assisting her when she needed to rent a business premise. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more clothing for selling. She hopes to provide a good education to her three children. She also hopes to expand her business into wholesale.

loan.use: To purchase more clothing stock.

loan.name: Benter

texts.en: Benter is a 28-year-old wife and mother to three children who are in school. For two years, she has been involved in a tailoring business. Apart from that, she runs a cafeteria to boost her income. She also gets financial support from her husband. She has seen her business expand since she became part of Faulu Kenya as part of the New Jerusalem group. She now requests a 40,000 KES loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, fabric, and other sewing tools. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards.

loan.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine, fabric, and tools.

loan.name: Dzyunik

texts.en: Dzyunik A. lives in Tskhuk village in the Syunik region of Armenia. Dzyunik and her husband are farmers. To increase her family income and prepare for the upcoming winter, Dzyunik has applied for a loan to fund the purchase of some cattle and feed for them.

loan.use: To buy cattle and feed.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more used clothing for selling.

loan.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 51 years old, married, and blessed with five children aged 29, 27, 24, 20 and 18. Two of the children are still in school. He is an entrepreneur who runs a butcher shop, and also does some farming to boost his income. He used to run a cafeteria. Stephen runs his business in the Mukuru Kayaba slums and has employed one person. As a member of Faulu Kenya â€“ in Eagles group â€“ he is requesting a loan of 25, 000 KES to buy a refrigerator, glass display, and meat. He hopes to excel in his business and buy his own house in the future.

loan.use: to buy a refrigerator, glass display

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor M. has been managing a trading business since February 2010. He rents a stall at one of the city markets, where he sells womenâ€™s and childrenâ€™s clothing. His wife is a big help in their family business, taking care of it when he is away. Grigor applied for this loan to travel to a neighbouring country to purchase clothing.

loan.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loan.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 38 years old and married. She sells clothes for a living. She has been in the business for three years, and sees herself owning a wholesale boutique in the future. She is a member of Rohi, a self-help group registered with Faulu Kenya. Since she joined the group, her business has really grown. She has had two previous loans from Faulu Kenya, which were guaranteed by her fellow group members. She has requested another loan of 80, 000 KES, which she will use to buy dresses, sweaters and skirts. She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loan.use: to buy dresses, sweaters and skirts for resale

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old and married. He sells clothes to earn a living. He is a member of a self-help group called Rohi in Faulu Kenya. He says that his living standard has improved since he joined Faulu Kenya. So far, he has serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use to buy ladies tops, trousers, skirts, and shirts. He hopes to open a wholesale boutique in five years. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loan.use: To buy ladies tops, trousers, skirts, and shirts

loan.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen T. has been in the trading business since 2004. He rents a stall at one of the city markets, selling shoes and sneakers. Karen has applied for this loan to purchase a stock of new shoes.

loan.use: Purchasing new stock

loan.name: Sama

texts.en:
E. was born in 1966. She is married to Sama Aron, and they are blessed with five children. She shares five rooms with her five children and her husband in Musang, a quarter in Bamenda, in the North-West Region of Cameroon.
E. has had great difficulties in life, ranging from ill-health, failure to attain quality education, and inadequate capital to expand her business. Amongst other challenges, she needs more capital to be able to pull ahead with her projects. With this loan, she plans to buy yams seeds, day-old chicks, and piglets, which she will keep and will later on sell to make more profit from them. She thinks her business is an influential one, and she has succeeded over the past years. She, as well, regularly undertakes contracts. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford good yams, chickens, and pigs for affordable prices.
She will plough her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up, and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.
About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loan.use: Purchase yams seeds, poultry and pig farming

loan.name: Aidake

texts.en:
Aidake U. is 58 years old and the mother of five children. She lives in Ozgorush village, which is in northwest Kyrgyzstan. Sixteen years ago, Aidake bought one cow and five sheep and started her livestock business. Today, she earns 2,200 KGS per month by selling milk to a local diary. She also earns a small amount of money by farming a plot of land on which she grows kidney beans and potatoes. And, because she is a very energetic woman, she supplements these two sources of income by sewing garments for brides, and is well known locally for her skills in this area.
Aidake has applied for a loan for 60,000 KGS to to buy more milk cows, which will allow her to increase sales and acquire more customers. She plans to use her increased income to build a barn for her cows. In the future, she dreams of buying a sewing machine so she can expand her clothing-making business.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan, and contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment by meeting the needs of clients and investors.

loan.use: to buy more cattle

loan.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married with two sons who are ages 18 and 11. He is a small businessman who makes a living in the town of Ivano-Frankivsk by selling clothing in the central market. He specializes in underwear, caps, socks, pantyhose, and other items. He went into business 11 years ago after resigning from a low-paying job at a local factory. His business has benefited from microloans since he started it, and today his monthly profit comes to 6,000 Grivnyas.
Andryi is seeking a 7,500 Grivnya loan to buy additional items to sell to his customers. He would like to increase his income because his small company is his family's sole means of support, and his wife actively helps him with it. He promptly repaid a previous loan, and is hoping to use the increased income made possible by this new one to add a second floor to his house.

loan.use: to buy additional products to sell to his customers

loan.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married and has two children, a 14-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. He is the only breadwinner in his family and has made a living as a taxi driver for the last three years. Currently, he offers transportation services to many parts of the Ukraine. He is a very determined, hard-working man who sometimes puts in a 24-hour day. He currently makes about 4,000 Grivnyas a month.
Andryi is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to remodel his vehicle, improve its efficiency and allow it to run more smoothly and quietly. This will not only help his cut his costs, but also reduce the environmental impact of his vehicle.

loan.use: to make his vehicle op[erate more smoothly and efficiently

loan.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora lives in the town of Mukachevo, where she makes a living selling footwear for women and children in a local marketplace. She is committed to run her business in a stable way, avoiding risks and expanding sales steadily and consistently. She has been in business for 10 years and makes about 12,000 Grivnyas a month.
Leonora is applying for a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal items and her stay competitive with other vendors. She is very diligent and runs her business with great integrity, which explains why it has grown and become such a success.

loan.use: to buy seasonal merchandise to sell to her customers

loan.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, D. 56 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en e su casa propia, junto a su esposo Augusto D. 63 aÃ±os y su querida hija menor Alison D. 19 aÃ±os, a quienes dese brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeÃ±a Aida aprendiÃ³ ha trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseÃ±aron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja y papa, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 36 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plagas que pueden ser afectadas. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producciÃ³n. Este es el octavo crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre estÃ¡ poniendo la cuata D. humor en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Aida, 56-years-old, is a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Augusto, 63-years-old, and their beloved younger daughter Alison, 19-years old. She wants to proviD. them with a better quality of life. Since she was very young Aida has worked on the farm with her parents, who taught her everything that had to be done to achieve a good cultivation. She now has her own land, which she cultivates and cares for with love and patience. She plants peas and potatoes, which she sells at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her crops because at that point she sees that her hard work is coming to fruition. She's performed this activity for 36 years and says that the most difficult thing is protecting her crops from plagues. She hopes to buy new lands with which she will expand her production. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments punctually and she's willing to do that. She's a happy member of her communal bank, where she always brings humor to the group. With the money she's requesting she will buy fertilizer for her land so that her latest crops will give good fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loan.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 48 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pepe de 53 aÃ±os y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Ana ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa y arveja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 27 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, de esa manera pueda mejorar su economÃ­a. Este es el octavo crÃ©dito con MFP, estÃ¡ muy feliz de poder acceder a este crÃ©dito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harÃ¡n posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ nuevas semillas de arveja y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Pepe, 53, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Working hard, Ana has gotten her fields to produce the necessary products to support her family. Before the sun even shows its first rays she is out of the house to walk the nearly hour and a half to reach her fields where she grows potatoes and peas, products which she later takes to sell in Tarmaâ€™s wholesale market. What she likes best about her work is tilling the soil because she feels she uses them well. She has been a farmer for 27 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the products to Tarma because the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In time sheâ€™d like to install a grocery store to improve her economy. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to access it. She wants to thank all the people that will fund it making it possible for her to get the money she needs. She is respected in her communal bank because she imposes order at the meetings. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy new pea seed and sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sacks of manure and pea seeds.

loan.name: Marcial Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Marcial se dedica a la elaboraciÃ³n de salteÃ±as y otros en su domicilio con la ayuda de su esposa quien las vende en la avenida principal de la zona, la actividad que realiza la pareja les ayuda a sustentar a su familia ya que es el Ãºnico ingreso que tienen para los gastos de la alimentaciÃ³n y pagar los estudios de los hijos que estÃ¡n en colegio, podemos indicar tambiÃ©n que los clientes son bastantes trabajadores y responsables ya que se esfuerzan para cancelar sus obligaciones, por lo que se vio por conveniente darles la tasa kiva, con el dinero del crÃ©dito compraran harina, ajÃ­ picante, papa por cantidad para la elaboraciÃ³n de las riquÃ­simas salteÃ±as que elabora el Sr. Marcial.
texts.en:
Marcial makes salteÃ±as (savory baked turnovers) from his home, helping his wife who also makes and sells them along the main road of the region. The business that this couple carries out helps them support the family, this being their only source of income. This income covers their food and the tuition for the kids who attend school. They are hard working and responsible people that invest their energy in covering their expenses and obligations. With the loan they will purchase flour, garlic, chili powder and potatoes to make their exquisite salteÃ±as.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase ingredients.

loan.name: Rosalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Destino de CrÃ©dito: ConstrucciÃ³n de muro perimetral.
La seÃ±orita RosalÃ­a vive en casa de sus parientes en la zona de Milluni en la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera y es de profesiÃ³n maestra, actualmente trabaja en una unidad educativa de la misma ciudad. Los ingresos que obtiene ayudan a su subsistencia y ayuda a sus padres, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crÃ©dito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Loan Use: To build a perimeter wall. RosalÃ­a is single and is a teacher. She currently is employed in a school in El Alto which is where she lives in her relativesâ€™ house in the Milluni neighborhood. Her salary helps her to subsist and help her parents. This is her first loan request from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a perimeter wall.

loan.name: Natty Jesusa

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Natty vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada, sus hijos estÃ¡n en edad escolar. La seÃ±ora tiene un almacÃ©n de abarrotes y su esposo trabaja en el transporte publico, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia. El crÃ©dito que solicta serÃ¡ utilizado para la construcciÃ³n de un cuarto de baÃ±o. Natty es cliente de Impro con un historial de 8 crÃ©ditos.
texts.en:
Natty lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area, on the eastern slopes of the city of La Paz. She's married with school-aged children. She has a grocery warehouse and her husband works in public transit. They use their income to support the family. Natty plans to use her loan to construct a bathroom. She is an Impro client who has had eight loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To build a bathroom.

loan.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio, de 58 aÃ±os, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que mÃ¡s desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Los aÃ±os le han enseÃ±ado a Artemio, que tiene que trabajar muy duro si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado y es asÃ­ que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus sembrÃ­os de papa, arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, sean muy solicitados en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 45 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y para Ã©l siempre le fue difÃ­cil tener que cuidar sus campos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea sembrar todas sus tierras, ya que asÃ­ podrÃ¡ mejorar su producciÃ³n. Este es el octavo crÃ©dito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora tambiÃ©n. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compaÃ±eras. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ semillas de arveja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Artemio is 58 years old. He is someone who has always worked hard to advance in life. He lives alone in his own home and his greatest wish is to have a peaceful old age. Time has taught Artemio that one has to work very hard if the harvest is going to be the best in the village so it is with a great deal of effort that he has cared for his potato, sweet pea, spinach, and carrot plantations. His products are very sought out in the markets of the city of Tarma. What he most enjoys about the work is the harvest. For the past 45 years he has worked in the business and it has always been very difficult to ward his fields from insects and pests. In time he hopes to cultivate all of his land to improve his yield. This is the eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He has always been on time with his payments and he plans on keeping his record. In his community bank he is a very engaged member. With the eight hundred nuevos soles he requests he will purchase pea seeds, this being the harvest that sells the best.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Pea seeds.

loan.name: MarÃ­a Eugenia

texts.es: La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa ExaltaciÃ³n de la ciudad de El Alto, vive con su esposo y su hijo de un aÃ±o, la seÃ±ora es empleada en una pensiÃ³n y su esposo trabaja en mantenimiento de ascensores, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crÃ©dito. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ para la refacciÃ³n de muros exteriores.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home in the Villa Exaltacion area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and one-year-old child. She is employed at a boarding house and her husband works in elevator maintenance. With their income, they support their family. This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan. The loan will be used for repairing exterior walls.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: restoration of walls

loan.name: Veronica

texts.es: La SeÃ±ora VerÃ³nica se dedica a distintas actividades como a la venta de distintos productos como ser ropa, tenis pero su actividad principal es la venta de comida cerca a un colegio de Colcapirhua, vende salchipapas y hamburguesas, actualmente vive en casa de su suegra y la seÃ±ora no paga alquiler, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y con Kiva por darle la oportunidad de trabajar y crecer junto a nosotros, vive actualmente en el barrio kami de la zona de Colcapirhua y tambiÃ©n la seÃ±ora es muy sacrificada ya que se dedica a la venta de todo a veces por la Ã©poca de navidad vende juguetes y en la Ã©poca de invierno vende chompas y en la Ã©poca de clases vende salchipapas y otros, con el dinero del crÃ©dito desea comprar Papa, garrafa, platos desechables para la venta de sus productos , trabaja duro para poder asÃ­ mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Veronica carries out various business activities such as the sale clothing and sports shoes but her primary business is the sale of prepared foods near the school in Colcapirhua. She sells salchipapas (a traditional dish of chicken, sausages and potatoes) and hamburgers. She currently lives with her mother-in-law, not having to pay rent. She is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) to have imparted the opportunity to work together and become a member of the group. She lives in the Kami district of the Colcapirhua region. Veronica also sells all kinds of things depending on the season. For Christmas she sells toys and for the winter season she sells jackets and during the school year she sells foods in the schools. With the loan she will purchase potatoes, a carafe, and disposable plates. She works hard to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase ingredients.

loan.name: La Gata Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Gata estÃ¡ conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Agustina Ãngela Fornos O. de 36 aÃ±os quien inicio vendiendo tortillas actualmente tiene una pequeÃ±a venta donde oferta maÃ­z, queso, huevo, chicharron, cuajadas, leche agria etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sandi SalomÃ© S. GÃ³mez de 20 aÃ±os quien tiene una pequeÃ±a tortillerÃ­a y Helsel Raquel S. AlegrÃ­a comercializa productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group's name is La Gata. It is made up of three hard working women. One of the members is Agustina Angela Fornos O., 36 years old. She started selling tortillas and now she has a small store from where she sells corn, cheese, eggs, pork rinds, desserts etc. The other members of the group are Sandi Salome S. G., 20 years old. She has a small tortilla making business. Helsel Raquel S. A. sells Avon brand products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase corn, dairy products, eggs, etc.

loan.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, 40 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de su esposo junto a su menor hijo Bryan de 13 aÃ±os, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El cultivo de zanahoria y gladiolo es la actividad que realiza diariamente Delia. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 15 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Espera en adelante tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para asÃ­ mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el sÃ©timo crÃ©dito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives together with her husband and their youngest son Bryan, 13 years old. They are the reason for all of her efforts. She harvests carrots and gladiola flowers. This is Delia's daily work. With a great deal of effort she has managed to make her fields to be very productive, generating excellent quality harvests and very sought out by the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her favorite part of her work is caring of the plantations. She has had 15 years in the field. The most difficult part of the work is having to transport her products all the way to the city of Tarma. The sacks are very heavy. IN the future she hopes to have a stand in the wholesale market to improve her earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she will endeavor to be on time with her payments, not wanting to cause any troubles with her community bank, where she feels very content. With the thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests, she will purchase pea seeds. This product is selling very well these months.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loan.name: Coco Victor

texts.es: El SeÃ±or coco dedicado al servicio de taxi, diariamente desde muy tempranas horas de la maÃ±ana el Sr. Sale al trabajo, el seÃ±or Coco tiene una particularidad especial ya que el seÃ±or no cuenta con una pierna pero esto no le impide realizar esta actividad consiente de que es duro para el pero sigue adelante con mas fuerza, el dinero que el gana lo utiliza para el tratamiento que requiere para su pierna, y tambiÃ©n para mantener su hogar, el crÃ©dito que el requiere es para comprar repuestos para su automÃ³vil. Y asÃ­ poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, esta muy agradecido con la instituciÃ³n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Coco is a taxi driver. Every day, from the very early morning hours, he goes to work. He has a unique circumstance in that he is an amputee but this has never prevented him from working every day. He knows that it is hard to advance but that's why he works even harder. His earnings are used to cover the medical expenses to treat his leg and to support his family. The loan he requests will be used to purchase spare parts for his car, to provide better service to his clients. He is very grateful for the support he is given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loan.name: Harold

texts.es: Harold, de 24 aÃ±os, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Lisbeth de 21 aÃ±os y su Ãºnico hijo Junior de 10 meses, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la comodidad de su hogar Harold tiene su horno, desde entonces todos los dÃ­as se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Ã‰l trabaja con su esposa Lisbeth y juntos realizan pan, ya que el horno les pertenece a ambos. Disfruta mucho de su labor, como hornear pasteles, es asÃ­ que tiene 15 aÃ±os trabajando en esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es elaborar los panes, ya que tiene que tener mucho cuidado para que no se quemen. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender Ã©l mismo sus panes. Este es el primer crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrÃ¡ acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de sus socias. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirÃ¡ en comprar ingredientes, para preparar sus deliciosos panes.
texts.en:
Harold is 24 years old. He is a very unpretentious and hard working young man. He lives in a rented house together with his wife Lisbeth, 21 years old, and their only son, Junior who is 10 months old. They are the reason for all of his efforts. In the comfort of his home Harold has an oven. He starts baking very early in the morning to fill all the orders he has received from his clients. He works together with his wife Lisbeth and together they bake breads. The oven belongs to them both. He very much enjoys his work, especially baking cakes. He has 15 years' experience in the field. The most difficult part of the work is baking breads because he always has to give special care to not over bake them. In the future he hopes to set up a store from where they can sell their baked goods themselves. This is the first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that if he pays his loan back on time he will have access to future loans and not bring any difficulties to his community bank. He is very well liked by the other members of the group. The one thousand nuevos soles that he requests will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to bake more delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase ingredients for his bakery.

loan.name: Salustino

texts.es: El seÃ±or Salustino vive en casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, es policÃ­a y ademÃ¡s realiza trabajos varios como electricista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene y ayuda a su familia. El crÃ©dito es para la construcciÃ³n de una sala, el seÃ±or es cliente de Impro con un historial de 4 crÃ©ditos. Por su antecedente histÃ³rico califica para obtener un nuevo crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Salustino lives in his own home in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. He is single and a police officer. He also works in other areas, for example as an electrician. With his income, he supports and helps his family. The loan is for the construction of a room. He is a client of Impro and has a 4 previous loans. His prior history qualifies him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: construction

loan.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El seÃ±or ELEUTERIO P. R., es una persona de 46 aÃ±os, es soltero sin hijos, que se dedica a la actividad de crÃ­a de ganado lechero y asimismo es albaÃ±il. No tiene estudios, sÃ³lo cursÃ³ el primero y segundo curso, ha vivido desde su infancia en el lugar llamado Pilancho, estÃ¡ a 25 kilÃ³metros de la ciudad de Cochabamba hacia el TrÃ³pico, ha heredado el terreno de sus padres, quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida construyendo dos habitaciones, lo que tiene estÃ¡ en muy mal estado. Asimismo en el lugar tiene una arboleda de eucaliptos para preservar el entorno medioambiental. Su trabajo de albaÃ±il lo realiza en diferentes lugares de Cochabamba con regularidad.
El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ utilizado en la construcciÃ³n y mejoramiento de los establos donde se encuentra el ganado, asi de ese modo podra realizar mejor su trabajo, optimizandolo, y con el tiempo mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eleuterio P. R. is a 46 year old man. He is single and he has no children. He raises milk cows and he also a construction worker. He has a grade 2 education. Since his infancy he has lived in the same place, a village named Pilancho, located 25 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. He inherited the land from his parents. He wishes to improve his living conditions, so he is building two bedrooms. The one he currently has is in very poor state. In his house he also has a tree orchard of eucalyptus trees, preserved to conserve the environment. He works as a construction worker in various locales in Cochabamba. The loan will be invested in the construction and improvement of the farm stables where the dairy cows are raised. He will be able to carry out his work in better conditions, optimizing it, and in time see an improvement in his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To make a stable for his dairy cows.

loan.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora, de 45 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Isidora ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, zanahoria y arveja, las cuales los lleva a vender al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva 20 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y aÃºn sigue disfrutando trabajar en el campo, cuidar sus cultivos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producciÃ³n. Este es el octavo crÃ©dito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores crÃ©ditos y espera serlo tambiÃ©n ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isidora is 45 years old. She is a very unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in a rented home together with her 4 beloved children, to whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. With a great deal of work Isidora has managed her fields to make them very productive. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, and peas. She sells her harvest in wholesale in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her harvests have granted her an income, enough to support her family, reason for which she expends all of her energy in the business. She has 20 years' experience in the field and even after all this time she still enjoys working the fields, and caring for her plantations. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to expand production. This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been on time with her loans in the past and she hopes to keep up her record. In her community bank she is a very involved member, always on top of the business and agreements of the group. With the two thousand soles she requests she will purchase fertilizer to improve her harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loan.name: MarÃ­a Cristina

texts.es: La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de las Lomas, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 aÃ±os, la seÃ±ora es profesora y trabaja en una unidad educativa de su zona, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia. El crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la construcciÃ³n de un cuarto de baÃ±o Esta es la octava vez que solicita un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a lives in her parents' home in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. She is single and has an 8-year-old child. She is a teacher and works in a local school. With her income, she supports her family. This loan will be used to construct a bathroom. This is her eighth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the construction of a bathroom

loan.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the Ruth Group from Makeni. They are microentrepreneurs residing in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Halima S., standing on the left in the photo. Halima is age 42 and was born in Binkolo village about 7 miles from Makeni city. She is married to a health worker and they have four children: one in primary school and three in secondary school. Halima runs a little clinic and at the same time she also sells market foodstuffs such as groundnuts (peanuts), palm oil (the countryâ€™s most favorite cooking oil), etc. With the help of this loan, Halima will improve her clinic and also buy more palm oil and groundnuts to add to her business.

loan.use: To improve a clinic and also buy more palm oil and groundnuts

loan.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, D. 60 aÃ±os, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 64 aÃ±os y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Marcela ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembrÃ­os, todas las maÃ±anas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos D. papa, espinaca y arveja, productos que llevarÃ¡ a comercializarlas en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahÃ­ donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 37 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar la mayorÃ­a D. sus tierras para el sembrado D. arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se venD.. Este es el primer crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que este prÃ©stamo le ayudarÃ¡ bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s abono para mejorar la calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old. She is a very loving mother and a hard working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Fortunato, 64 years old, and their 3 beloved children. She hopes to proviD. them all with a better quality of life. Working arduously Marcela has managed her plantations. Every morning she starts her work very early, providing the needed care to her fields of potatoes, spinach, and peas. She takes her products to sell in the city of Tarma, location where she gets the best prices. Her favorite part of her work is the freedom she enjoys when she works in her fields. She has 37 years' experience in the business. The most difficult part of her work is preparing the fields for seeding. In time she hopes to prepare most of her fields to cultivate peas, during this time of year it is the harvest that sells the best. This is her first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She sees this loan as a great help in the advancement and development of her business. She is committed to the responsibilities of the loan. In the community bank she is known as a very responsible and much liked member. The one thousand nuevos soles requested will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loan.name: Masuba Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the â€œMasubaâ€ group. They are small-scale businesswomen residing in Makeni city. They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.
Pictured on the left is Fatmata F. who is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Makeni and she is 37 years old. She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children who are attending secondary school.
Fatmata sells cloth (fabric). She has had 10 years of experience in the cloth business. With her share of the loan, Fatmata will buy cloth to add to her current stock.
(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loan.use: To buy cloth to add to her current stock

loan.name: Juan

texts.es: El seÃ±or Juan es casado vive con su esposa en casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El seÃ±or Juan es costurero y se dedica a la confecciÃ³n de chamarras junto con la ayuda de su esposa, de esta manera obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar. El crÃ©dito solicitado es para la compra de una maquina industrial overlok y asÃ­ mejorar la calidad de su producto. Este es el segundo crÃ©dito que solicita el seÃ±or Juan con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Juan is married. He lives with his wife in his parents' home in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Juan is a tailor, and makes jackets with the help of his wife. This is how they obtain an income for their household. The requested loan is for the purchase of an Overlok industrial machine to improve the quality of his product. This is his second loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy Overlock sewing machine

loan.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 47 aÃ±os, su actividad es una pulperÃ­a. Ella tiene mÃ¡s de 12 aÃ±os de tener este negocio comenzÃ³ con muy pocos productos, un negocio en el cual le estÃ¡ dando buenos resultados econÃ³micos, Hoy con su propio negocio, le estÃ¡ yendo de la mejor manera y ese Ã©xito mesurado lo agradece eternamente a sus padres, ademÃ¡s sus clientes mÃ¡s exigentes se sienten satisfechos su planes para el futuro son que el negocio siga creciendo y obtener mÃ¡s ingresos. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que lucha y que disfruta de su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, leche, jugos, pan y detergentes. SueÃ±a con mantener siempre satisfecho a sus clientes.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Lourdes, 47, has had a grocery store for over 12 years. She started out with just a few products but itâ€™s a business that is producing good economic results. Today, with her own business, she is doing better and she is eternally grateful to her parents for this success. In addition, her most demanding customers are satisfied. She plans for her business to continue growing in the future in order to earn more income. She has always been noted for being a woman who works hard and enjoys her work. The financing will be used to buy sweets, beverages, milk, juices, bread and detergents. She dreams with always having satisfied customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loan.name: Sandra Felisa

texts.es:
La seÃ±ora Sandra Felisa Q. A. tiene 33 aÃ±os y vive en casa de su tia en el barrio IV Centenario de esta ciudad de Tarija. Sandra no es casada pero tiene un hijo. Sandra se dedica a trabajar como costurera desde hace mÃ¡s de 10 aÃ±os.
Sandra quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero ella nos cuenta que tiene un trabajo grande por hacer y tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo. Es por eso que el crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para la compra de dicho material para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
Sandra nos cuenta que quiere darle a su hijo toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el prÃ³ximo crÃ©dito que solicite serÃ¡ para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Sandra Felisa Q. A. is thirty-three and lives in her aunt's house in the Centenario Neighborhood IV in Tarija. She is not married but she has one son. She has been working as a seamstress for more than ten years. Sandra would like to have more income to provide her family with a better life, but she tells us that she needs to buy supplies for a big job she has to do. That's why she plans to use her loan buy the supplies, so she can increase her earnings. Sandra tells us that she would like to give her son every possible comfort, so she plans to use her next loan to improve the condition of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sewing supplies, including thread and fabric, and for operating expenses.

loan.name: Ma-Finoh Group

texts.en:
Ramatu B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 28 years ago in Makeni city, Ramatu is married and has two children. Ramatu has been selling palm oil, rice, etc. for countless years. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil, rice, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.
This is the second loan that Ramatu and her group member have applied for from SMT, a partner of Kiva.org. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loan.use: Buy palm oil, rice, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loan.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 53 aÃ±os, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredÃ³ su madre junto a su hijo Maycon y lo que mÃ¡s desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicaciÃ³n ha logrado cultivar Maximiliana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las maÃ±anas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembrÃ­os de papa y arveja, dependerÃ¡ la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 23 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para asÃ­ poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el segundo crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ semillas de arveja y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Maximiliano, age 53, is a very happy and hard-working mother. She lives with her son, Maycon, in the house that she inherited from her mother. What she wishes for most is to improve her quality of life. The products that Maximiliana has managed to cultivate, with much effort and dedication, have helped her a lot to make progress in her life. Every morning she starts to work in her fields. She knows that the quality of the products that she will get depends upon the care she gives her potato and pea crops. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She is very happy when they are large and abundant. She has been doing this for 23 years, and the most difficult is taking the harvest to the Tarma market where she sells her crops. The bags she uses to take her harvest are very heavy. Later, she hopes to improve her products in order to be able to get better prices. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments punctually, and she is prepared to do so. She is a very supportive and responsible member of her communal bank. She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: JosÃ© Antonio

texts.es: El seÃ±or Jose A. T. Z. es casado vive con su esposa y su hija de 7 aÃ±os de edad en la casa de sus suegros en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. El seÃ±or JosÃ© trabaja como programador de computadoras en una entidad privada y su esposa es administradora de un edificio, ambos tienen un negocio donde venden material de escritorio, de esta forma obtienen ingresos para su hogar. El crÃ©dito solicitado es para aumentar capital de trabajo para su negocio y asÃ mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Es su primer crÃ©dito en IMPRO y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado lo califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. JosÃ© A. T. Z. is married and lives with his wife and 7-year-old daughter in his in-lawsâ€™ house in La Pazâ€™s Achachicala neighborhood. JosÃ© works as a Computer Programmer in a private firm and his wife is a building supervisor. Both own a business where they sell office supplies thereby earning extra income for the home. The loan will be used to increase working capital for their business in order to improve income and quality of life. Itâ€™s his first loan with IMPRO; the socio-economic evaluation undertaken indicates that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy paper goods.

loan.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Sra. Lucila vive en la ciudad de la Paz, en la zona denominada Alto Tacagua cuenta con dos hijos ya mayores de edad, es viuda, cuenta que fue un golpe para ella el quedarse sola sin su compaÃ±ero, pero supo reponerse y salir adelante, su actividad es la venta de comida cuenta con 10 aÃ±os de experiencia en el rubro y menciona que invertirÃ¡ el dinero en la compra de un terreno que esta de ocasiÃ³n, ella cuenta con parte de lo que cuesta el terreno y le hizo falta los un mil dÃ³lares americanos que actualmente solicita, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in the city of La Paz in an area called Alto Tacagua. She has two grown children, and she is a widow. She says that it was a blow for her to be left alone without her life partner. But, she knew how to recover and get ahead. She sells food, and she has ten years of experience in this field. She says that she will use the money to buy a piece of land that is a bargain. She has part of the price of the land, but she still needs $1,000 American dollars. She is requesting that amount now. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is always thinking of her familyâ€™s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a piece of land

loan.name: Sintya

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Sintya es separada, actualmente vive con su hijo de 9 aÃ±os de edad en alquiler en el Barrio Ferroviario de la zona de Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz. La seÃ±ora Sintya es comerciante independiente y trabaja vendiendo joyas, es asÃ­ como obtiene ingresos para su hogar. El crÃ©dito solicitado es para aumento de capital para vender ampliar su mercaderÃ­a. Es su primer crÃ©dito con IMPRO y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado la califica favorablemente para acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Sintya is separated. She currently lives with her 9-year-old child in a rented home in the Ferroviario neighbourhood of the Pura Pura zone of the city of La Paz. Sintya is an independent merchant and works selling jewellery; this is how she obtains an income for her household. The requested loan is for an increase of working capital to expand her merchandise. This is her first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis for obtaining a loan graded her favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œVirgen del Rosario del Cuscoâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella tiene 43 aÃ±os de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, ella saca sola adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes mas grande. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar mercaderÃ­a como arroz, azÃºcar, leche y galletas.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueÃ±o mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florentina, age 43, is a member of the â€œVirgen del Rosario del Cuscoâ€ Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Florentina is a single mother, and she has two children. She alternates between her daily activities and her business, which is a grocery store. She sells from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She alone gets her children ahead. She wants to have a larger grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is grateful to those people, who through these means, are part of her dream. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loan.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio tiene 41 aÃ±os de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa para caballeros, niÃ±os y damas y tambiÃ©n una gran variedad de ropa interior. Su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que asÃ­ tiene la probabilidad de vender. El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administraciÃ³n, la excelente atenciÃ³n a los clientes. Junto a su esposa tienen 2 hijos de los cuales dependen de ellos pues siempre se preocupan por mejorar su negocio. El crÃ©dito lo utilizara para comprar mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a y asÃ­ surtir su negocio. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 41 years old, and he sells clothing for men, women, and children. He also sells a great variety of underwear. He sells in an itinerant manner because that is they way that he will most likely make sales. The growth of his business is notable thanks to his good administration and the excellent service he gives his customers. He and his wife have two dependent children. They are always thinking about improving his business. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock his business. He needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working Capital

loan.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania, D. 53 aÃ±os es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo HÃ©ctor D. 51 aÃ±os y su hijo menor Bryan D. 16 aÃ±os, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Melania ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas, zanahorias y habas, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 30 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para mÃ¡s adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producciÃ³n. Este es el cuarto crÃ©dito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores crÃ©ditos y espera serlo tambiÃ©n ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Melanie, age 53, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 51 year old husband, HÃ©ctor, and her 16 year old son, Bryan. She wants to give them a better future. With a great deal of effort Melania has managed to work her fields and have them be productive again. She grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans. These products are taken to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her crops have given her the necessary income to support her family. Therefore, she wants to put all of her efforts into getting this business ahead. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She has been doing this for 30 years. The most difficult part is transporting her products to Tarma. The sacks that she takes there are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she wishes to buy new fields to increase her production. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous loans, and she plans being punctual with this loan as well. She is a very active participant in her communal bank, and she is up on all of the agreements the group has come to. She will use the requested 1,300 soles to buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: JosÃ©

texts.es: El seÃ±or Jose es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 1 y 3 aÃ±os de edad en casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz El seÃ±or Jose trabaja como empleado de limpieza en una entidad privada y su esposa trabaja como vendedora de perfumes, de estÃ¡ manera obtiene ingresos para su hogar. El crÃ©dito solicitado es para la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad de EL Alto y asÃ­ tener un lugar donde vivir. Es su primer crÃ©dito con IMPRO y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado le califica favorablemente para acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Jose is married and lives with his wife and children, ages 1 and 3, in his parents' home in the Pasankeri zone, south of the city of La Paz. Jose works as a member of the cleaning staff of a private company and his wife works as a perfume salesperson. This is how they obtain an income for their household. The requested loan is for the purchase of a plot of land in the city of El Alto, which will provide them with a place to live. This is his first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis for receiving a loan graded him favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of land

loan.name: Martha

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Martha es separada, vive con su hermana en alquiler en la zona de Sopocachi Alto de la ciudad de La Paz. La seÃ±ora Martha es comerciante independiente de ropa para damas con lo que obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar. El crÃ©dito solicitado es para aumentar capital y obtener mayor mercaderÃ­a. Es su tercer crÃ©dito y el anÃ¡lisis socioeconÃ³mico realizado la califica favorablemente para acceder a un crÃ©dito.
texts.en:
Martha is separated and lives with her sister in a rented home in the Sopocachi Alto zone in the city of La Paz. Martha works as an independent seller of women's clothing to obtain her income for her household. The requested loan is to increase her working capital and obtain better merchandise. This is her third loan and the socioeconomic analysis for accessing a loan graded her favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loan.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 45 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 50 aÃ±os y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida. Todos los dÃ­as muy temprano por la maÃ±ana, Nelly sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los dÃ­as de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producciÃ³n. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa, espinaca y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lleva 30 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y aÃºn sigue disfrutando trabajar en el campo y cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo debe estar atenta para que la plaga de insectos no perjudique su siembra. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producciÃ³n. Este es el sÃ©ptimo crÃ©dito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora tambiÃ©n. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compaÃ±eras, ya es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years years old. She is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Pedro, who is 50 years old, and their 3 children to whom she wishes to give a better life. Every day, very early in the morning, Nelly leaves to go to work in the fields. For her, there are no rest days as she has to continually work her farm in order for it to be productive. Her main crops are potatoes, spinach and peas which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. She has been doing this work for 30 years and she still enjoys working in the fields and caring for her crops, however, she has to be vigilant so that the insects don't destroy her crops. In the future, she wants to buy more land to increase her production. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same with this loan. In her communal bank she is very well-liked by her fellow members since she is very cheerful. With the two thousand nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting she will buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loan.name: Voice Of Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the â€œVoice Of Womenâ€ group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses.
Adama F. is the leader of this group. Adama is 48 years old and a widow with six children. Three of the children are attending secondary school.
Adama sells cooking oil, magi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. and has been running this business for a very long time. With the help of this loan, Adama will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loan.use: To buy cooking oil, margi, etc in large quantity

loan.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Buen Pastor lo integran Ana MarÃ­a R. MÃ©ndez, Sabrina de los Ãngeles P. y Xiomara M. E., tres mujeres que se encuentran en distintas etapas de sus vidas pero que comparten el placer de ser solidarias en una actividad que las beneficia a todas.
Ana MarÃ­a de 56 aÃ±os se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos y perfumerÃ­a en general, los cuales compra al por mayor para luego vender por menudeo, ella es la coordinadora del grupo; Sabrina vende verduras y tamales en un pequeÃ±o tramo en el mercado municipal, a sus 69 aÃ±os es ella misma quien fabrica dichos tamales para vender; finalmente Xiomara vende cosmÃ©ticos, ropa, tintes y accesorios en su comunidad y los sectores cercanos a su casa de habitaciÃ³n.
texts.en:
The united group â€œEl Buen Pastorâ€ (The Good Shepherd) is made up of Ana MarÃ­a R. MÃ©ndez, Sabrina de los Ãngeles P., and Xiomara M. E.; three women who find themselves at different stages of their lives, but who contribute and are united in an activity that benefits them all. Ana MarÃ­a is 56 years old and sells cosmetics and perfumes, which she buys in bulk and then resells at retail. She is the groupâ€™s coordinator. Sabrina sells vegetables and tamales from spot in the city marketplace. At 69, she makes the tamales herself. Finally, Xiomara sells cosmetics, clothing, hair coloring, and accessories in her community and sectors near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer
