loan.name: Braulio Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Braulio lo conforma Norma del Socorro DÃ¡vila M. de 38 aÃ±os, Martha Lorena LÃ³pez GarcÃ­a y MarÃ­a Evalia MartÃ­nez C.; la primera es coordinadora del grupo y su labor es la compra/venta de cosechas, principalmente de frutas, actividad la cual realiza desde hace 4 aÃ±os; dado que su esposo es agricultor ocasionalmente son las cosechas de Ã©l las que vende lo cual le deja mayores mÃ¡rgenes de ganancia.
Martha vende verduras en el mercado y MarÃ­a Evelia tiene una pulperÃ­a la cual surgiÃ³ hace cuatro aÃ±os y poco a poco ha venido creciendo. El sueÃ±o de estas mujeres es seguir prosperando con sus actividades y poder hacer mejoras en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The â€œBraulioâ€ communal bankâ€™s members are: Norma del Socorro DÃ¡vila M., 38, Martha Lorena LÃ³pez GarcÃ­a and MarÃ­a Evalia MartÃ­nez C.. Norma is the group Coordinator and she buys and sells crops, mostly fruits; sheâ€™s been in this line of work for 4 years since her husbandâ€™s a farmer. Sometimes itâ€™s his crops that she sells which means higher profit margins. Martha sells vegetables in the market and MarÃ­a Evelia has a grocery store that she started four years ago and has been growing gradually ever since. The dream of these women is to continue prospering with their activities and to be able to make some improvements to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, D. 63 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija menor Liz D. 26 aÃ±os, quien es el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. DesD. muy pequeÃ±a Nieves aprendiÃ³ a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseÃ±aron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra alverja, espinaca y zanahoria, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 40 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo espera, comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producciÃ³n. Este es el quinto crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre estÃ¡ poniendo la cuota D. humor en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nieves, 63, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter, Liz, 26, who is the object of all her efforts. Since a very young age Nieves learned how to work the fields with her parents who taught her everything you need to know to have a good crop. Now she owns her own lands which she cultivates and cares for with love and patience. She plants peas, spinach and carrots which she then sells in Tarmaâ€™s market. What she most enjoys about the work is harvesting the crops because thatâ€™s when she enjoys the fruits of her hard work. She has been in this line of work for 40 years. She considers the most difficult part of it protecting the plants from infestations that can damage them. In time she hopes to buy new fields in order to increase production. This is her 5th loan with MFP. She knows that she has to repay on time and is willing to do so. She is a cheerful member of her communal group and can always be counted on to inject humor into the group. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy sacks of manure for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loan.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: El SeÃ±or Harold Enrique tiene 40 aÃ±os. Su actividad econÃ³mica es brindar el servicio de taxi, hace mÃ¡s de 15 aÃ±os que se dedica a este negocio. Este negocio comenzÃ³ por su Padre que le enseÃ±o a manejar con el paso del tiempo este negocio le gusto a Harold ya que ademÃ¡s tenÃ­a que mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos, llantas, focos entre otras cosas. Sus deseos son de conseguir otro taxi y asÃ­ proporcionarle a su familia esta fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Harold Enrique, 40, is a taxi driver. He has been in this business for over 15 years. His father started the business and taught him how to drive. In time, Harold liked this type of work. Besides, he had to support his family. The financing will be used to buy replacement parts: tires and headlamps among others. His wish is to acquire a second taxi so that he can provide his family with this source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy replacement parts for his taxi.

loan.name: Asociasion Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario AsociaciÃ³n sin Fronteras lo conforman tres mujeres de edad madura que luchan todos los dÃ­as por llevar el alimento a sus hogares, Felipa Lorena J. E. es una de ellas y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como plÃ¡tano, tomate, repollo, lechuga y cebollas, entre otros; siendo ayudada por sus dos hijos mayores pues su esposo se encuentra enfermo posterior a un accidente que tuvo en el pasado. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y llegar a ver a sus nietos como profesionales.
Elidia de los Ãngeles P. S. se dedica a la venta de artesanÃ­as, cosmÃ©ticos y sandalias, este negocio era anteriormente de su mamÃ¡ y ella retomo los pasos. Socorro Benita RodrÃ­guez LÃ³pez es una de las principales proveedoras de papel en las comiderÃ­as de Masaya.
texts.en:
The â€œAsociaciÃ³n sin Fronterasâ€ (Association without Borders) is made up of three mature women who struggle daily to provide nourishment for their families. Felipa Lorena JosÃ© E. is one of them. She sells fruits and vegetables like: bananas, tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce and onions, among others. Her two older children help her because her husband is currently ill due to a past accident he suffered. Her goal is to continue working until her grandchildren become professionals. Elidia de los Ãngeles P. S. sells crafts, cosmetics and sandals. This business used to belong to her mother but she took it over. Socorro Benita RodrÃ­guez LÃ³pez is one of the main paper suppliers to eateries in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Priscila

texts.es: Priscila, de 53 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Walter de 52 aÃ±os y su querida hija Pamela de 16 aÃ±os, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Priscila es el cultivo de arvejas, espinacas y zanahoria, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien tambiÃ©n trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que segÃºn manifiesta, es ahÃ­ donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 30 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos econÃ³micos. Este es el sÃ©ptimo crÃ©dito con MFP, se siente en la obligaciÃ³n de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Priscila is 53 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Walter, who is 52 years old, and her dear daughter Pamela, 16. They are the reason for all her efforts. Priscila grows peas, spinach and carrots for a living. This she does with her husband who also works very hard to earn an income for their family. For convenience sake she brings her products to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. It is here that she can obtain the best price. What she likes most about her job is protecting her crops from the pests that can threaten her production. She has been doing this for 30 years and considers transporting her products the most difficult since the trip is long and exhausting. In time, she hopes to buy mO. land to increase her crop production and increase her income with the sales. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her communal bank where she is well-liked. With the 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting, she will buy mO. fertilizer to increase her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loan.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Gerardo RamÃ³n S. R. es un hombre de 65 aÃ±os cuyo oficio aprendiÃ³ desde su adolescencia y en mÃ¡s de 47 aÃ±os de la realizaciÃ³n del mismo sigue sintiÃ©ndose con fuerzas para â€œecharle ganar aÃºn mÃ¡s tiempoâ€. Ã‰l es agricultor, ademÃ¡s se dedica a la compra-venta de leÃ±a y siembras. En su labor diaria recibe ayuda de sus hijos y sus nietos, pero siente la pena de la enfermedad de su conyugue, quien por su avanzada edad no puede ayudarle como en los aÃ±os de su juventud.
texts.en:
Gerardo RamÃ³n S. R. is a 65 year old man who learned his craft as an adolescent and after 47 years of working still feels strong enough to â€œhang in there a bit longer.â€ He is a farmer and also buys and sells firewood and his crops. His children and grandchildren help him in his daily tasks. But he is sad about his spouseâ€™s illness who, because of advanced age, canâ€™t help him like in his younger years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 52 aÃ±os, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor Alan de 23 aÃ±os, quien siempre la ayuda en el trabajo. La actividad a la que Soledad se dedica es la venta de leÃ±a y es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Con 30 aÃ±os en este negocio desea para el futuro de su trabajo, incrementar la cantidad de leÃ±a que tiene para vender y asÃ­ tener plata para pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo, a quien cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no le falte nada. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia de venta es la alegrÃ­a que le pone a todo lo que hace, lo que menos le gusta es estar molesta y mÃ¡s aun si lo esta cuando vende, ya que no quiere alejar los clientes que ya tiene ganados. Es el octavo crÃ©dito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y se ha comprometido a pagarlo con todas las socias de su banco comunal. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ mÃ¡s madera para tener una buena reserva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad, 52, is a very hard working, sincere woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest son, Alan, 23, who always helps her with the work. Soledadâ€™s activity is firewood sales; she is highly sought after by her customers. She has been in this business for 30 years and wants for the future to increase the amount of firewood that she has on hand to sell in order to have enough money to pay for her sonâ€™s higher education. She has always cared for him lovingly and been concerned that he always has everything he needs. She enjoys chatting with her customers and always has a joke ready to get along with them better since her main sales strategy is the joy she puts into everything she does. What she most dislikes is being upset and more so when she is selling because she doesnâ€™t want to scare her customers away. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is happy to have gotten it and pledges to repay along with all the members of her communal bank. She will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy more wood in order to have a good reserve supply for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy more firewood.

loan.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Luisa Amanda tiene 48 aÃ±os de edad, su actividad econÃ³mica es brindar el servicio de taxi, con la ayuda de su esposo es que han logrado salir adelante, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento pues ha sido de muy buena ayuda. Ella estÃ¡ buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener su hogar, ya que inicio con fondos propios. Este crÃ©dito serÃ¡ invertido en cambio de llantas, pintura entre otras cosas. El desea obtener otro taxi y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda is 48 years old and provides taxi services. With the help of her husband, they have manages to get ahead. The loans have been of great help; this will not be her first one. She is looking for a way to increase her income to support her household. She started her business with her own funds and will use the money from this loan to buy new tires, paint, and other things. She would like to buy another taxi and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vehicle maintenance

loan.name: Faustino Gregorio

texts.es: El seÃ±or Faustino Gregorio C. G., tiene la edad de 42 aÃ±os habita en el barrio Pablo C., es casado y su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar y le apoya en los trabajos de la finca, ellos tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, que se dedican a estudiar la escuela secundaria, desde hace mas de 20 aÃ±os que se dedican a la agricultura, gracias al apoyo de la Reforma Agraria que lograron adquirir unos terrenos, ellos habitan en las faldas de un volcÃ¡n, pero los gases han afectado de sobremanera su producciÃ³n, es por esta razÃ³n que solicita un prÃ©stamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que permitan un mantenimiento mas optimo, con el objetivo de aumentar la producciÃ³n de sus cosechas para mejorar los volÃºmenes de venta que le aseguren mejores condiciones econÃ³micas para el buen desarrollo de sus hijos sobretodo los estudios del mayor que pronto entrara a la universidad y esperan tener los recursos necesarios para poyarlo en sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Faustino Gregorio C. G., 42, lives in the Pablo C. neighborhood. Heâ€™s married and his wifeâ€™s a housewife but she also helps him with the farm work. They have four minor children who go to secondary school. They have been in farming for over 20 years. They were able to acquire farmland thanks to the Agrarian Reform. They live on the slopes of a volcano and gases from it have greatly affected production. For this reason he is asking for funding to buy fertilizers, fungicides and farming supplies that will make it possible for him to give optimal maintenance to the soil hoping to increase production for better sales insuring higher income for his childrenâ€™s development, especially his eldestâ€™s educational expenses since he is soon to start university and they hope to have necessary funds to support his professional studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To provide optimal care to his fields.

loan.name: Ynocente

texts.es: Ynocente, de 47 aÃ±os, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mila de 45 aÃ±os y su Ãºnico hijo Renzo de 16 aÃ±os, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La siembra de papa, espinaca y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica Ynocente, todas las maÃ±anas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer mÃ¡s fÃ©rtiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, ya que saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educaciÃ³n de su hijo les demanda muchos gastos. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 32 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos dÃ­as, espera cosechar sus productos y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado. Este es el quinto crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ nuevas semillas de arveja, espinacas y papa, tambiÃ©n comprarÃ¡ abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ynocente is 47 years old and is a simple hard working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 45 year old Mila, and his only son, 16 year old Renzo. He wants to give them a better quality of life. He raises potatoes, spinach, and peas. Every morning, Ynocente works his land to make it more fertile and productive and he and his wife work together very hard. They know that they must work all they can because their sonâ€™s education is expensive. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and preventing them from getting disease. Heâ€™s been doing this for 32 years and he considers the most difficult part to be transporting his goods to the market in Tarma, where he sells his harvest. Within a few days he expects to harvest his current crops and sell them for a good price in the market. This will be his fifth loan through MFP and he knows that he must make all of his payments on time, so as not to cause problems for his communal bank. There his is a very responsible member. He will use the 2,000 PEN ($725) from this loan to buy new seed for peas, spinach, and potatoes. He will also buy fertilizer to care for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Seed and fertilizer

loan.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El seÃ±or Julio Cesar E. de 66 aÃ±os se ha dedicado desde su juventud a la elaboraciÃ³n de zapatos y es esta materia la que le ha servido para salir adelante y mantener a su familia, a pesar de su avanzada edad, nos cuenta que aÃºn tiene las fortalezas para preparar un encargo semanal o quincenal de zapatos y entregarlos en los departamentos del norte del paÃ­s que es donde principalmente comercializa sus productos.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar E., 66, has worked since he was young making shoes. This work has allowed him to get ahead and support his family. In spite of his advanced age, he tells us that he still has the strength to fill his weekly or bi-weekly orders for shoes and deliver them in departments (administrative regions) in the northern part of the country, which is where he sells most of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy materials to make shoes

loan.name: Yulver

texts.es: Yulver, de 36 aÃ±os, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Roselin de 30 aÃ±os y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los extensos campos de sembrado que posee Yulver, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y una firme convicciÃ³n de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembrÃ­os de la plaga que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 24 aÃ±os realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mÃ¡s difÃ­cil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil el traslado de sus productos. Este es el tercer crÃ©dito con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crÃ©dito le serÃ¡ muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprarÃ¡ abono para sus sembrÃ­os, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean mÃ¡s productivos.
texts.en:
Yulver, 36, is an unassuming, hard working man. He lives in his own house with his wife, Roselin, 30, and their two beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Yulverâ€™s extensive planted fields are the result of a lifetime of hard work and firm conviction to get ahead in life. His products are highly sought after in Tarmaâ€™s wholesale market because heâ€™s famous for producing high quality crops and this helps him sell for very good prices. What he most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from infestations that can damage them. He has been a farmer for 24 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the sack of potatoes and peas, which are very heavy and tire him out. In the future heâ€™d like to buy a car so that product transport will be easier. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial for his workâ€™s development. He is a cheerful member of his communal bank and he always imposes order during the meetings. He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy manure for his plantings so that his crops will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loan.name: Charlott Jeanethe

texts.es: Charlott Jeanethe M. R. de 30 aÃ±os se dedica desde hace tiempo ya a la venta de frijoles y leÃ±a en su casa de habitaciÃ³n. No es la primera vez que esta mujer abnegada realiza alguna actividad econÃ³mica para poder llevar un sustento a su casa, antes se dedicaba a la venta de refrescos y gaseosas pero despuÃ©s de un tiempo no pudo seguir y luego de una pausa iniciÃ³ con el que ahora es su negocio.
texts.en:
Charlott Jeanethe M. R., 30, has sold beans and firewood from home for a long time. This isnâ€™t the first time this selfless woman has undertaken economic activity in order to bring sustenance to her home. She used to sell soft drinks and beverages but after a time was unable to continue. After a break she started her current business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Naranjos lo integran Abimal Arsenio M., Francisca Teodora V. y Lino Nemecio M.. Abimal, quien es el coordinador del grupo se dedica desde hace 10 aÃ±os a la profesiÃ³n de sastre en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, el utilizarÃ¡ el crÃ©dito en la compra de tela y materiales para la elaboraciÃ³n de uniformes y demÃ¡s productos. Fancisca y Lino se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. municipal de Masaya.
texts.en:
Abimal Arsenio M., Francisca Teodora VelÃ¡squez and Lino Nemecio M. are the members of the â€œLos Naranjosâ€ (The Orange Trees) communal bank. Abimal, who is group Coordinator, has been a tailor for the last 10 years. His shop is in his house. He will use the loan to buy fabric and supplies to make uniforms and other products. Francisca and Lino are fruit and vegetable merchants in Masayaâ€™s Municipal Market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fabric.

loan.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Antonela lo conforman Lea Judith F. V., Ana de los Milagros F. B. y Claudia MarÃ­a A. B., tres mujeres con distintas actividades econÃ³micas que comparten la solidaridad y el empeÃ±o de seguir trabajando juntas.
Lea, quien es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de prendas de lujo como pulseras, anillos y cadenas de oro y plata; Ana en cambio vende ropa de manera ambulante en la comunidad de NindirÃ­ y finalmente Claudia vende cosmÃ©ticos y productos de las compaÃ±Ã­as AVON y ZERMAT a sus familiares, conocidos y recomendados.
texts.en:
The Antonela solidarity group is made up of Lea Judith F. V., Ana de los Milagros F. Beharano, and Claudia Maria A. B.. They are three women with distinct jobs who share in solidarity and determination to continue working together. Lea, the group coordinator, sells luxury items such as gold and silver bracelets, rings and chains. Ana sells clothing as a street vendor in the Nindiri community. Finally, Claudia sells cosmetics and Avon and Zermat products to her relatives, acquaintances and referrals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario MarÃ­a se encuentra conformado por MarÃ­a de JesÃºs R. T. de 40 aÃ±os, MarÃ­a Auxiliadora A. M. de 33 y Sonia del Carmen HernÃ¡ndez de 27 aÃ±os, tres fÃ©minas luchadoras del departamento de Masaya.
MarÃ­a de JesÃºs es la coordinadora y se dedica a la venta de ropa bordada para niÃ±as de manera ambulante en NindirÃ­ y Masaya, ella misma realiza los bordados y fabrica la ropa, dado que ya hace tiempo atrÃ¡s que aprendiÃ³ este oficio y decidiÃ³ sacarle provecho.
MarÃ­a Auxiliadora es fotÃ³grafa, tiene un estudio en su casa de habitaciÃ³n donde cualquiera puede llegar y solicitar sus servicios ya sea en el mismo local o a domicilio; finalmente Sonia, quien es la mÃ¡s joven estÃ¡ incursionando en el comercio de la venta de ropa, pero recibe buenos consejos de sus compaÃ±eras de grupo.
texts.en:
The MarÃ­a solidarity group is made up of MarÃ­a de JesÃºs R. T., age 40; MarÃ­a Auxiliadora A. M., age 33; and Sonia del Carmen HernÃ¡ndez, age 27. They are three hard-working women from the Masaya department. MarÃ­a de JesÃºs is the group coordinator, and she sells embroidered children's clothing in the street markets of Nindiri and Masaya. She does the embroidery herself and makes the clothing, since she learned the trade long ago and decided to take advantage of it. MarÃ­a Auxiliadora is a photographer. She has a studio in her home, where anyone can go and request her services, either in her location or in their homes. Finally, Sonia, who is the youngest member, is just entering into clothing sales, but she gets good advice from her group members.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of material

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco comunal â€œChojchoniâ€ desde hace dos aÃ±os, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 19 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Julia tiene un hijo de aÃ±o y siete meses. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la elaboraciÃ³n de antenas para televisiÃ³n, las lleva a vender a La Paz - Bolivia, asÃ­ mismo vende abarrotes en su tienda. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital en compra de abarrotes. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar su mercaderÃ­a y una parte en comprar alambres para elaboraciÃ³n de antenas. Su visiÃ³n es comprar mÃ¡quinas de coser para confeccionar ropas en La Paz - Bolivia. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las reuniones y las conversaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the community bank named Chojchoni for the past 2 years. She lives in the district of Copani located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 19 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. She graduated high school. Julia has a 19-month old son. She works together with her boyfriend, making antennas for television. She sells them in La Paz, Bolivia. She also sells groceries from her store. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles she purchased grocery store items for her store. She requests a new loan in the amount of 2500 neuvos soles and it will be used to increase her merchandise and to purchase wire to make antennas. Her dream is to purchase sewing machines to make clothing in La Paz. What she most likes about the community bank is the meetings and the talks that are given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase grocery store items and wire to make tv antennas.

loan.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 52 aÃ±os, es una madre de familia con mucho coraje, vive en su casa propia, en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo, sus 6 hijos y sus 9 nietos, por quienes se esfuerza a diario. Durante toda su vida vendÃ­a comida y siempre estuvo al pendiente de las obras de construcciÃ³n, como: el proyecto de alcantarillado, reparaciÃ³n de pistas y demÃ¡s obras pÃºblicas,, para que pueda ofrecer su platillos a los trabajadores e ingenieros de dichas obras, siendo al final el pago cada fin de semana. Actualmente y con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, lograron instalar cabinas para ofrecer el servicio de Internet, en donde sus nietos la ayudan en la atenciÃ³n de sus clientes, controlando el tiempo que tiene utilizando el servicio. Como si fuera, esa emprendedora mujer, trabaja tambiÃ©n los sÃ¡bados y domingo, vendiendo parrillas y polladas, ya que es el negocio que mÃ¡s le apasiona hacer. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar el segundo piso de su casa y poder trasladarse toda su familia para su comodidad propia. Este es su dÃ©cimo crÃ©dito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas como lo estuvo haciendo con los demÃ¡s prestamos, puesto que sabe que le es de mucha utilidad. Con este crÃ©dito que solicita, colocarÃ¡ rejas para cercar los perÃ­metros de la puerta de su casa, para proteger su negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a 52-year-old mother who has a lot of courage. She lives in her own home with her husband and their 6 children and 9 grandchildren, for whom she strives daily. She has sold food all her life, and she has always kept on the lookout for construction sites, such as sewer projects, road repairs and public works, so that she can offer her dishes to the workers and engineers. Currently, with the help of her husband and children, they have been able to build stalls to offer an internet service. Her grandchildren help attend to these customers, monitoring the time that customers use this service. This enterprising woman also works on Saturdays and Sundays, selling grilled food and barbecued chicken, since this is the business that she is most passionate about. Her greatest wish is to expand the second floor of her house and be able to spread out her family for everyone's personal comfort. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she promises to repay all of the quotas as she has repaid the previous loans, since she knows that this is very useful. With the requested loan, she will install bars around the perimeter of her home, to protect her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Installing bars to protect her house and business

loan.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Monte Verde es coordinado por Juana Mercedes M. N. de 23 aÃ±os, ella vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya desde hace mÃ¡s de 2 aÃ±os, su giro principal es comprar cosechas completas para revender al por mayor y al menudeo. Las otras integrantes del grupo son, Lizett Marbelly LÃ³pez y Rogelio JosÃ© Abulto P., ellos al igual que su coordinadora venden frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The Monte Verde solidarity group is coordinated by Juana Mercedes M. N., age 23. She has sold fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of the city of Masaya for over 2 years. She mainly buys whole harvests to resell at wholesale and retail prices. The other group members are Lizett Marbelly LÃ³pez and Rogelio JosÃ© Abulto P.. They, like their coordinator, sell fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: for the purchase of merchandise for her clothing sales business

loan.name: Sidey

texts.es: Sidey Q. R., tiene la edad de 28 aÃ±os, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar almacigo de cafÃ© para sembrarlo y aumentar la cantidad de cafÃ© en producciÃ³n a su beneficio y de terreno en uso. AdemÃ¡s, su finca ya tiene una parte de cafÃ© la cual quiere resembrar para mejorarla y a su vez sembrar una parte del terreno que se perdiÃ³ por falta de mantenimiento en aÃ±os atrÃ¡s. Tiene varios aÃ±os que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer prÃ©stamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenÃ­a problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. TambiÃ©n, ella no ha realizados otros prÃ©stamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindÃ³ el prÃ©stamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interÃ©s es mucho mÃ¡s baja. Ella tambiÃ©n tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educaciÃ³n necesaria para que sean en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil la vida.
texts.en:
Sidey Q. R., age 28, is married and has 2 children who are her highest priority. She wants to purchase coffee seeds to plant and increase her coffee production. On her farm, there is already an area seeded with coffee, which she wants to re-seed in order to improve it. She also wants to sow an area of land that she lost for lack of maintenance a few years ago. She has been a farmer for several years and she wants to expand. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had problems with her property, but she wants to have a productive farm. Also, she has not received any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. She also wants to offer her children the necessary education so that in the future they will be prepared and more able to handle life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: coffee planting

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Banco comunal â€œVirgen del Rosarioâ€ desD. hace ocho aÃ±os, pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 42 aÃ±os D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con grado D. instrucciÃ³n primaria incompleta, tiene dos hijos que son independientes. Julia se dedica a la compra - venta D. sacos D. yute (tela) al por mayor y menor en las ferias D.: Yunguyo, Desaguadero y Chaca chaca. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentÃ³ su capital D. trabajo. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para comprar sacos D. yute. Su visiÃ³n es tener una tienda D. abarrotes. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los prÃ©stamos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past two years. She lives in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 42 years old and she is married. She did not finish graD. school. She has two children who are grown and independent. Julia buys and sells jute burlap sacks in wholesale and retail at different fairs in Yunguyo, Desaguadero and in Chaca Chaca. Her first loan requested from Manuela R. (Kiva Field Partner) was used as working capital. This new loan requested is in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase more burlap sacks. Her dream is to have a grocery store. What she most likes about her community bank are the loans and savings programs.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase burlap to make sacks.

loan.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is an entrepreneur who makes a living selling socks, lingerie, tops, shirts and other items at the Albion Market in her home town of Uzhgorod. She has been in business for 15 years, and has many loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her merchandise and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She earns about 5,000 Grivnas in profit each month.
Ildika has used micro-loans in the past and found them to be a very useful way to expand her business. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Grivnas to increase the size and scope of the items she has to sell. She would like to buy clothing for the fall season so that she can increase her sales and make additional income.

loan.use: to purchase additional items to sell to her customers

loan.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Rey de Reyes lo integran Mirna MarÃ­a LÃ³pez M. de 29 aÃ±os, Virginia del Carmen RodrÃ­guez MartÃ­nez de 41 y Ayda Lea GonzÃ¡lez GonzÃ¡lez de 35. Mirna, la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frituras y platanitos de manera ambulante en su comunidad y en los colegios aledaÃ±os. Virginia, vende leÃ±a y carbÃ³n en su casa de habitaciÃ³n; y Ayda se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos por catalogo y ademÃ¡s vende hielo y helados en su casa.
Estas mujeres desean aumentar su capital de trabajo e invertirÃ¡n el monto prestado en la compra de mÃ¡s materia prima para seguir laborando.

Mirna MarÃ­a LÃ³pez M., 29, Virginia del Carmen RodrÃ­guez MartÃ­nez, 41,and Ayda Lea GonzÃ¡lez GonzÃ¡lez, 35, make up the â€œRey de Reyesâ€ (King of Kings) communal bank. Mirna is group Coordinator. She sells fried snacks and fried banana chips throughout her community and nearby schools. Virginia sells firewood and charcoal from home and Ayda sells catalogue cosmetics and also sells ice and ice cream in her home. These women aim to increase their working capital and will invest the total loan in the purchase of more ingredients and raw materials to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Mil Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mil se encuentra conformado por MarÃ­a Esther PÃ©rez B., Lesbia Marina PÃ©rez B. y Karla Patricia PÃ©rez, tres mujeres emprendedoras y con deseos de superaciÃ³n. Ella iniciÃ³ hace tres aÃ±os cuando le encargaron una ropa y ella la compro y vendiÃ³, posteriormente decidiÃ³ dedicarse a esta actividad.
Lesbia, es docente de artes y ha laborado por mÃ¡s de 20 aÃ±os en esta actividad en distintas instituciones ONGÂ´s; y Karla diseÃ±a, elabora y vende bisuterÃ­a, al igual que la venta de perfumerÃ­a, cosmÃ©ticos y demÃ¡s productos de las compaÃ±Ã­as AVON y ZERMAT.

MarÃ­a Esther PÃ©rez B., Lesbia Marina PÃ©rez B. and Karla Patricia PÃ©rez, three enterprising women with a desire for self-improvement, make up the Mil (Thousand) communal bank. MarÃ­a Esther, group Coordinator, sells clothes and cosmetics that she buys at wholesale in the market for subsequent resale at retail. She started three years ago when she got orders for clothes and she bought them and sold them. Later on she decided to go into this business. Lesbia is an arts teacher and has worked for over 20 years in this activity for various NGOs. Karla designs, makes and sells costume jewelry. She also sells AVON and ZERMAT brand cosmetics and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Desididas Group

texts.es:

Yolanda, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica desde su casa de habitaciÃ³n a la venta de carne de res y hueso, ella desea incursionar en la venta de carne porcina y es Ã©ste el propÃ³sito del prÃ©stamo otorgado. Claudia, se dedica a la fabricaciÃ³n y venta de nacatamales los dÃ­as jueves, viernes y fines de semana; y finalmente Elizabeth, se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos y ropa nueva de manera ambulante en las cercanÃ­as de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda del Carmen S., Claudia Leticia GÃ³mez M. and Elizabeth del Carmen O. C., three women with distinct economic activities but with the common goal to continue progressing both in life and in business, make up the â€œDesididasâ€ (Decided Ones) communal bank. Yolanda is the group Coordinator and sells beef and soup bones from home. She wants to start selling pork and this is the purpose of the granted loan. Claudia makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) for sale on Thursdays, Fridays and weekends. And finally, Elizabeth sells cosmetic and new clothing around her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Barrio Loco Group

El grupo solidario Barrio Loco se encuentra integrado por Clara Isabel GarcÃ­a Z. de 32 aÃ±os, Claudia VerÃ³nica E. R. de 34 aÃ±os y Carlos Antonio HernÃ¡ndez F. de 27 aÃ±os. Ella iniciÃ³ hace apenas medio aÃ±o a dedicarse a esto; antes era ama de casa pero por la situaciÃ³n econÃ³mica decidiÃ³ buscar trabajo en la zona franca y estuvo ahÃ­ por casi un aÃ±o. Esta joven mujer de 32 aÃ±os recibe ayuda de su hija mayor de 15 aÃ±os en sus actividades comerciales y su meta es ver triunfadores a sus 5 hijos.
Claudia, vende productos ESKIMO en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, asÃ­ mismo vende perfumes los cuales muchas veces son encargados. Carlos, es albaÃ±il y tambiÃ©n vende productos ESKIMO en su casa, asÃ­ mismo en su hogar vende carnes. Este es el ejemplo de tres personas luchadoras que buscan distintas actividades econÃ³micas para lograr llevar una mejor calidad de vida a sus respectivos hogares.
texts.en:
Clara Isabel GarcÃ­a Z., 32, Claudia VerÃ³nica E. R., 34, and Carlos Antonio HernÃ¡ndez F., 27, are the members of â€œBarrio Locoâ€ (Crazy Neighborhood) communal bank. Clara, group Coordinator, sells AVON products and new and used clothing three days a week. She has a set route that she covers each time with small, one or two block detours, to get new customers. She just started half a year ago; she used to be a housewife but due to the economic situation she decided to find work in the free zone and was there for almost a year. This young 32-year-old gets help with her activities from her 15-year-old daughter. Her goal is to see her five children succeed. Claudia sells ESKIMO products from home; she also sells perfumes that are sometimes ordered from her. Carlos is a bricklayer and also sells ESKIMO products from home where he also sells meats. These are three examples of tenacious people who seek different economic activities to attain a better quality of life for their respective homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Geraldin Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Geraldin lo conforman Reina Patricia MÃ¡tuz GarcÃ­a de 47 aÃ±os, Maclovia del Carmen HernÃ¡ndez LÃ³pez de 36 aÃ±os y Blanca Rosa HernÃ¡ndez Ãlvarez de 36 aÃ±os, tres mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a trabajar para darle una vida mejor a sus familias.
Reina, la coordinadora del grupo elabora tortillas desde que tenÃ­a 15 aÃ±os de edad cuando le ayudaba a su mamÃ¡ y a esa edad ella iniciÃ³ su camino a la independencia econÃ³mica; ya con 32 aÃ±os de experiencia ella desea poner en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, que es donde fabrica las tortillas, una especie de cafetÃ­n donde pueda vender cafÃ©, refrescos y bocadillos.
Maclovia, junto a su conyugue, se dedica a la compra/venta de chatarra, inicio hace 12 cuando su esposo, que trabajaba en un chatarrerÃ­a, decidiÃ³ iniciar el giro de negocio que mÃ¡s conocÃ­a por cuenta propia. En cambio Blanca, posee una pulperÃ­a la cual iniciÃ³ hace 10 aÃ±os como una pequeÃ±a ventecita de granos bÃ¡sicos.

The support group Geraldin is made up of Reina Patricia MÃ¡tuz GarcÃ­a who is 47 years old, Maclovia del Carmen HernÃ¡ndez LÃ³pez who is 36 years old and Blanca Rosa HernÃ¡ndez Ãlvarez who is also 36 years old. The three enterprising woman are dedicated to working to give their families better lives. Reina, the coordinator of the group has been making tortillas since she was 15 when she helped her mother. It was at that age that she began her journey to economic independence. Now, with 32 years of experience, she wants to build a small cafe in her house, where she makes the tortillas, so she can sell coffee, sodas and sandwiches. Maclovia, together with her spouse, works buying and selling junk food. She and her husband began doing this 12 years ago and they work in a junk food shop. Maclovia decided to begin this line of business that is very well known on its own. On the other hand, Blanca owns a local store which she began 10 years ago as a small shop that sold basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy consumables

loan.name: Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Alfarero lo integran Irene Auxiliadora T. U. de 39 aÃ±os, Heydi Natalia R. U. de 22 aÃ±os y Fabiola del Carmen B. M. de 27 aÃ±os; tres mujeres que han sabido hacerle frente a la vida a pesar de afrontarla a temprana edad.
Irene, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica desde hace 3 aÃ±os a la compra/venta de oro y plata, iniciÃ³ con poco capital propio invirtiendo en algunas prendas y revendiÃ©ndolas a un precio mayor y en esta ocasiÃ³n utilizarÃ¡ el crÃ©dito que le brinda la instituciÃ³n para la compra de prendas de mayor valor. Heydi es estilista en su hogar y a domicilio, ademÃ¡s vende ropa en su casa de habitaciÃ³n; por otro lado Fabiola tiene en su hogar una venta de gaseosas, cervezas y productos ESKIMO.

The communal bank Alfarero is composed of Irene Auxiliadora T. U., 39 years old, Heydi Natalia R. U., 22 years old, and Fabiola del Carmen B. M., 27 years old, three women who have learned to manage in life despite being young. Irene, who is the coordinator, has been buying and selling gold and silver for a living for 3 years. She started, with a little of her own capital, by buying jewelry and reselling it for a higher price. She will use this loan to buy higher value jewelry. Heydi works at home as a stylist in addition to selling clothing out of her home. Fabiola sells soda, beer and Eskimo products out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: La Esquinita Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Esquinita estÃ¡ integrado por Mirna Lorena L. ElÃ­as, Arianne Liceth Gudiel SÃ¡nchez y Rosario del Socorro R.. Mirna, quien es coordinadora, posee en su casa de habitaciÃ³n una pulperÃ­a que iniciÃ³ hace 8 aÃ±os vendiendo pan y algunas verduras. Su sueÃ±o es verse a sÃ­ misma y a sus hijos en prosperidad.
Arianne, vende por catÃ¡logo ropa Ã­ntima y productos ZERMAT; en cambio Rosario, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y productos de AVON, a la vez tiene una mini venta de verduras en su casa de habitaciÃ³n.

The La Esquinita solidarity group is made up of Mirna Lorena L. ElÃ­as, Arianne Liceth Gudiel SÃ¡nchez and Rosario del Socorro R.. Mirna, who is the coordinator, has a general store in her home, which she started 8 years ago selling bread and some vegetables. Her dream is to see herself and her children in prosperity. Arianne sells lingerie and ZERMAT products through a catalogue. Rosario sells second-hand clothing and AVON products. She also has a small vegetable sales business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es:

Maria Luisa LÃ³pez MorÃ¡n, de 35 aÃ±os de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo y se dedica a la venta de productos AVON y ZERMAT, asÃ­ como a la venta de otros cosmÃ©ticos y accesoR. de uso personal que compra en el mercado al por mayor. Su sueÃ±o es reparar su casa de habitaciÃ³n y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
Maria Auxiliadora R. M., realiza todo tipo de trabajos de corte y confecciÃ³n en su hogar, ademÃ¡s tiene 4 aÃ±os de vender productos AVON; Rosa Emilia LÃ³pez MorÃ¡n tiene un trabajo fijo como domÃ©stica y tambiÃ©n vende por encargo electrodomÃ©sticos, ropa interior y zapatos; Vilma Esther Cerna Bonilla vende en su casa de habitaciÃ³n helados y chocobananos ademÃ¡s es distribuidora de hielo para algunas comiderÃ­as del sector; finalmente Engracia de la ConcepciÃ³n MorÃ¡n vende cosmÃ©ticos por catÃ¡logo y accesoR. de uso personal que compra en el mercado.
texts.en:
The Mi Banquito solidarity group is made up of 5 hard-working and enterprising women who strive day to day to get ahead in their different businesses. Maria Luisa L. M., age 35, is the group coordinator and sells AVON and ZERMAT products. She also sells other cosmetics and personal accessories which she buys wholesale in the market. Her dream is to repair her house, and for her children to be professionals. Maria Auxiliadora R. M. does all types of sewing and tailoring work in her home, and she has been selling AVON products for 4 years. Rosa Emilia LÃ³pez MorÃ¡n has a steady job as a maid and also sells home appliances on order, and underwear and shoes. Vilma Esther Cerna Bonilla sells ice cream and chocolate bananas in her home, and she also distributes ice for some local eateries. Finally, Engracia de la ConcepciÃ³n MorÃ¡n sells cosmetics through a catalogue, and personal accessories that she purchases in the market.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

texts.es: DoÃ±a EloÃ­sa JazmÃ­n ChÃ¡vez SÃ¡nchez de 47 aÃ±os de edad tiene en su casa de habitaciÃ³n una pequeÃ±a tienda de ropa usada donde tambiÃ©n vende bisuterÃ­as, ella iniciÃ³ comprando una paca de ropa hace 6 aÃ±os y vendiÃ©ndole a conocidos y vecinos. El Ãºnico problema econÃ³mico que tiene es que hay temporadas bajas pero en ellas se auxilia con la clientela fija.

EloÃ­sa JazmÃ­n ChÃ¡vez SÃ¡nchez, age 47, has a small used clothing store in her home where she also sells costume jewelery. She started her business 6 years ago, buying a package of clothing and selling it to acquaintances and neighbours. Her youngest daughter, age 28, helps her in the store. Her goal is to have enough capital to rent another venue in a good location and open another store in it, with one of the stores attended by her and the other by her daughter. Her only economic problem is the low season, but during this she is sustained by her steady customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

B. de 53 aÃ±os fue trabajadora de una importante instituciÃ³n bancaria del paÃ­s, por problemas de salud fue jubilada antes de tiempo y desde ese entonces se dedica a la venta de productos de las marcas AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME, pero sobre todo LOVABLE; sus principales clientes son ex compaÃ±eras y ex compaÃ±eros de trabajo. Ella ademÃ¡s de los ingresos por venta de estos productos tambiÃ©n recibe su pensiÃ³n. Su objetivo es poder seguir trabajando mientras Dios le de las fuerzas para hacerlo.

Rosario de FÃ¡tima R. B., age 53, worked in an important banking institution of Nicaragua, but due to health problems she retired. Since then she has sold AVON, ZERMAT and ORIFLAME products; but mostly LOVABLE brand products. Her main customers are her former co-workers. She receives a pension on top of the income from these products. Her goal is to keep working as long as God gives her the strength to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: the purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: the purchase of consumables

loan.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
DoÃ±a Petrona del Carmen PÃ©rez SÃ¡nchez de 53 aÃ±os de edad vende ropa de segunda mano en su comunidad, ella sale a vender de manera ambulante dÃ­a de por medio, ademÃ¡s vende nacatamales los dÃ­as viernes, sÃ¡bados y domingos. Ella antes de dedicarse a esta actividad realizaba viajes al norte del paÃ­s y compraba queso para revenderlo acÃ¡ en Managua; sin embargo Ã©sta actividad econÃ³mica no le resultaba en ciertas temporadas, principalmente lluviosas asÃ­ que decidiÃ³ cambiar de giro de negocio.
DoÃ±a Petrona con el crÃ©dito otorgado piensa cambiar nuevamente su actividad econÃ³mica, dedicÃ¡ndose ahora a la venta de granos bÃ¡sicos. Su sueÃ±o es que Dios le ayude a realizarse en sus planes de negocio y que pueda seguir adelante.

Petrona del Carmen PÃ©rez SÃ¡nchez, 53, sells used clothes in her community. She goes out on her selling runs every other day. She also sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. Before going into this business she would travel to the north of the country to buy cheese to resell in Managua. However, this activity didnâ€™t have positive results in some seasons, especially during the rainy season, so she decided to change lines of work. She will use the loan to once again change jobs. Now she will sell basic grains. She dreams that God will help her bring her business plans to fruition so that she can continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise.

loan.name: Irma Del Socorro

Su meta para el futuro es que su negocio se haga aÃºn mÃ¡s grande.
texts.en:
Irma del Socorro M. has had a grocery store in her home for the last 6 years. In her youth she was a domestic employee and worked at whatever activity or economic opportunity came her way. After selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) she decided to try her luck selling meneitos (cheese puffs), cigarettes and yoghurt snacks. For a long time this is how she remained but with the first loan she got her business started to grow. Her goal for the future is that her store be even larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Mariana Del Carmen
