texts.en:
Mariana del Carmen GarcÃ­a A., 51, owns a snack bar. She started the business about 6 years ago selling fried snacks. Then, with help from her son-in-law and loans she had gotten, she bought fixed assets like tables and chairs. She even roofed and tiled part of the locale. She plans to use the new loan to finish tiling and to buy more products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy products.

loan.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel B. DÃ­az es dueÃ±o y conductor de una moto taxi en Ciudad Sandino, el iniciÃ³ hace 6 aÃ±os cuando decidiÃ³ comprar su propio medio de transporte despuÃ©s de trabajar vendiendo repuestos de vehÃ­culos por 12 aÃ±os. El piensa utilizar el crÃ©dito otorgado para darle mantenimiento al que hoy es su principal fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel B. DÃ­az is the owner and driver of a moto taxi in Ciudad Sandino. He began this business 6 years ago when he decided to buy his own form of transportation after he worked selling spare parts for vehicles for 12 years. He wants to use the loan granted to him to maintain his vehicle, which today is his main form of work.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Vehicle repairs

loan.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa R. M. es una mujer joven, quien es dueÃ±a de una miscelÃ¡nea y venta de licor la cual adquiriÃ³ desde hace 2 aÃ±os gracias a la inversiÃ³n que hicieron sus padres. Esta mujer ahora puede sentirse realizada gracias a que puede ocupar su tiempo en cosas productivas y que lleven ingresos a su hogar. Ella utilizarÃ¡ el crÃ©dito otorgado en la compra de distintos productos de mucho movimiento en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Vanesa R. M. is a young woman who owns a general store; she also sells liquor. She got it two years ago thanks to an investment her parents made. She can now feel fulfilled because she can use her time in productive activities that produce income for her home. She will use the loan to buy various types of products that sell well in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy products.

loan.name: Esperanza En Ti 1 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group Esperanza en ti 1 (Hope on you). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to buy a computer for my children and to finish studying. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work. She started very young and she likes it a lot.
Altagracia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for nine years. She started selling in her Mom's business. After some years, she become the owner and had some loans which she used to pay daily. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pork meats and seasonings. Then she will produce sausage to sell. She will use the profits to build a wall for her house and in a short time, wants to finish building her house.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she had a first one and liked the facilities and learned a little more about business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loan.use: To buy pork meat

loan.name: Mery

texts.es: La SeÃ±ora Mery es una persona muy joven, tiene un pequeÃ±o hijo de tres meses, su esposo trabaja en un restaurante, ella trabaja con el comercio vendiendo poleras juveniles de marcas conocidas, ella reparte su mercaderÃ­a en los mercados conocidos y populosos de nuestra ciudad y esta feliz ya que con el crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ incrementar su capital ya que quiere comprar mercaderÃ­a de temporada, es muy trabajadora a su corta edad pero el hecho de ser Madre apresuro su madurez.
texts.en:
Mery is a young person who has a baby son who is 3 months old. Her husband works in a restaurant and she works as a merchant selling brand-name children's shirts. She distributes her merchandise in the busy and well-known markets in her city. She is happy that with this loan she will be able to increase her capital, since she wants to buy seasonal merchandise. She is very hardworking for such a young person, but becoming a mother made her mature more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy seasonal clothing and jewelry

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 46 aÃ±os, es una madre de familia muy tierna y amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos a quienes los adora. Hace muchos aÃ±os atrÃ¡s se dedicaba en la venta de productos comestibles y a falta de variedad en productos fue perdiendo clientes. Desde entonces hace 2 aÃ±os, se dedica en la preparaciÃ³n y venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas (papas y pollo frito), en la puerta de su casa. Sus clientes son sus vecinos que gustan de su sazÃ³n, casi siempre suelen comprarle muy seguido a su establecimiento, ya que los precios que ofrece son muy asequibles. Esta muy contenta con su actividad, ya que por las maÃ±ana se dedica a labores domesticas, mÃ¡s que los fines de semana sus ventas se duplican mÃ¡s de lo habitual. En adelante piensa instalar su bodega en su misma casa, para diversificar su negocio, con la venta de gaseosas, galletas y demÃ¡s productos comestibles. Este es su treceavo crÃ©dito con MFP, y sabe que el crÃ©dito le serÃ¡ muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Juana piensa invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de madera y listones de maderas, para dividir su casa, asimismo desea comprarse un balÃ³n de gas adicional.
texts.en:
Juana, 46, is a tender and loving mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and four children whom she adores. Many years ago she used to sell foodstuffs but due to poor variety of available items gradually lost customers. Since two years ago she has prepared Salchipapas (fried potatoes and fried chicken) and hamburgers to sell in her front yard. Her customers are neighbors that enjoy her seasoning; they tend to come often to consume from her establishment because prices are accessible. She is very happy with her work because she can tend to her domestic chores in the morning and even more because on weekends her sales are double the usual. In the future she plans to install a grocery store in her home in order to diversify her business selling soft drinks, cookies and other food items. This is her 13th loan with MFP. She knows that the loan will be very beneficial to increase working capital so she pledges to repay on time. Juana plans to use the requested loan to buy lumber and wood slats to make room divisions in her house; she also wants to buy an additional container of gas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy lumber to make room divisions in her house as well as to buy a container of gas.

loan.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El seÃ±or Adolfo tiene 37 aÃ±os de edad, esta en pareja con la Sra. Adriana de profesiÃ³n comerciante. Tienen 2 hijos, ambos menores, uno de ellos cursa la educaciÃ³n primaria y el otro cuenta con dos aÃ±os de vida. El seÃ±or Adolfo junto con su esposa se dedican a la venta de golosinas y artÃ­culos comestibles en los diferentes negocios como: despensas, copetines, casillas, cantinas de colegios entre otros. A esta actividad se dedican hace 10 aÃ±os aproximadamente, se iniciaron con la venta ambulante en bolsos, luego adquirieron su primer mÃ³vil y asÃ­ empezaron a cubrir como mÃ­nimo a tres ciudades cercanas. Actualmente tiene una clientela formada que gracias a la comodidad y los buenos precios de sus productos se mantiene en este rubro tan competitivo. Solicita el prÃ©stamo para la compra de mercaderÃ­as tales como: galletitas, golosinas, papas fritas, jugos en polvo, caramelos, chicles, pilas, gomas y aumentar su inventario de mercaderÃ­as de electrodomÃ©sticos.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 37 years old and he is married with Adriana, a merchant. They have 2 small children and one if going to primary school. The other is only 2 years old. Adolfo together with his wife sell snacks and grocery items to various businesses such as grocery stores, stands, cafeterias, and canteens in schools. He has had this business for about 10 years, having started out by selling in door to door. They soon acquired their first car and started to visit the three closest cities. He has a steady client base now thanks to the convenience and good prices offered, helping maintain his position in the competitive market. He requests a loan to purchase merchandise, including: cookies, candies, chips, juice powders, caramels, gum, batteries, erasers and to supplement his stock of household products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase cookies, chips, drink powders, caramels, gum, batteries, and erasers.

loan.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMataro Chicoâ€ ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja, provincia D. AzÃ¡ngaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 49 aÃ±os D. edad, estÃ¡ casada y tiene 05 hijos (04 dependientes y 01 independiente), la seÃ±ora solo tiene estudios D. primaria incompleto(5to).
La seÃ±ora Juliana esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 meses, nos cuenta que con el prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales menores.
En la actualidad la seÃ±ora solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirÃ¡ para comprar mas animales para luego engordarlas y poder venderlas en las ferias, tambiÃ©n nos cuenta que se ayuda con la chacra.
Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es aumentar el capital D. su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the community bank "Mataro Chico" located in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja in the province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 49 years old and she is married and has 5 children (4 are dependent and 1 is independent). She has a graD. 5 education. Juliana has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 months. She says that with the first loan that Manuela Ramos granted her was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and she supplemented her working capital with those funds. Her business is buying and selling small farm animals. She requests a new loan in the amount of 500 neuvos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more livestock to raise and resell later in fairs. She also has a plantation. Her dreams for the future are to increase her working capital and improve her earnings. What she most enjoys about the community bank are the meetings and the talks given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase livestock.

loan.name: Marianna

texts.en:
Marianna is divorced with a six-year-old son. She owns a small business selling food at the local market in Uzhgorod town. Marianna started this business several years ago. She decided to choose a food business because the demand does not depend much on the season or other factors. The store she rents is located in a good spot at the market, brining many clients who buy food from her.
Marianna is a very open person. She is able to provide excellent client service. People love to buy from her and come back again. Recently Marianna was able to increase the space at her store. She needs a loan to purchase more inventories to put on her new shelves. Also, she is going to use part of the loan to purchase a refrigerator.

loan.use: To purchase a refrigerator and additional inventory

loan.name: Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. AngÃ©lica tiene 56 aÃ±os y su actividad es alquileres de piezas y tambiÃ©n de casas, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijas dos ellas ya son casadas y una es la que se quedo a su cargo y estÃ¡ estudiando. Como tiene todo el tiempo libre una ves una de sus inquilinas le recomendÃ³ que haga comidas para la venta los fines de semana especialmente, empezÃ³ un sÃ¡bado y domingo luego los clientes le pedÃ­an que haga para todos los dÃ­as el cual tuvo mucho Ã©xito y el crÃ©dito solicitado fue destinado a la compra de un congelador para poder tener en mayor cantidad las cosas. Agradece a la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya por el apoyo y la realizaciÃ³n de dicho emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Angelica is 56 years old and she engages in renting rooms and houses; she is a widow and has three daughters: two are married and one is a student and is still economically dependent on her. She has a lot of free time, and one of her tenants recommended to her to prepare and sell food especially during the week-ends: she did so one Saturday and one Sunday, and her customers asked her to prepare and sell food every day, and the activity was a great success. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a freezer in order to be able to store a wider variety of items. She is thankful to FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya for their support in the realization of this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a freezer.

loan.name: Candida Cruz

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Candida desde sus inicios, dice que le gusta su actividad, ella estÃ¡ a cargo del negocio como es una carpinterÃ­a. Ella tiene 3 hijos pero solamente 1 estÃ¡ a su cargo, pues los otros le ayudan con el negocio, nos cuenta que ha pasado por muchos problemas como fue la enfermedad de su esposo y fue por medio Ã©l que establecen este negocio, que mas tarde es ella quien administra, pues ha luchado para mantenerlo, porque necesita ingresos para el hogar. Este crÃ©dito lo va a utilizar para comprar madera, pega, junco, barniz, clavos y otros ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para obtener ganancias y generar empleos.
texts.en:
Candida says that she likes her work. She is a carpenter and is in charge of the business. She has 3 children, but only 1 is under her care; the others help her with the business. She tells us that she has had many problems, such as the illness of her husband. He established the business and later she became the manager. She has fought to maintain it, because she needs income for her home. She will use this loan to buy wood, glue, reeds, varnish, nails and other items, as she has many orders. She wants to expand her business to make profits and create jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: working capital

loan.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas 2 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con suenos y metas 2 (Women with Dreams and goals). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house with a concrete block structure. It is still wood and she needs a stronger structure. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work.
Paulina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year and a half, starting because her husband built a stand to sell goods and she heard about Esperanza loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying soda, cookies, fruits, vegetables, snacks and candies, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loan.use: To buy goods for her food stall

loan.name: Lelia

texts.es:
Lelia es socia del Banco comunal â€œLas Retamasâ€ desde hace seis aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene estudios superior incompleto. Lelia tiene tres hijos.
Actualmente se dedica a la artesanÃ­a, elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir, vende a los turistas nacionales e internacionales en el Hotel â€œTAYPI HUASIâ€. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, invirtiÃ³ en su negocio de comida rÃ¡pida que vendÃ­a en ese entonces.
Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizarÃ¡ para comprar lana de alpaca. Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanÃ­a. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
Notese en la foto junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Lelia has been a member of the Banco Comunal â€œLas Retamasâ€ ("Broom flowers" Communal Bank) for six years; she lives in the Puno district (located in a province and region bearing the same name), she is 40 years old, she is married and has attended high school but did not complete her studies. Lelia has three children. She is currently engaged in craftsmanship, preparing every type of items of clothing that she then sells to national and international tourist at the Taypi Huasi Hotel. The first loan she requested to Movimiento Manuela Ramos, amounting to 300.00 PEN, was used to invest in her fast food shop, activity she was running at that time. She will request a new loan of 1000.00 PEN that she will use to buy Alpaca wool. In the future she desires to own a craftsmanship shop; the savings are what she likes the most about her Communal Bank. In the picture she is portrayed together with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy Alpaca wool

loan.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia, de 64 aÃ±os, es divorciada, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus 2 hijos y sus nietas. Por algunos aÃ±os vendÃ­a dulces en los paraderos de buses, pero lo tuvo que dejar debido a los obstÃ¡culos generados por sus competidores, entonces han transcurrido 4 aÃ±os para dedicarse a la preparaciÃ³n de salchipapas (frituras de pollo y papas), platillos que los vende por las tardes y que gustan a la gente. El punto de su negocio es en la puerta de su casa, en la que con mucha paciencia atiende desde las 6:00pm hasta 11:00 de la noche a sus vecinos, quienes son asiduos clientes, que gustan de la higiene y su buena sazÃ³n. Se siente feliz con su negocio; ya que no tiene mucha competencia cercana, y eso le favorece mucho en las ganancias. En adelante anhela instalar un restaurante en su casa. Este es su doceavo crÃ©dito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, podrÃ¡ comprarse una vitrina y sillas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Mauricia, age 64, is divorced. She is a hard-working mother and lives in her own home with her 2 children and her grandchildren. For some years she sold candies at bus stops, but she had to stop because of the obstacles generated by her competition. Now, for 4 years she has prepared salchipapas (fried chicken and potatoes), a dish that she sells in the afternoons and that people like. She sells from the door of her home, which she does with great patience from 6:00 pm to 11:00 pm. She sells to her neighbours, who are regular customers and like her cleanliness and the flavour of her food. She is happy with her business; since there is not much competition nearby, her earnings are good. In the future she wants to open up a restaurant in her home. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she promises to repay all of her quotas on time, since she wants to have future help. With the loan that she is requesting, she will be able to purchase a display cabinet and chairs to better set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: to buy display cabinets and chairs to set up her business

loan.name: Liliana

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana tiene tiene 31 aÃ±os y tiene una despensa con panaderÃ­a, pero el tema D. la despensa esta dejando porque la panaderÃ­a esta teniendo mas Ã©xito,su marido trabaja con ella en el reparto y para ello cuenta con una motocarro. El cliente estÃ¡ solicitando el crÃ©dito para la compra D. harinas en bolsas. Y agradece a la FundaciÃ³n por darle la oportunidad D. acceder con el crÃ©dito y poder mantener su comercio.
texts.en:
Liliana is 31 years old. She runs a warehouse with a bakery, but she is abandoning the warehouse activity because the bakery is being more successful. Her husband, who works with her, takes care of the deliveries, thanks to a three-wheeler van. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bags of flour, and she is thankful to our institution for having granted her a loan that allows her to continue her activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy bags of flour

loan.name: Minerva Mirabal 2 Group

texts.en:
Enriketa is the coordinator of her group, 'Minerva Mirabal 2' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study. She needs to finish her studies. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew.
Enriketa is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year, starting when she received her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for her little colmado where she sell rice, beans, sugar and vegetables and she want to build a wall for her business locale. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and finish building her home.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loan.use: To buy goods for her store and build a wall

loan.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza es socia del Banco comunal â€œChojchoniâ€ desde hace tres aÃ±os atrÃ¡s, que pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil casada, con grado de instrucciÃ³n primaria (incompleta), tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales tres son independientes. Lorenza se dedica a la venta de llicllas que lleva a Bolivia, de mismo modo trae animales menores a lado Peruano, para comercializarlo. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar mercaderÃ­a de llicllas. Su visiÃ³n es llevar llicllas a Bolivia al por mayor. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lorenza has been a member of the community bank named Chojchoni for the past 3 years. she lives in the district of Copani in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 48 years old and she is married. She did not complete primary school. She has five children and of them, three are independent. Lorenza sells sarong wraps in Bolivia. The same way she brings small animals form the Peruvian side of the country for resale. The first loan requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and she used it to supplement her capital funds. She requests a new loan in the amount of 1700 nuevos soles to purchase more sarong wraps. Her dream is to sells wraps in wholesale in Bolivia. What she most enjoys about her community bank is the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase sarong wraps.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 21 aÃ±os, es una joven soltera, es hija mayor, vive en casa de su padres en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus dos hermanas. En vista que es la hija mayor, se siente en la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus hermanas y encargarse de la casa. Es por ello que tiene dos empleos: por las maÃ±anas dicta clases de ingles a niÃ±os de 5 a 8 aÃ±os y por las tardes trabaja en un casino durante la noche. Su mayor preocupaciÃ³n, son las comodidades bÃ¡sicas de su casa, es por ello que Nancy se ha propuesto en realizar las instalaciones del lavatorio de su cocina, de ese modo espera contribuir en la mejora de su hogar. Se siente muy feliz por lo que esta realizando, ya que su mayor anhelo, es terminar de construir su casa con todos sus servicios bÃ¡sicos, para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanas menores y a su padre. Este es su primer crÃ©dito con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le serÃ¡ de mucha utilidad para invertir en su casa, es por ello que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, va comprar mayÃ³licas para enchapar las paredes de su cocina.
texts.en:
Nancy, 21, is single. Sheâ€™s the eldest daughter and lives with her parents and two sisters. Because sheâ€™s the oldest, she feels responsible to help her sisters and be in charge of the house. Because of this, she has two jobs: in the morning she teaches English to children between the ages of 5 and 8 and in the evenings she works in a casino. Her greatest concerns are the homeâ€™s basic comforts. Nancy has, therefore, proposed for herself to install the sink in the kitchen thereby contributing to a home improvement. She feels very happy with what she is accomplishing because her greatest wish is to finish building the house with all the basic utilities so that her younger sisters and father can have a better quality of life. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that the money will be of great use for her to invest in the house so she pledges to repay on time. She will use the funds to buy tile for the kitchen walls.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ceramic tile to cover the kitchen walls.

loan.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora MarÃ­a Elena es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMataro Chicoâ€ ubicado en la provincia de AzÃ¡ngaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la seÃ±ora estudiÃ³ educaciÃ³n secundaria (completo).
La seÃ±ora MarÃ­a Elena esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses, nos cuenta que con el prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de productos lÃ¡cteos.
En la actualidad la seÃ±ora solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirÃ¡ para comprar insumos para la elaboraciÃ³n de sus productos.
Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es mejorar su negocio y ser mayorista.
Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la facilidad de los prÃ©stamos.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the community bank named "Mataro Chico", located in the province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 24 years old and she lives with her boyfriend and together they have a son. She graduated high school. Maria Elena has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 months. The first loan was in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and she used it to supplement the working capital for her dairy business. She requests a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will be used to purchase ingredients to make her products. In the future she hopes to improve her business and become a wholesaler. What she most enjoys about the community bank meetings is the meetings, the scheduling and the loan conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase ingredients to make dairy products.

loan.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene de 24 aÃ±os estÃ¡ casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Desde muy joven le gustÃ³ trabajar lo hizo durante su adolescencia, con la enseÃ±anza que le brindaron su padres Marlene decide iniciar el negocio de venta y elaboraciÃ³n de comida, se arriesgÃ³ en establecer su propio lugar por la necesidad de proporcionar los ingresos para el hogar, debido al precio y a la buena atenciÃ³n que ofrecÃ­a a sus clientes su negocio fue creciendo. Este es su primer crÃ©dito por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus cuotas de pagos, ya que es principalmente para la compra materia prima necesaria. Por lo que sueÃ±a con construir su propia casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene, 24, is married and has two children in her care. Sheâ€™s enjoyed working from a very early age; she started during her adolescence. With the teachings she got from her parents Marlene decided to go into the preparation and sale of food. She ventured to establish her own place motivated by the need to generate household income. Due to the good prices and service she offers her customers the business began to grow. This is her first loan and she assures that she will repay her installments faithfully since it will be used primarily to purchase ingredients. She dreams with building her own house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital.

loan.name: Nuevo Renacer 7 Group

texts.en:
Fani is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Renacer 7 (Rebirth). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.
Fani is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products, like beauty aids and cosmetics. She also wants to buy a hair dryer and hair washer. She has a beauty salon, a little boutique and she is a professional masseuse. She will use the profits to invest in saving toward the future to have a massage school. She enjoys doing her favorites activities like writing, acting and singing. Her most difficult challenge is to print a book she wrote called Change your life.

loan.use: To buy beauty and cosmetics products and miscellaneous items

loan.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina tiene 60 aÃ±os, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo y sus dos hijas, quienes la apoyan en su trabajo. Hace mÃ¡s de 10 aÃ±os, se dedica a la preparaciÃ³n y elaboraciÃ³n de panqueques (masa compuesta de harina, zapallo y camote) y cafÃ©. Su puesto queda a media hora de su casa, lugar muy concurrido, por ser el paradero final de los buses. Es asÃ­ que a partir de las 3:00 de la tarde hay mucha concurrencia de gente, que gustan de sus platillos. En un inicio solÃ­a trabajar sola, por lo que terminaba agotada, conforme pasÃ³ el tiempo pudo contar con el apoyo de su sobrina y en ocasiones de su hija. Esta muy contenta con su labor, por lo que sus ganancias son muy buenas y no descuida las labores de su casa. Su mayor anhelo en el futuro es tener un local y poner un restaurante, ya que la cocina le apasiona mucho. Este es su dÃ©cimo crÃ©dito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy en dÃ­a. Agripina tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de un toldo para cubrirse de la lluvia, ya que se encuentra en temporada de invierno, asimismo le ayudarÃ¡ protegerse del sol en verano.
texts.en:
Agripina, 60, is a hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters who help her with the work. For over 10 years she has worked preparing and making â€œpanquequesâ€ (dough made from flour, pumpkin and sweet potatoes) and coffee. Her stand is half an hour from home in a very crowded spot because itâ€™s the last stop on a bus route. From 3pm on there are a lot of people there that like her dishes. When she started out she used to work by herself but she would finish exhausted. As time went by she was able to count on her nieceâ€™s help and occasionally on help from her daughter. She is very happy with her work because her profits are good and she does not neglect her household chores. Her greatest wish is to have a fixed locale to install a restaurant because cooking is a passion of hers. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments on time like sheâ€™s been doing to date. Agripina plans to use the requested funds to buy a tarp to cover herself because itâ€™s the winter rainy season. The tarp will equally protect her from the sun during the summer

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy a tarp to protect her food stand from the rain.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: MarÃ­a es socia del Banco comunal â€œVirgen del Rosarioâ€ desD. hace diez aÃ±os, que pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 65 aÃ±os D. edad, estado civil casada, es analfabeta y tiene cuatro hijos que son independientes. MarÃ­a se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para pagar al Banco Comunal debe vender 2 unidades cada tres meses. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentÃ³ en su capital para su negocio D. venta D. ganado vacuno. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un crÃ©dito D. S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar dos toros. Su visiÃ³n es seguir adelante con el negocio del engorD. D. toros. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son intereses que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past 10 years. it is located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 65 years old and she is married. She is illiterate and she has 4 grown children. Maria is a cattle farmer. In order to make her payments to the community bank she must make 2 sales every three months. The first loan requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and it was used to supplement her working capital. She requests a new loan amounting to 3000 nuevos soles to purchase two bulls. her dreams are to keep her cattle farming business prosperous. What she most enjoys about the community bank meetings is the interest earned through the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase 2 bulls.

loan.name: Maxima

texts.es: MÃ¡xima es socia del Banco comunal â€œVirgen del Rosarioâ€ desD. hace diez aÃ±os, pertenece al distrito y provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 aÃ±os D. edad, D. estado civil casada, cursÃ³ hasta primero D. primaria, tiene seis hijos, todos independientes. Se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para pagar al Banquito Comunal debe vender 02 unidades cada cuatro meses. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentÃ³ su capital D. trabajo. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar dos toros. Su visiÃ³n es seguir adelante con el negocio del engorD. D. ganado vacuno. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los intereses que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Maxima has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past 10 years. It is located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 67 years old and she is married. She has a graD. 1 education. She has six grown children. She is a cattle farmer and to make her payments she must make 2 sales every four months. The first loan requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was for 300 nuevos soles and it was use as working capital. She requests a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase two bulls. Her dream is to keep her cattle farming business prosperous. What she most enjoys about the community bank is the interest earned from the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase 2 bulls.

loan.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr:
Madame Marie ThÃ©rÃ¨se N. est une femme de 42 ans. Elle est mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGASCOP 13 ans. Elle a 25 fois de suite reÃ§u de crÃ©dit et a toujours remboursÃ© rÃ©guliÃ¨rement.
Elle fait de l'embouche porcine. Elle mÃ¨ne cette activitÃ© depuis plus d'une dÃ©cennie
Son nouveau crÃ©dit lui permettra d'acheter 20 porcs qu'elle embouchera pendant 5 mois au moins avant de les vendre aux bouchers ou bien qu'elle ne les abatte pour vendre la viande.
Son objectif est de participer Ã l'amÃ©lioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marie ThÃ©rÃ¨se N. is a 42-year old woman, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Ngascop for 13 years. She obtained loans 25 times and always repaid them on time. She raises pigs. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Her new loan will allow her to purchase 20 pigs to fatten them for at least 5 months before reselling them to butchers or slaughtering them and selling the meat herself. Her goal is to help improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing 20 pigs

loan.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comitÃ© â€œKUÃ‘A ATYâ€ estÃ¡ dentro del octavo Ciclo del Programa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comitÃ© desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparaciÃ³n de comidas rÃ¡pidas y otros. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaÃ±erismo. La SeÃ±ora Lourdes es una de las integrantes del comitÃ©, ella se dedica a la Venta de productos de primera necesidad. En fin realiza varias actividades, como tambiÃ©n la venta tortas, minutas es una seÃ±ora muy creativa en su actividad. Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3 (tres) hijos y su marido quien trabaja como constructor de obra.
La seÃ±ora Lourdes solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de mercaderÃ­as para el negocio y un freezer.
texts.en:
The group named Kuna Aty is on their eighth loan cycle. They are located in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members of the group are very close and they are capable of working together, a unity that reinforces their team. Lourdes is one of the members of the group. she sells basic needs products. But she carries out different activities; she also sells hamburgers and snacks. She is a very creative person in her business. She has a very close knit family made up of her 3 children and her husband. Her husband works as a construction worker. Lourdes requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her business and a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Compra de mercaderias fideos, azucar, arroz, harina, y freezers

loan.name: Paula Maura

texts.es: Paula Maura es socia del Banco Comunal â€œVÃ­ctor Echaveâ€ desde hace seis aÃ±os, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con grado de instrucciÃ³n primaria (incompleta), tiene cinco hijos, solo uno depende de ella. Paula Maura tiene una empresa de transporte de servicio urbano, que viene trabajando desde hace muchos aÃ±os. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles comprÃ³ repuestos para un carro. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para comprar llantas y repuestos. Su visiÃ³n es aumentar mÃ¡s carros para servicio pÃºblico y carga. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Paula Maura has been a member of the community bank named Victor Echave for the past six years. She lives together with her boyfriend and she did not complete primary school. She has five children and only one of them still lives at home. Paula Maura has a public transport company. She has had the business for many years now. The first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and with it she purchased spare parts for her cab. She requests a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase tires and spare parts. Her dream is to expand her fleet of taxi cabs and moving trucks. She most enjoys the savings programs and support system in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase tire and spare parts for her taxi.

loan.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 62 aÃ±os, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija estudiante. Anteriormente se dedicaba en la venta de comida en los paraderos de buses, sin embargo tuvo que renunciar a ello debido a problemas graves de salud, es asÃ­ que han transcurrido 5 aÃ±os por lo que ha decidido vender productos comestibles y bebidas gasificadas en general. Es asÃ­ que tiene una bodega, para ello tuvo que acondicionar en el interior de su casa, donde atiende calidamente a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, ademÃ¡s puede trabajar de manera mÃ¡s tranquila sin descuidar su salud. Lo que mÃ¡s anhela es tener cervezas y ampliar mucho mÃ¡s su negocio. Es su cuarto crÃ©dito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que con este dinero le ayuda a fortalecer su capital de trabajo. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, piensa incrementar con mercaderÃ­as comestibles, para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Nora, 62, is a very hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and her student daughter. She used to work selling food at bus stops but had to stop doing that due to serious health issues. Itâ€™s been five years since she decided to sell food items and soft drinks in general. She has a grocery store set up in part of her house that was specially equipped for this where she kindly tends to her customers. She feels very happy about her store because she runs it with her husbandâ€™s help. Besides, she can work calmly and not neglect her health. What she most wants is to add beer and expand her inventory much more. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she commits to repay each installment on time because this money helps strengthen her working capital. She will use the requested funds to increase stock of food items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMataro Chicoâ€ ubicado en la provincia de AzÃ¡ngaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 02 hijos, la seÃ±ora solo tiene educaciÃ³n primaria (completo).
La seÃ±ora Rosa esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses, nos cuenta que con el prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
En la actualidad la seÃ±ora solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirÃ¡ para comprar mÃ¡s insumos para su tienda de abarrotes.
Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es mejorar el negocio y tener una casa propia en Juliaca.
Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank â€œMataro Chicoâ€, located in the province of AzÃ¡ngaro, Puno department. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. She has finished only her primary education. Rosa has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months. She tells us that with a loan of S/.500.00 nuevos soles that she asked for from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she was able to increase her caital in her grocery selling business. Presently she is asking for a loan of S/. 800.00 nuevos soles. This money will be used to purchase more products for her grocery store. Her dream for the future is to improve her business and have her own home in Juliaca. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings and the trainings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase grocery products

loan.name: Vladimir

texts.es: Vladimir B. Ãvila, tiene la edad de 20 aÃ±os, es soltero y no tiene hijos a su cargo pues vive con su madre. El quiere comprar matas de cafÃ© para resembrar una parte de su terreno en producciÃ³n y sembrar una parte que estÃ¡ en buenas condiciones. AsÃ­ puede explotar al mÃ¡ximo su finca y generarse unas ganancias para su bienestar. AdemÃ¡s, su finca cuenta con una parte de cafÃ© que estÃ¡ en malas condiciones por falta de las lluvias fuertes este aÃ±o la cual quiere mejorar. Tiene varios aÃ±os que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer prÃ©stamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tenÃ­a problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca productiva y de buenas condiciones para la producciÃ³n. TambiÃ©n, el no ha realizados otros prÃ©stamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindÃ³ el prÃ©stamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interÃ©s es mucho mÃ¡s baja. El tambiÃ©n tiene el deseo de superarse como persona y como productor de cafÃ©, y a su vez ir generando ganancias para su bienestar personal y el de su madre en el futuro.
texts.en:
Vladimir B. Ãvila, 20, is single and has no children; he lives with his mother. He wants to buy coffee plants to replant in part of his farmlands that are in good condition. This way he can get the most out of his farm and earn profits for his wellbeing. In addition, part of the area of his farm planted with coffee is in poor condition due to the extreme drought this year and heâ€™d like to improve it. He has devoted several years to his farm and heâ€™d like to see it develop. This is the first loan heâ€™s gotten from FUDECOSUR. He didnâ€™t have problems on his property but he does wish it to be a productive farm with good conditions for production. Also, heâ€™s never had any other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR, however, offered the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate. He also wants to better himself both as a person and as a coffee grower as well as to generate income for his personal and his motherâ€™s wellbeing in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For coffee planting.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To refurbish the bathroom in the store and buy materials like cement.

loan.name: Yovana Ubaldina

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal â€œFlor de Kantutaâ€ desde hace tres aÃ±os, que pertenece al distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con grado de instrucciÃ³n secundaria (completo), tiene dos hijos, uno de 6 y otro de un aÃ±o respectivamente. Se dedica a la compra y venta de casacas de cuero que lleva de desaguadero a Tacna, lo distribuye al por mayor, paralelamente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en Yunguyo. Con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital. SolicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles para comprar casacas de cuero. Su visiÃ³n es tener un locutorio. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banquito Comunal es la forma de trabajo de su promotora.
En la foro se muestra a la socia en su otro negocio, venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yovana has been a member of the communal bank â€œFlor de Kantutaâ€ for three years. It is in ths district and province of Yunguyo, Puno department. She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has finished her secondary education. She has two children, 6 and 1, repsectively. She buys and sells porks rinds, which she takes from Desaguadero to Tacna. She distributes them wholesale. She also has a grocery store in Yunguyo. With the first loan that she asked for from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She will ask for a new loan of S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles to purchase pork rinds. Her vision is to run a call center. What she likes the most about her little communal bank is the way her developer works. The photo shows the member at her other business, selling groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Jehova es mi Pastor lo integran tres fÃ©minas luchadoras en la vida con actividades similares, Liseth Carolina B. L. es una de ella y se dedica a la venta de frutas como limones, naranjas, naranjas agrias, piÃ±as, pitahayas, etc. Ella iniciÃ³ esta actividad hace 10 aÃ±os cuando despuÃ©s de ser empleada domÃ©stica decidiÃ³ ser su propia empleadora. Las metas de esta mujer son arreglar su casa y que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Justina del Carmen R. y Yamilett de los Santos S. venden verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace mÃ¡s de 18 aÃ±os.
texts.en:
The â€œJehova es mi Pastorâ€ (Jehovah is my Pastor) communal bank is made up of three tenacious women with similar activities. Liset Carolina B. LÃ³pez is one of them. She sells fruits like: lemons, oranges, sour oranges, pineapples, dragon fruit, etc. She started the business 10 years ago when after having been a domestic employee for some time she decided to work for herself. Her goals are to make home improvements and that her children stay in school. Justina del Carmen R. and Yamilett de los Santos SÃ¡nchez have sold vegetables in Masayaâ€™s market foro ver 18 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 63 aÃ±os, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia. Hace muchos aÃ±os tenia una familia muy feliz y tras la muerte de su hijo, su esposa lo abandono. Desde entonces pensÃ³ en salir adelante solo, se puso a construir su caca, acondicionando varias habitaciones. Ahora tiene 6 inquilinos que habitan esos cuartos, por lo que cobra mensualmente el alquiler y eso le satisface de sobre manera, es por ello que sigue preocupado en darles todas las comodidades a sus arrendatarios, ya que le genera buenas ganancias. En vista de ello Rolando se ha empeÃ±ado en poner otro lavatorio para lavar ropa. Su proyecto de vida es tener una casa hermosa con muchos cuartos, por lo que se propone realizarlo, para que no tenga problemas en el futuro y poder vivir de sus rentas. Este es su octavo crÃ©dito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que valora la utilidad del dinero, en la mejora de su casa. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, comprarÃ¡ cementos y ladrillos, para que construya el lavatorio.
texts.en:
Rolando, 63, is a very hard working man. He lives alone in his own house. Many years ago he had a very happy family but after the death of his son his wife abandoned him. Since then, he has gotten ahead alone. He started to build his house furnishing several rooms. Now he has six lodgers who live in those rooms. He charges them a monthly rental fee and this is quite satisfactory for him because he earns good profits so he strives to provide his tenants with all the comforts. In light of this, Rolando has seen fit to install another laundry room to do laundry. His life project is to have a beautiful house with many rooms. He intends to accomplish this so that he can live off his rents in the future. This is his 8th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he values the utility of the money in making improvements to his house. He will use the requested funds to buy cement and bricks to build the laundry room.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cement and bricks to build a laundry room.

loan.name: Karla Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Karla se encuentra conformado por Karla de los Angeles S. V., Martha Alejandra V. C. y Magaly Rosana B. V., tres fÃ©minas con distintas actividades econÃ³micas y con la meta de llevar el sustento a sus respectivos hogares. Karla, quien es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene un salÃ³n de belleza en su casa de habitaciÃ³n, ademÃ¡s atiende a domicilio dentro de la comunidad, ella utilizarÃ¡ el dinero para hacer mejoras a su negocio. Magaly tiene una panaderÃ­a en su hogar y en cambio Martha se dedica a la agricultura y la ganaderÃ­a, en especial la venta de granos bÃ¡sicos y productos derivados de la res.
texts.en:
The Karla communal bankâ€™s members are: Karla de los Ãngeles S. VÃ¡squez, Martha Alejandra VÃ¡squez C. and Magaly Rosana B. VÃ¡squez, three women with different economic activities but the common goal to provide sustenance to their homes. Karla, who is the group Coordinator, has a beauty salon installed in her home; she also provides in home services in her community. She will use the funds to make improvements to her salon. Magaly has a bakery in her house and Martha is a farmer and raises cattle, especially she sells basic grains and products derived from beef.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To make improvements to her beauty salon.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy books at wholesale.

loan.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El SeÃ±or Jose Luis es cliente antiguo, se dedica al mantenimiento de elevadores trabaja desde tempranas horas de la maÃ±ana, su actividad es realizada en varios edificios de la ciudad de La Paz, el es bastante reconocido por su clientela ya que es solicitados por muchos clientes por la rapidez y eficiencia en su trabajo, por lo cual tiene un numero significativo de clientes. El seÃ±or Jose Luis invertira el dinero del prestamo en la compra de repuestos para elevadores por mayor y luego venderos por unidad cuando vaya hacer alguna refaccion, esta muy agradecido por la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
JosÃ© Luis is a longstanding client. He is an elevator maintenance man. He works from very early in the morning in several buildings in La Paz. He is quite well known by his customers and highly sought after because of the speed and efficiency of his work. He, therefore, has a significant number of customers. He will use the funds to buy replacement parts for elevators at wholesale and then sell them at retails when he goes to do some repair. He is very grateful to the Institution for the support given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy replacement parts for elevators.

loan.name: Suzanne

texts.fr:
SUZANNE D. est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGASCOP depuis 12 ans. Elle a reÃ§u 24 prÃªts qu'elle a toujours remboursÃ©s rÃ©guliÃ¨rement.
Elle fait de l'Ã©levage de porcs. Elle achÃ¨te des porcs qu'elle embouche pour faire de l'abattage ou pour revendre sur pied.
Avec nouveau crÃ©dit elle va acheter 20 porcs pour continuer son activitÃ© de porcherie
Son objectif est de renforcer son Ã©pargne et de participer Ã l'amÃ©lioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Suzanne D. is a 50-year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Ngascop for 12 years. She obtained loans 24 times in the past and always repaid them on time. She raises pigs. She buys pigs and fattens them before slaughtering or reselling them live. With this new credit she is going to purchase 20 pigs to continue with her business. Her goal is to bolster her savings and help improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

Han transcurrido 5 aÃ±os en esta labor, y tiene proyectos futuros, como el tener un local propio, asimismo desea dedicar a la venta de chicharrones. Con el crÃ©dito que solicita, piensa comprar detergentes, lejÃ­as y jabones, por otro lado tambiÃ©n desea comprar ollas y utensilios para iniciar su aÃ±orado negocio de comida.

As they became less profitable she wanted to diversify her activity so she decided to take advantage of her washing machine and started to take in laundry. Although it was difficult at first because she didnâ€™t have many customers, in time she was able to establish her business. Since then she works all day washing clothes; she hardly ever leaves the house in order not to lose potential customers. She is very happy with her work because she does it at home. She has been at this for 5 years and she has future projects, like owning her own place. She also wants to sell chicharrones (fried pork rinds). This is her 9th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay punctually like sheâ€™s always done in the past because she values this contribution that is so beneficial to her progress. loan.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 30 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo AndrÃ©s de 30 aÃ±os y de sus 2 pequeÃ±os hijos. Cada dÃ­a es de esfuerzo constante para esta trabajadora mujer que desde muy joven trabaja en diferentes oficios, y cuando se junto con su pareja decidiÃ³ ayudarlo en la manutenciÃ³n de sus hijos. AsÃ­ empezÃ³ a vender productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, y luego de un tiempo se le ocurriÃ³ ofrecer algunos cosmÃ©ticos en una vitrina ubicada en un espacio en la tienda de comestibles que tiene su madre. Desde entonces, le ha ido muy bien, aunque no vive con su mamÃ¡, pasa gran parte de su tiempo en el negocio, pues siempre esta a la espera de vender u ofrecer a sus amigas y conocidas. Dice que le gusta mucho este trabajo porque le permite trabajar sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos, y puede obtener regulares ganancias y asÃ­ ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar una vitrina mÃ¡s para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos, pues cuenta con el espacio disponible en el negocio de su madre. Es el sexto crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como lo hace siempre, ademÃ¡s esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo ya que todas las integrantes son muy responsables y honradas. Jessica tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de productos de belleza para ofrecer en su vitrina a sus clientes, de esta manera espera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessica is 30 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband Andres, 30, and their 2 small children. Each day is a constant effort for this hard-working woman who from an early age, worked at different jobs. And when she united with her husband, she decided to help him with maintenance of the children. Thus she began to sell beauty products of a recognized brand, and later, for a time, it occurred to her to offer some cosmetics in a showcase located in a space in her mother's grocery store. Since then, it has gone well, and though she doesn't live with her mother, she spends a great part of her time in the business, and she is always hoping to offer or sell items to her friends or to people she knows. Jessica says she likes this activity very much because it permits her to work without neglecting the care of her children, and she can obtain regular earnings and thus, help her husband with household costs. And since she is an enterprising woman, further along she plans to buy another showcase to offer a larger quantity of products. She has the space in her mother's business. This is Jessica's 6th loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually as she always has. Moreover, she is quite satisfied with the work of her group since all the members are very responsible and honorable. Jessica plans to invest this loan in purchasing a quantity of beauty products for her showcase and to offer her customers. In this manner, she hopes to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Johanna
