Esta trabajadora mujer, a pesar de su incapacidad fÃ­sica, se desempeÃ±a en varios oficios, pues siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, y sabe que en la vida no hay impedimento, por eso todos los dÃ­as sube y baja con mucho empeÃ±o del cerro donde vive, para esto se apoya en su muleta. Se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado que trae de otras ciudades a la capital, ella vende a sus conocidos y clientes fijos que le sacan la mercaderÃ­a a crÃ©dito, ya que ofrece modernas prendas a buenos precios, y considera que este es un negocio bastante rentable, pues aunque demora un poco si percibe buenas ganancias. TambiÃ©n compra leche fresca que adquiere a buenos precios por la zona donde vive, y luego la vende en la ciudad, de esta manera se genera tambiÃ©n ganancias extras; y como si fuera poco prepara dulce de melocotÃ³n que comercializa en botellas a sus conocidos que saben de la garantÃ­a de su preparaciÃ³n. Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su mercaderÃ­a en ropa y zapatos, ademÃ¡s de comprarse una maquina para empezar a hacer realidad su sueÃ±o, como instalar una pequeÃ±a fÃ¡brica donde se prepare dulces y nÃ©ctares de melocotÃ³n. Es el tercer crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues desea seguir sacando crÃ©ditos para salir adelante y concretar todos sus planes, tambiÃ©n afirma que le gusta trabajar con su compaÃ±era de grupo porque entre las 2 cumplen con responsabilidad y puntualidad. Johanna tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de zapatos, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir y espera generarse mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Johanna is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her two adult children and her young granddaughter. They want to get ahead together. Johanna and her family live in a populous neighborhood north of the city. She is a woman who works hard despite having a physical disability.

Johanna has worked in different jobs in order to get ahead and tries to live life as if she did not have an impediment. Every day she must walk up and down the hill where she lives with the help of a crutch. Johanna sells clothing and shoes that she brings in from other cities. She sells to her acquaintances and established customers who purchase the merchandise on credit. The products she offers are modern and come with affordable prices. Johanna also buys fresh milk in her neighborhood at a good price and then sells it in the city so that she can generate extra income. In addition, she prepares peach preserves and sells them in bottles to her acquaintances who are familiar with how she makes this product. She has future plans to increase her inventory of clothing and shoes, so she will buy a sewing machine to begin making this dream a reality. Johanna also wants to establish a small workspace where she can prepare sweets and peach nectar.

This is her third loan with MFP. Johanna promises to submit her payments on time because she wants to continue taking loans to help her move forward and follow through with all of her plans. She also says she likes working with her fellow group members because they have demonstrated responsibility and punctuality. Johanna plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of shoes since she has several orders to fulfill. She hopes to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Acquire more shoes to sell

loan.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene la edad de 58 aÃ±os, es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 21 aÃ±os. En este momento Costa Rica esta sufriendo aguaceros que hace difÃ­cil la cosecha. Por eso Ã©l quiere comprar fertilizantes para la mejora de la cosecha de los cafetales para este aÃ±o y ayudarle a las matas a producir mÃ¡s para el siguente. Rosario cuenta con su experiencia en cafÃ© y su finca con lo cual tiene varios aÃ±os. Desea de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer prÃ©stamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y no ha realizados otros prÃ©stamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindÃ³ el prÃ©stamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interÃ©s es mucho mÃ¡s baja. Con los ganancias de su finca quiere invertir en el futuro de su finca y en el bienestar de su familia que es su mayor prioridad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 58 years old, married, and has a son who is 21 years old. At the moment, Costa Rica is experiencing heavy downpours which is making it difficult to harvest. He wants to buy fertilizers to improve his coffee fields this year and help his plants produce more in the following seasons. Rosario has experience growing coffee and has owned his farm for several years. He wants to have a productive farm.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and he has not received other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR provides this loan with greater convenience and a lower interest rate. His earnings will be reinvested in the future of his farm. The welfare of his family is his greatest priority.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies for his coffee crop

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 40 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus 2 hijos y de su suegra, habitan en un barrio populoso ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Hace mÃ¡s de 2 aÃ±os, se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, recuerda como se animÃ³ a empezar en este negocio por recomendaciÃ³n de una amiga. Y cuando reciÃ©n comenzaba a colocar sus productos, todo era muy difÃ­cil pero con el tiempo adquiriÃ³ buenas clientes que ahora le compran con frecuencia y le pagan a tiempo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite obtener buenas ganancias sin descuidar su hogar, ademÃ¡s ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos con mucho empeÃ±o y dedicaciÃ³n. Pero lo que le desagrada es caminar mucho para captar nuevas clientes, pues siempre esta en busca del crecimiento. Esta trabajadora mujer tiene planeado para mÃ¡s adelante instalar un pequeÃ±o bazar en su casa y de esta manera continuar adelante. Es el tercer crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente ya que quiere seguir progresando, ademÃ¡s no quiere decepcionar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando. Julia tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y perfumes, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y espera tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her two children and her mother-in-law. They all reside in a populous neighborhood located north of the city. For more than two years, Julia has been selling beauty products of a known brand. She remembers starting her business based on a recommendation of a friend. When she first started building up her inventory of products, everything was very difficult, but in time she eventually acquired good customers who now buy on a frequent basis and pay on time. Julia enjoys her work because it allows her to earn a good income without neglecting her household. In addition, her children have been able to get ahead because of her effort and dedication. The part she dislikes is walking great distances in order to attract new customers, but she is willing to do it so that she can keep growing. This hardworking woman has plans to get further ahead by opening a small bazaar in her home so that she can continue forward.

This is her third loan with MFP. Julia promises to complete her payments on time so that she can continue progressing. In addition, she does not want to disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that she could continue working. Julia plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of more beauty products and perfumes since she has several orders to fulfill. She hopes to have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase beauty products & perfumes to fulfill her orders

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 45 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia, en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus padres y de sus hijos que ya son jÃ³venes. Recuerda como empezÃ³ en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, desde entonces ya han pasado 3 aÃ±os. En la actualidad no solo comercializa su mercaderÃ­a, si no tambiÃ©n capta nuevas vendedoras lo que le permite obtener buenos incentivos y ganancias de la empresa para la que trabaja. AdemÃ¡s esta muy satisfecha pues el trabajo es muy tranquilo y lo puede realizar en la comodidad de su casa, donde ha instalado una vitrina y ahÃ­ muestra los productos que tiene en stock, entre cosmÃ©ticos, perfumes y accesorios trata de colocar toda su mercaderÃ­a a buen precio. Y como es una dama muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado comprar otra vitrina para surtirla de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, pues con frecuencia sus clientes se acercan en cualquier momento a comprar, ya que necesitan para regalos ocasionales. Es el noveno crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crÃ©dito que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando. Luz tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercaderÃ­a en productos de belleza, pues desea surtir mejor su vitrina y de esta manera ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and her teenage children. She remembers starting to sell beauty products of a known brand three years ago. Not only does she sell merchandise, but she also recruits new sales representatives since she is offered good incentives and earnings from the company that manufactures her products. Luz is very pleased with her work because it is peaceful and allows her to be comfortable at home, where she has a display cabinet where she can store and exhibit her inventory of cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories that she offers at a good price. Being an enterprising woman, Luz has plans to get ahead even further by purchasing another display cabinet so that she can be stocked with more beauty products since her customers frequently by products at the spur of the moment when they need gifts for special occasions.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Luz promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to look bad to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. She plans to invest the loan she requested in more beauty products so that she can restock her display cabinet and offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase beauty products

loan.name: David

texts.es: David tiene la edad de 31 aÃ±os, es casado y tiene un bebe de 3 aÃ±os que es su mayor prioridad. Vive con su esposa e hijo por temporadas. El quiere comprar almÃ¡cigos para la renovaciÃ³n de su cafetal. AdemÃ¡s de cafÃ©, su finca tiene cerdos y con lo que sobre de la compra de los almÃ¡cigos de cafÃ© le gustarÃ­a comprar cerdos para engordar. Tiene varios aÃ±os que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. El no tenÃ­a problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer prÃ©stamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y no ha realizados otros prÃ©stamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindÃ³ el prÃ©stamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interÃ©s es mucho mÃ¡s baja. El tambiÃ©n tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educaciÃ³n necesaria a su hijo para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil la vida. Con la venta del cafÃ© quiere generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de la familia.
texts.en:
David is 31 years old, married, and has a three year old child who is his highest priority. He and his family live from season to season. David wants to buy seedlings in order to renew his coffee crop. In addition to growing coffee, he also raises pigs on his farm. Therefore, he wants to buy pigs for fattening in addition to the coffee seedlings. David has been farming for several years and he wants to continue growing. He has not experienced any problems with his property and wants to have a productive farm.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and he has not received other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR provides this loan with greater convenience and a lower interest rate. David also wants to provide his son with the necessary education that will help him be prepared for anything he encounters in the future so that he will have a much easier life. Through his coffee sales, he wants to generate more income for the welfare of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase coffee seedlings & pigs for fattening

loan.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: Nelson Enrique tiene 31 aÃ±os, vive con su esposa y estÃ¡ a cargo de 4 hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de Nelson. Tiene un negocio de servicio de barberÃ­a, este es un negocio muy difÃ­cil pero es su Ãºnica entrada de dinero lo cual ayuda su familia para salir adelante, hace mas de 7 aÃ±os que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que se esfuerzan mucho dÃ­a con dÃ­a. El prÃ©stamo que ha sido solicitado es para poder invertir en cremas para afeitar, peines, talcos, rasuradoras elÃ©ctricas y gabachas de tela.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique is 31 years old and lives with his wife and their four young children who are able to attend school because of his enormous efforts. He has a business where he offers his services as a barber. The work is very difficult but it is his only source of income that helps his family get ahead. Nelson has been in this business for more than seven years and works hard day after day.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy shaving creams, combs, talcum powders, electric razors, and barber capes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase shaving creams, combs, talcum powders, electric razors, and barber capes

loan.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 35 aÃ±os, vive en una casa alquilada en compaÃ±Ã­a de sus 3 hijos menores, que aÃºn estudian en el colegio, juntos desean salir adelante, habitan en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Hace mÃ¡s de 3 aÃ±os, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la comercializaciÃ³n de diversos productos comestibles (quesos, palta y carne) que compra cuando viaja a una provincia cercana de la ciudad, y cuando regresa coloca su mercaderÃ­a en las tiendas de su barrio. Dice que el negocio es bastante rentable ya que tiene clientes fijos que le compran su mercaderÃ­a una vez a la semana, y con las ganancias trata de brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. AdemÃ¡s se gana la vida lavando ropa para sus conocidos, por lo que cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Y como ella misma se considera una â€œmil oficiosâ€, ademÃ¡s trabaja como cobradora de un Ã³mnibus que maneja su hermano; dice muy orgullosa que tiene los papeles en regla para desempeÃ±ar este trabajo. Para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de venta de comestibles pues se ha dado cuenta que le genera buenas ganancias. Es el primer crÃ©dito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Eva tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercaderÃ­a en quesos y palta pues tiene varios pedidos de diferentes tiendas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and lives in a rented house with her three young children who are in school. They want to get ahead together. Eva and her family live in a populous neighborhood north of the city. For more than three years, this hardworking woman has been selling different food products (cheese, avocados, and meat) that she acquires when she travels to the neighboring province. Upon her return, she distributes her merchandise to the stores in her neighborhood. Eva says her business is profitable enough since she has established customers who buy merchandise on a weekly basis. With her earnings, she is able to provide the best for her children. Eva says she has several jobs since she also works as a bus fare collector for a vehicle that her brother drives. She says she is proud to have achieved the proper registration papers needed to perform this work. In the distant future, Eva plans to expand her food sales business so that she can generate good revenues.

This is her first loan with MFP. Eva is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of more merchandise, such as cheese and avocados, since she has several orders from different stores. In this manner, she hopes to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase cheese & avocados to fulfill her customers' orders

loan.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Angela Maria B. R., tiene la edad de 37 aÃ±os, habita en el barrio La BorgoÃ±a junto a su esposo el cual labora como albaÃ±il para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar; ya que tienes tres hijos dos de ellos ya independientes y el menor de 14 aÃ±os estudiante de secundaria, doÃ±a Angela desde hace ocho aÃ±os se dedica a la agricultura la mayor necesidad es la falta de recursos econÃ³micos para poder comprar fertilizantes e insumos. Ya que el cultivo de piÃ±a careces de varios factores para poder crecer y dar un buen colar para que a la hora de su venta puedan pagar un mejor precio y poder cancelar el crÃ©dito en tiempo y forma que establece su plan de pago.
texts.en:
Sra. Angela Maria B. R. is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La BorgoÃ±a. Her husband works as a mason and helps her with the household expenses. They have three children, two of whom who are already independent, while the youngest is a 14 year old high school student. DoÃ±a Angela has been a farmer for eight years and her greatest need is securing financial resources to buy fertilizers and supplies. She grows pineapples and there are several factors that go into their care and maintenance in order for her to get the best price when it is time to sell her harvest. This allows her to repay her loan on time according to her payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fertilizers and supplies to improve her pineapple crop

loan.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œVirgen del Rosario del Cuscoâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 61 aÃ±os de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida en un triciclo, ella vende en unas de las calles del Cusco llamado Av. Diagonal Angamos desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio y tener un restaurant para vender la comida. La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueÃ±o mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Angelica is a member of the Communal Bank â€œVirgen del Rosario del Cusco.â€ The bank is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco. Angelica is 61 years old and widowed with 5 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food from a three-wheeled cart on a street of Cusco called Av.Diagonal Angamos from 6 AM to 5 PM. She sells food door to door and wants to improve her business by having a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase products for food preparation. She is grateful to those who are helping her fulfill her dream through this forum and is committed to completing her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal â€œMataro Chicoâ€, ubicado en el centro poblado D. Mataro Chico del distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja, provincia D. AzÃ¡ngaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 aÃ±os D. edad, estÃ¡ casada y tiene 03 hijos (independientes), la seÃ±ora estudiÃ³ hasta 1ro D. educaciÃ³n primaria.
La seÃ±ora Rosa esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 meses, nos cuenta que con el prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirÃ¡ incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales menores como avino y chanchos.
En la actualidad la seÃ±ora solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirÃ¡ comprar mÃ¡s animales para luego venderlos, tambiÃ©n nos cuenta que venD. productos lÃ¡cteos como leche.

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank "Mataro Chico", located in downtown Mataro Chico in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja, Azangaro Puno. She is 67 years old, she is married, and she has 3 grown children. She has a graD. 1 education. Rosa has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 4 months. She had previously requested a loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. This loan supplemented her business' capital funds, to buy and sell small farm animals, such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more livestock for future resale. She also sells dairy products. Her dream for the future is to improve her livestock and to make traditional food products such as oatmeal. She most enjoys the gatherings in her community bank, as well as the proceedings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase small farm animals.

loan.name: Antonieta

La socia pertenece al banco comunal â€œQorimankachaâ€; El banco estÃ¡ ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. La socia solicita el prÃ©stamo para comprar materiales para su fotocopiadora.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueÃ±o mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Antonieta is a member of the Communal Bank "Qorimankacha.â€ The bank is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco. Antonieta is 28 years old and a single mother of two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of offering services such as photocopying, making transparencies, and spiral binding of documents. She has two small posts in the San Antonio Abad University, where she works from 7 AM to 5 PM. She wants to better equip her business so she is requesting a loan to buy materials for her photocopier. She thanks those who are helping her fulfill her dream through this forum and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy materials for her photocopier

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo ElÃ­as de 49 aÃ±os y de sus 5 hijos de los cuales 2 ya son mayores de edad. Cada dÃ­a es nuevo en la vida de esta trabajadora mujer, pues aparte de las labores que realiza en su hogar tambiÃ©n se dedica a la preparaciÃ³n y venta de comida diaria a los trabajadores de diferentes empresas que se encuentran cerca de su casa. Aunque dice que la labor es algo tediosa ya que debe trasladar sus platillos a diferentes lugares, obtiene regulares ganancias que son la recompensa a tan esmerada labor. Dice ademÃ¡s que con el tiempo la cantidad de sus clientes aumentÃ³ bastante, lo que le permite obtener mejores ganancias, de esta manera ha empezado a juntar un capital para ampliar su negocio. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar su propio restaurante en una zona comercial para continuar vendiendo sus exquisitas comidas, pero de una manera formal y estable. Es el segundo crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le esta permitiendo darle un empuje a su negocio. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor con el fin de preparar mayor variedad de platillos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, lives in her own house with her husband, ElÃ­as, 49, and their five children two of whom are adults. Every day is new in this hard working womanâ€™s life because besides the chores she does at home she also prepares food daily to sell to employees of various firms near her home. She says that although the work is tedious and she has to deliver her dishes to various locations she earns steady income which is the reward for such dedicated work. She also says that the number of her customers she has increased with time which means more profits. This has allowed her to start saving up capital to expand her business. As she is an enterprising woman she plans for later on to set up a restaurant in a commercial zone to continue selling her delicious meals in a formal and stable manner. This is the 2nd loan sheâ€™s had with MFP and she promises to repay on time because she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that is pushing her business forward. Rosa plans to use the requested funds to buy ingredients at wholesale to prepare a larger variety of dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy ingredients to prepare a variety of dishes.

loan.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina es socia del Banco comunal â€œChojchoniâ€ desde hace cinco aÃ±os, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 64 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil casada, no tiene estudios (analfabeta). Josefina tiene diez hijos, de los cuales dos dependen de ella y un nieto. Josefina, de todo corazÃ³n, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberle otorgado el crÃ©dito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitiÃ³ empezar con el negocio de la venta de llicllas, por que anteriormente solo vendÃ­a pescados por falta de capital, ahora vende frazadas y llicllas los dÃ­as sÃ¡bados y domingos en La Paz -Bolivia, eso le permite cubrir de alguna forma las necesidades bÃ¡sicas de sus dos hijos y de su nieto de siete aÃ±os. Ella solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar mÃ¡s llicllas. Su visiÃ³n es seguir adelante con su negocio de llicllas. Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Josefina has been a member of the Community Bank "Chojchoni" for the past five years. She lives in the district of Copani in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 64 years old and she is married. She has never attended school and she is illiterate. Josefina has ten children, all of whom depend on her. She also has a grandson that depends on her. With all of her heart Josefina is grateful to the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for having granted her a past loan of 500 nuevos soles. With it she was able to start a business selling women's wraps. Previously she only sold fish for lack of capital. But now she sells blankets and wraps every Saturday and Sunday in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is able to, in part, cover her children's and grandson's basic needs. Her grand son is seven years old. She requests a new loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase more pashmina wraps. Her vision is to keep advancing in her business selling pashmina wraps. What she most enjoys about the community bank is saving and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase women's wraps.

loan.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca es una maestra en la escuela de la comunidad de Santa Elena de la regiÃ³n Brunca en el sur de Costa Rica. Tiene la edad de 30 aÃ±os y es soltera pero tiene una hija de 9 aÃ±os. Hace poco su carro se rotÃ³ y desde entonces no ha podido ir a la escuela para impartir clases a los niÃ±os. Ella quiere arreglar su vehÃ­culo, comprar partes daÃ±ados para volver a tenerlo en buen estado y viajar a impartir los lecciones en la escuela. AdemÃ¡s, le gustarÃ­a usar su vehÃ­culo para facilitarse el transporte de su hija. Es el primer prÃ©stamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y tambiÃ©n ella ha realizados otros prÃ©stamos en el uniÃ³n de crÃ©dito Coopealianza, pero FUDECOSUR le brindÃ³ el prÃ©stamo con mayores facilidades. Ella tambiÃ©n tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hija y los hijos en la escual la educaciÃ³n necesaria para que sean en el futuro personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil la vida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a teacher in a school in Santa Elena in the Brunca region in southern Costa Rica. She is 30 years old and single but has a 9 year-old daughter. Her car broke down recently and since then she has been unable to get to school to teach her students. She wants to repair the car and buy replacement parts for the damaged parts to once again have it in good running order and be able to get to school to teach her lessons. In addition, sheâ€™d like to be able to have the car to transport her daughter. This is the first loan from FUDECOSUR and she has had previous loans from Coopealianza Credit Union. However, FUDECOSUR offered more comfortable loan terms. She wants to provide her daughter and the children at the school with the necessary education so that they will be prepared individuals in the future to face life more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loan.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 31 aÃ±os, vive en su casa que es propia en compaÃ±Ã­a de su esposo Ronald de 30 aÃ±os, que es obrero en una fÃ¡brica y de sus 2 pequeÃ±os hijos, juntos habitan en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado ha laborar en distintos oficios, y luego que se junto con su pareja, se le ocurriÃ³ emprender un nuevo negocio para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad, y en sociedad con una amiga se dedica a la crianza y comercializaciÃ³n de pollos, dice que la labor debe ser constante, pues desde muy pequeÃ±os los polluelos requieren de esmerados cuidados para lograr crecer sin dificultad. Al principio fue fÃ¡cil, pero a medida que aumentaba estos animales tuvieron que trasladarlos a un espacio mÃ¡s amplio. Le gusta mucho el negocio de comercializaciÃ³n de pollos, pues Ã©stos crecen rÃ¡pido y en solo un mes ya los pueden vender. Pero lo que no le gusta es subir el cerro donde esta ubicada el galpÃ³n, pues es algo dificultoso, ya que ella adolece de los riÃ±ones. Y como es una mujer emprendedora tiene grandes sueÃ±os para ampliar este negocio, y uno de ellos es comprar un terreno para aumentar la cantidad de pollos, y asÃ­ mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas, ya que desea seguir trabajando en busca del progreso, ademÃ¡s esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirÃ¡ ampliar su negocio. Ana tiene planeado invertir este crÃ©dito solicitado en la compra de alimento balanceado y vitaminas para brindarles a sus polluelos el mejor cuidado, de esta manera espera venderlos a mayor precio y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and lives in her own house. She lives in the company of her 30-year old husband, Ronald, who is a factory worker, and her 2 small children. Together, they live in a populated neighborhood north of the city.

Since she was young, she has worked in different jobs but after marrying her husband, she decided to start a new business to help with the household expenses. Now, in association with a friend, she works raising and selling chickens. She says that the work must be constant because from the time that they are very small, the chicks require a great deal of care so that they grow without any difficulty. At the beginning it was easy, but as the number of animals increased, they had to take them to a larger space. She likes selling chickens very much â€“ they grow quickly and they can be sold in just a month. However, what she doesnâ€™t like is going up the hill to where the barn is located, as it is difficult since she has backaches.

Since she is an enterprising woman, she has big dreams to expand this business and one of those dreams is to purchase a piece of land to increase the number of chickens and, in that way, increase her earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, since she wants to continue working in search of progress. In addition, she is very grateful for all of the people that made this loan possible, which will allow her to expand her business. Ana plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of balanced diet and vitamins to provide better care to her chicks. This way, she hopes to sell them at a better price and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase feed for her chicks

loan.name: Filemon

texts.es:
El seÃ±or FilemÃ³n H. M. tiene 34 aÃ±os convive con la SeÃ±ora Simona Flores Villarroel mÃ¡s de 12 aÃ±os, tienen 2 hijos menores dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, en la escuela rural de la comunidad, la actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, oca, haba en el terreno que tiene 2 hectÃ¡reas sector Cotani Bajo Sector Churo, son una familia humilde de pocos recursos pero muy trabajadores, estÃ¡n a 45 km de la ciudad de Cbba para ellos acudir a los banco para un prÃ©stamo de dinero es muy difÃ­cil.
El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Donde Don FilemÃ³n H. M. necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgÃ¡nico, semilla de papa para la siembra de esta campaÃ±a agrÃ­cola, FilemÃ³n nos comenta que la producciÃ³n agrÃ­cola ha sido poco por factores climÃ¡ticos como la sequia, si este aÃ±o no siembra no tendrÃ­a alimentaciÃ³n ni dinero tampoco ahorro para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. FilemÃ³n H. M., 34, has lived together with Mrs. Simona Flores Villarroel for over 12 years. They have two minor, dependent children who are in primary school at the rural school in the community. His main activity is potato, oca (an Andean tuber) and lima bean farming on a 2 hectare field in Cotani Bajo, Sector Churo. They are a humble family of few resources but are very hard working. They are located 45 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba and it is very difficult for them to come to the banks to request loans. CIDRE took the initiative to go to this rural zone where Mr. FilemÃ³n H. M. needed money to buy organic manure and potato seed for the next planting season. FilemÃ³n mentioned to us that production has been poor due to climactic factors, mainly the drought. If he doesnâ€™t plant this year he wonâ€™t have food or money to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy manure.

loan.name: Salinoa

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Salinoa es socia del Banco Comunal â€œLas Perlas IIâ€, ubicado en la provincia D. San RomÃ¡n y departamento D. Puno, tiene 41 aÃ±os D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 08 hijo (01 independiente), la seÃ±ora estudiÃ³ hasta 3ro D. secundaria.
La seÃ±ora Salinoa esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. este ciclo, y nos cuenta que con el prÃ©stamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, podrÃ¡ incrementar su capital para su negocio D. venta D. pescado, y al engorD. D. animales menores, para luego venderlos en las ferias comunales.
Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es incrementar su capital y aumentar mÃ¡s ganado.
Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la facilidad D. los prÃ©stamos.
texts.en:
Salinoa is a member of the community bank named "The Pearls II". It is located in the province of San Roman in Puno. She is 41 years old, she is married, and she is has 8 children (one is independent). She has a graD. 9 education. Salinoa has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement since the beginning of this loan cycle. The loan she requests of Manuela Ramos is in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and with it she will supplement her business' working capital, selling fish and raising small livestock. She resells her livestock in regional country fairs. Her dreams for the future are to increase her working capital and to purchase more livestock. What she most enjoys about her community bank is being granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase fish in wholesale and small livestock.

loan.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 24 aÃ±os de edad vive en la Maica una Zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el se dedica a la producciÃ³n de la leche junto con su esposa con la cual tiene una hijo de tres aÃ±os. El es una persona muy responsable y dedicado al trabajo que el realiza tiene cuatro cabezas de ganado lechero Juan Carlos se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven ya que su madre se dedicaba a la misma actividad el por ser el hermano menor siempre estuvo trabajando con ella, la mamÃ¡ de Juan Carlos muriÃ³ hace seis aÃ±os a causa de una enfermedad que lucho desde niÃ±a ya que cuando ella se enfermo de mal de chagas que es una enfermedad con la cual combatiÃ³ muchos aÃ±os pero ella estuvo siempre luchando junto a sus hijos para salir adelante ya que el padre les abandono cuando ellos eran niÃ±os.
Juan Carlos lucha todos los dÃ­as y valora mucho el sacrificio que su madre hizo por sus hermanas y su persona, el crÃ©dito que solicita es para la compra un camiÃ³n de cascara de soya que es alimento para el ganado y de esa manera generar mÃ¡s ingresos y podrÃ¡ aumentar su producciÃ³n de leche porque el saca 150 litros diarios los cuales entrega a su suegra para la realizaciÃ³n de quesillos.
Juan Carlos quiere un futuro mejor para su hijo es por eso que Ã©l trabaja desde muy temprano y realiza otros trabajos como agricultor, Ã©l y su esposa quieren en un futuro no muy lejano casarse y trabajar juntos y ayudar a que su hijo estudie una carrera y tenga un futuro mejor que el que tuvo el.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 24, lives in La Maica, a rural zone in Cochabamba. He and his wife are dairy farmers and they have a three year old son. He is a very responsible person who is dedicated to the work he does. He has four head of dairy cattle. He has been in this line of work since he was very young because his mother did the same. Because he is the youngest sibling he was always at her side working with her. Juan Carlosâ€™ mother died six years ago due to an illness she fought against since she was a little girl and got Chagas disease. This is a disease she fought against for many years but still she was always struggling together with her children to get ahead since their father abandoned them when they were children. Juan Carlos struggles daily and values the sacrifice his mother made for his sisters and for himself. He is asking for funds to buy a truckload of soy husks which is the feed for his cattle so that he can generate higher income and produce more milk. He currently extracts 150 liters of milk daily which he delivers to his mother-in-law to make â€œquesilloâ€ (small fresh farm cheese popular in the Cochabamba valley.) Juan Carlos wants a better future for his son. This is why he works from very early in the morning and does other farming chores. He and his wife want to get married in the not too distant future and work together to help their son study a professional career and have a better future than he has had.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy soy based cattle feed.

loan.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 29 aÃ±os, vive en casa de sus padres en compaÃ±Ã­a de ellos y de sus hermanos, todos juntos habitan en una modesta vivienda de material noble ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Este emprendedor joven se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, durante el dÃ­a, dice que escogiÃ³ este horario porque trabajar en la noche es mÃ¡s peligroso. Aunque no tiene hijos aÃºn se esfuerza a diario, para ayudar en algo a sus padres en los constantes gastos del hogar, y tambiÃ©n para terminar con la construcciÃ³n de su casa. Trabaja con clientes fijos y nuevos, por rutas cortas, ya que sabe que asÃ­ se obtiene mayores ganancias, y lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su trabajo es compartir experiencias con sus ocasionales pasajeros, ademÃ¡s se distrae bastante viendo las calles y las personas. Tiene grandes planes por concretar, uno de ellos es, comprar un auto para rentarlo, de esta manera espera obtener mejores ganancias. Es el segundo crÃ©dito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crÃ©dito que le permitirÃ¡ continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Walter tiene planeado invertir el crÃ©dito solicitado en el mantenimiento mecÃ¡nico de su auto, ya que lo requiere con urgencia para poder trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Walter, 29, lives with his parents and siblings in their house which is a modest house made from substantial materials located in a crowded neighborhood in the north part of the city. This enterprising young man provides taxi services during the day. He says he selected this work schedule because working at night is more dangerous. Although he doesnâ€™t have any children he works hard daily to help his parents with the constant household expenses and to finish building their house. He works with both new and regular customers on short routes because that means higher profits. What he likes best about his work is sharing experiences with his passengers and he enjoys looking at the streets and the people. He has a lot of plans in the works. One of them is to buy a car to lease it out thereby earning better profits. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he promises to repay punctually so as not to disappoint all the people that made the loan possible which will allow him to keep working in search of progress. Walter will use the funds for vehicle maintenance and repair because it has some urgent work that needs to be done in order to be able to work worry-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loan.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal â€œLas Perlas IIâ€, ubicado en la provincia D. HuancanÃ© y departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 aÃ±os D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijo (01 independiente), la seÃ±ora estudiÃ³ hasta 5to D. primaria.
La seÃ±ora Sabina esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 meses como grupo mientras tanto y ahora como Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para su negocio D. venta D. artefactos electrodomÃ©sticos.
Con este crÃ©dito D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, podrÃ¡ hacer crecer mÃ¡s en su negocio D. venta D. artefactos.
Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es tener casas y una tienda propia.
Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias y las charlas que se dan.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the community bank "The Pearls II". It is located in the province of Huancane, Puno. She is 48 years old, she is married, and she has 5 children (one is independent). She has a graD. 5 education. Sabina has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 8 months, previously as a group member and now as a member of the community bank. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she managed to increase her capital and supplement her hardware store business. With this new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles she will be able to make her business grow. Her dreams for the future incluD. having a home and her own store. She most enjoys the gatherings in her community bank and the talks are given at their meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase hardware products.

loan.name: Gueni

texts.es:
La SeÃ±orita Gueni es socia del Banco Comunal â€œLas Perlas IIâ€, ubicado en la provincia de HuancanÃ© y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 aÃ±os de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos. Gueni estudiÃ³ educaciÃ³n superior pero no lo culminÃ³.
La seÃ±orita Gueni esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses como grupo mientras tanto y ahora como Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que con el primer prÃ©stamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual permitiÃ³ incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de Artefactos electrodomÃ©sticos.
En la actualidad la seÃ±orita solicitarÃ¡ un nuevo crÃ©dito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirÃ¡ incrementar el capital de su negocio y aumentar la mercaderÃ­a del negocio.
Su sueÃ±o para el futuro es tener una micro empresa.
Lo que mÃ¡s le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la organizaciÃ³n de la InstituciÃ³n. Notese en la foto junto a uno de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Gueni is a member of the community bank "The Pearls II". It is located in the province of Huancane, Puno. She is 19 years old, she is single, and she has no children. She started college courses but she never completed her diploma. Gueni has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 8 months, first as a group member and now as part of the community bank. The first loan she requested of 500 nuevos soles allowed her to supplement her business' working capital, selling household products. She requests a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will permit her to supplement her business and increase the merchandise she has in stock. Her dream for the future is to have a small business. What she most likes about the community bank is the orderliness and organization of the institution. (Note: she is pictured here together with her siblings).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase household products.
